Abstract: A capsule wardrobe (CW in short) is a minimal collection of interchangeable clothes from which a lot of diverse and attractive fashion coordination (combinations of clothes) can be obtained. CWs are created for the purpose of strategic brand developments, personal self-expression, and so on. Since a certain level of expertise is required, it is hard for fashion beginners to make CWs. In order to support for the creation of high-quality CWs, a method using an optimization technique has been developed, recently. In the method, fashion images are converted into certain vocabulary through image processing techniques, and a quasi-optimal CW is then derived by submodular optimization with respect to the compatibility and versatility which are calculated based on the LDA(Latent Dirichlet Allocation) topic model. However, the two metrics of compatibility and versatility are not always sufficient to meet the various demands of users. In this study, we extend the optimization function of the existing method by incorporating two factors of visual dissimilarity and number of good coordinates. By this extension, we can expect to realize a more flexible method for high-quality CW creation.

Abstract: Massive parallel computation on GPUs allows promising speedups for high performance computing, especially for CFD. However, simulations with different algorithms on different industry relevant cases may not exhibit the same performance on the same GPU. Using JAXA's FaSTAR CFD solver, accelerated with OpenACC, the performance of two time integration methods, the LU-SGS and the DP-LUR methods, was investigated on two different cases. For a simple case such as the NASA CRM geometry with low angle of attack at cruise flight, the DP-LUR method is 1.37 times faster than the LU-SGS method on GPU. For a more complex case such as the 30P30N geometry with higher angle of attack at takeoff, the method is 1.46 times slower.

Publication Title: 2022 Tenth International Symposium on Computing and Networking Workshops (CANDARW)
Abstract: High-precision time synchronization between hosts connected via networks has become a necessity in recent years. That is used to measure delays between microservices, to reduce service response times, and is also used in IoT such as smart-phones. One of the methods for high-precision time synchronization is The Precision Time Protocol (PTP). PTP is a mainstream protocol that enables high-precision time synchronization, but the Linux implementation of the protocol requires a specific function on hardware or a driver to achieve high precision; thus, it is difficult to deploy to many devices including IoT devices. In this research, we propose a portable time synchronization method using the extended Berkeley Packet Filter (eBPF) for high-precision time synchronization. Our method is freed from specific hardware or driver functions and supports efficient conversion of timestamps used in the kernel-level and protocol-level. We compared the time-synchronization precision of the proposed method with that of the conventional methods, in which timestamps are provided by at hardware of network interface card (NIC) and NIC driver. The proposed method has equivalent precision to that using an NIC driver.
Funding Information: Toyota Motor Corporation;

In response to this environment, the Open Radio Access Network (O-RAN) will be built with next-generation RANs based on Artificial Intelligence (AI) control. As the number of devices increases, more challenges will be faced. Abstract: With the rapid development of the Internet, the text published by various online social media is increasing day by day. To improve the effect of trigger and argument extraction, we propose a joint model based on conditional information fusion layers. In the trigger extraction module, we introduce the type information fusion layer to reduce the difficulty of extracting triggers. In the argument extraction module, we introduce the trigger information fusion layer to make the input of argument extraction carry both event type information and trigger information. Finally, we validate the model in the Chinese large-scale event extraction labeled dataset provided by Baidu. Experiments show that our model's F1-score performance is about 1% higher than common models such as BERT and so on in trigger extraction subtask, and about 3% higher than common methods such as BERT-MRC and so on in argument extraction subtask.

Abstract: A genetic algorithm with memory function (GA_MF) is proposed in this paper to improve the performance of the algorithm by using the historical search information. This would be of great help to the inheritance and development of good genes, and therefore the proposed GA_MF could be expected to achieve good optimization results. Abstract: Aiming at the problem that attribute weight information in the classic TOPSIS algorithm is given by experts and is too subjective due to personal preference, a method for determining attribute weight based on improved score function is proposed, which allows experts to give the importance information of attributes through intuitionistic fuzzy numbers rather than accurate values, and increases the flexibility of decision assignment. The related properties of the improved score function are discussed and compared with other score functions to verify the rationality of the score function. Combined with intuitionistic fuzzy mixed average operator, the evaluation information of each expert is integrated from the perspective of group experts, and the attribute weight is obtained by using the normalization principle to process the score value. An improved TOPSIS method for multi-attribute decision-making is proposed by using the score function to define the attribute importance, and then modifying the closeness function between the evaluation objective and the optimal objective. It is applied to the decision-making of the evaluation scheme of the software reliability growth model. The decision-making results show that the method is feasible and effective, which provides a new solution for determining the attribute weight and making multi-attribute decision-making.

Abstract: Intelligent identification method of indicator number of substation instrument based on deformable convolutional neural network there are many equipment in substation, and the value and scale of oil thermometer, oil level gauge, pressure gauge and other instrument equipment reflect the operation state of most instruments and meters, which is particularly important. Therefore, the research on value reading of instrument equipment in substation is particularly key. At present, for the instrument recognition of substation, most studies use traditional image processing and machine learning methods. However, in the recognition process, due to the influence of uneven illumination, complex background, rotation angle, image blur, shooting angle, proportion change and other factors, the recognition accuracy of pointer instrument is low and its usability is poor. In order to solve the above problems, this paper combines the traditional image processing technology with the deep learning method, and proposes an automatic recognition method of substation pointer instrument based on deformable convolutional neural network. The idea of deformable volume is introduced to enhance the modeling ability of convolutional neural network, so as to improve the accuracy of instrument recognition. The main idea is that firstly, the deformable convolution neural network method is used to detect the instrument image in the image, then the residual neural network is used to extract the key points of the instrument dial and pointer, then the detected key points are used to fit the dial circle and pointer, and finally the readout value is calculated according to the deflection angle of the pointer relative to the scale. The experimental results show that this method is very effective for the identification of pointer instruments, and has high accuracy and practicability, which is conducive to promoting the realization of intelligent operation and maintenance of substation.

Abstract: With the popularity of artificial intelligence applications, deep neural network (DNN) inference workloads are becoming more common in cloud servers. To improve GPU utilization, a GPU executes multiple workloads simultaneously, inevitably leading to resource contention and increasing inference latency. We propose a kernel-based latency prediction method that can more accurately predict the latency in the case of mutual interference between multiple workloads. The method uses the kernel parameters decomposed during the DNN inference to predict the latency of each kernel. It obtains the impact of interference on each model by the amount of data exchanged between the L1 cache, L2 cache, and GPU memory during the execution of each model. We conduct experiments on popular models. The results show that compared with the state-of-the-art multi-model coexistence prediction method, our method reduces the average error by 52% when predicting the latency of a single model and by 62%, 51%, and 58% when predicting the co-location of two, three, and four models.

Abstract: With the increasing proportion of new energy generation installed with power electronics technology as the core, the power system shows the trend of power electronics, which further leads to lower inertia, weaker damping and lower anti-disturbance capability of the grid, which brings hidden danger to the safe and stable operation of the power system under the high proportion of new energy access. In this paper, we propose a grid-based converter control strategy for energy storage systems based on DIgSILENT/PowerFactory software to realize virtual inertia, damping and droop control functions similar to those of synchronous generators. In this paper, a case study is conducted with the application scenario of the grid-based control strategy for energy storage systems in PV power plants to verify the correctness and effectiveness of the above model and strategy.

Document Title: Offline handwritten Chinese character recognition based on improved capsule network
Authors: M. Han; H. Zhang
Author Affiliations: College of Software, Liaoning Technical University, Huludao, China; Computer Department, Shantou Polytechnic, Shantou, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: An improved capsule network model is proposed to solve the problem of difficult feature extraction and low recognition accuracy of handwritten Chinese characters. The advantage of capsule network is to deal with the spatial relationship between feature vectors, while Chinese characters happen to be a spatial structure composed of strokes, radicals and radicals placed in different positions. However, due to the large number of parameters of the capsule network, it is difficult to train large size images and easy to over fit. In view of the shortcomings of capsule network, the following two improvements are proposed: First, the use of PD (Pixel shuffle down sampling) enables the model to train large images without losing pixel information, while reducing image noise. Secondly, the number of primary capsules is reduced by using multi-layer small windows instead of single-layer large windows to extract image features, so as to reduce the number of model parameters. The experimental results show that, with the increase of training picture size and the decrease of capsule network parameters, the recognition accuracy is significantly improved. The accuracy of the improved capsule network for taking 300 Chinese characters from CASIA-HWDB1.1 dataset can reach 95.97%, and the parameter quantity is only 7.95M, which proves the advantages and effectiveness of the improved model.
Author Keywords: handwritten Chinese character recognition;Ca-psnet;parameter reduction;PD;overfitting mitigation
IEEE Terms: Training;Handwriting recognition;Technological innovation;Feature extraction;Character recognition

Abstract: The "14th Five Year Plan" is the construction peak of pumped storage power plants, as well as the critical and window period for carbon peak. Under the current two-part electricity price mechanism, strengthening the investment management and control capability of pumped storage power plants is of great practical significance for improving the capital utilization efficiency of power enterprises, improving the investment quality, and reducing the power consumption cost of end users. A cost benchmarking index system for pumped storage power stations has been established, which covers six indicators, including the investment in the hub project, land acquisition and resettlement costs, independent costs, basic reserve funds, reserve funds for price increase, and loan interest during construction. Benchmarking has been carried out for units with different installed capacities and historical data to verify the scientificity of the method, and five cost control improvement strategies have been formulated.

Document Title: A Neural Network Pruning Method by the Sum of Matrix Similarity Measures
Authors: X. Dong; M. Song; B. Li; Y. Song
Author Affiliations: School of Engineering Science, University of Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, China; School of Information and Communication Engineering, Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications, Beijing, China; School of Public Health, University of Washington, Seattle, WA, USA; School of Emergency Management Science and Engineering, University of Chinese Academy of Sciences, Beijing, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: The development of today's intelligent communication 6G is closely related to deep learning. In semantic communication, images need to be transmitted selectively in combination with image semantic information, but the large-scale parameters of neural networks exacerbate the computational complexity. Parameter pruning is one of the predominant approaches for compressing deep models, which can reduce redundant parameters, reduce communication overhead, and improve the timeliness of information transmission while maintaining the performance of neural networks. Currently, most pruning methods focus on the importance of pruned objects in the overall task. Unlike previous methods, this paper ranks the similarity of the filters in the neural network using the sum of matrix similarity measures based on cosine similarity, removing the most similar and most replaceable filters. We validate the pruning method on CIFAR10 and ImageNet ILSVRC2012 using different network architectures. The results show that the sum of matrix similarity measures has state-of-the-art performance with less model performance loss and better compression.
Funding Information: National Natural Science Foundation of China;
Author Keywords: Image semantic communication;Network pruning;Deep neural network;Filter similarity measure

Document Title: Multi-Input Adaptive Activation Function for Binary Neural Networks
Authors: P. Zhang; S. Takamaeda-Yamazaki
Author Affiliations: The University of Tokyo, Tokyo, Japan; The University of Tokyo, Tokyo, Japan
Publication Title: 2022 Tenth International Symposium on Computing and Networking Workshops (CANDARW)
Abstract: Binary Neural Networks (BNN) have binarized neuron and connection values so that their accelerators can be realized by extremely efficient hardware. However, there is a significant accuracy gap between BNNs and networks with wider bit-width. Conventional BNNs binarize feature maps by static globally-unified thresholds, which makes the produced bipolar image lose local details. This paper proposes a multi-input activation function to enable adaptive thresholding for binarizing feature maps: (a) At the algorithm level, instead of operating each input pixel independently, adaptive thresholding dynamically changes the threshold according to surrounding pixels of the target pixel. When optimizing weights, adaptive thresholding is equivalent to an accompanied depth-wise convolution between normal convolution and binarization. Accompanied weights in the depth-wise filters are also binarized and optimized end-to-end. (b) At the hardware level, adaptive thresholding is realized through a multi-input activation function, which is compatible with common accelerator architectures. Compact activation hardware with only one extra accumulator is devised. By equipping the proposed method on FPGA, 4.1% accuracy improvement is achieved on the original BNN with only 1.1% extra LUT resource. Compared with State-of-the-art methods, the proposed idea further increases network accuracy by 0.8% on the Cifar-10 dataset and 0.4% on the ImageNet dataset.
Author Keywords: Binary Neural Network;Adaptive Thresholding;Algorithm/Hardware Co-Design;Neural Network Accelerator

Document Title: Proposal and Evaluation of a Method for Secure Division Sum Using the Secret Sharing Scheme by Rounding Off Real Numbers
Authors: Y. Noso; K. Iwamura; M. Inamura
Author Affiliations: Graduate School of Engineering, Tokyo University of Science, Tokyo, Japan; Graduate School of Engineering, Tokyo University of Science, Tokyo, Japan; Graduate School of Information Sciences, Hiroshima City University, Hiroshima, Japan
Publication Title: 2022 Tenth International Symposium on Computing and Networking Workshops (CANDARW)
Abstract: Although many secure computations in finite fields are known, few secure computations that can be performed on real numbers have been proposed. Particularly, division of real numbers is difficult for secure computations in a finite field, and there are many inefficient processes (e.g., repeated approximations). In this study, we propose a secure computation method that can directly compute four arithmetic operations, including division, using real numbers. By multiplying the secret information by a random number and rounding off real numbers, the proposed method can evaluate the calculation error in the case of secure computation using real numbers in detail, which has not been done in previous studies. We show that the proposed method has a low error rate and achieves efficient and fast processing, particularly in division.
Author Keywords: Secret Sharing Scheme;Secure Computation;MPC;Real Number;Round Off
IEEE Terms: Error analysis;Conferences;Cryptography;Proposals;Galois fields;Arithmetic

Abstract: With the rapid progress of power electronics and the renewables, the PEDF (photovoltaics, energy storage, direct current and flexibility) microgrid has the latent capacity to realize the self-sufficiency of the power supply of the microgrid in buildings, and is the key technology to alleviate the energy crisis. However, in the process of building heat pump control, the excessive or unreasonable temperature transition strategy. In this paper, from the heat pump regulation process, the building thermal parameter model and temperature rise model, as well as the heat balance equation and bus voltage sag principle are analyzed. Then, the human thermal comfort and thermodynamic constrains are taken into considerations, the temperature smooth transition model based on Chebyshev polynomial is constructed. An AdaDelta optimal method is introduced to optimal the temperature transition trajectory. Finally, the proposed transition strategy is verified by the comparative simulations under the temperature sudden change event, with a 4% less DC bus voltage drop than the conventional transition strategy.

Document Title: Machine Learning-Based Adaptive Fault Detection Method for Wind Turbine Gearboxes with Imbalanced Data through An IIoT Platform
Authors: X. Fu; J. Han; X. Li; K. Cao

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: In the context of Industry 4.0, machine learning algorithms have been commonly used to monitor the health state of wind turbine gearboxes to avoid catastrophic failure and reduce maintenance costs. However, due to the lack of a certain category of data (i.e., healthy or faulty) and the various working conditions of wind turbines, many existing methods may not provide reliable results in practical industrial applications. To solve this problem, we create an industrial internet of things (IIoT) platform, through which a machine learning-based adaptive fault detection method for wind turbine gearboxes is proposed. The features are extracted and adapted to fine-tune the pre-trained model on newly arriving samples from different wind turbines, components, or failure modes. The adaptation performance is evaluated with accuracy, false alarm rate, and fault detection rate. Case studies are then performed using highfrequency vibration signals acquired from two megawatts (MW) onshore wind turbines. The results show that the proposed adaptive method significantly improves the fault detection performance when class distribution is not balanced, and can be easily applied to the fault diagnosis of large numbers of wind turbines. This, integrated with the IIoT platform that alleviates the shortage of computational and storage capacity in wind farms and requires less user involvement, allows for a more effective condition monitoring system.
Author Keywords: industrial internet of things (IIoT);condition monitoring;adaptive fault detection;imbalanced data;wind turbine gearbox

Abstract: Low illuminance image is a kind of common image in dark light condition, usually has high noise, texture loss and other low quality problems. Low illumination image can not be directly used as the input for extracting beneficial information such as feature extraction and image segmentation.The processing of low illumination image usually involves two parts: denoising and enhancement. In the denoising part, this paper firstly preprocesses the L channel of the image, so as to retain more color information in the subsequent processing. Secondly, according to the noise distribution characteristics of low illumination image, the image is denoised by adaptive bilateral filtering. Finally, since the inversion image of the low illumination image called the pseudo fog image is very similar to the fog image. In this paper, the de-fog model based on the image brightness information is used to process the pseudo fog image, and the final low-illumination enhanced image is obtained by reversing the no-fog image. Through experimental simulation, the enhanced image can maintain good texture and color information while de-noising.

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: The main problem of current coal mine operation scene is safety, however, as the site environment is characterized by high noise, multiple exposure, low brightness by working reasons, which makes the traditional coal mine operation scene image segmentation algorithm is difficult to achieve the expected effect. In addition, whether the construction of a single network model is generalizable to the processing of multiple environments in coal mine operation scenes is also a pressing issue. To this end, a multi-level depth network algorithm for image segmentation in coal mine operation scenes is proposed. The algorithm firstly divides the enhancement layer, backbone layer, neck layer, head classification layer and loss layer. Secondly, the algorithm scheduling layer and algorithm interpretation layer are constructed, which groups and concatenates different kinds of models to form a variety of network models. Then, the annotated data is transferred to the network model for training to realize the training of different network models. Finally, the trained multiple models are analyzed and processed to judge the suitability of the models. This method can produce a large number of network models in very short time, which helps to expand beyond the original number of network models in a limited number of network models and increase the generalizability of the models.

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: In order to solve the problem of real-time perception and evaluation of health status of smart distribution station, a health status evaluation method of smart distribution station based on operation trajectory information matrix is proposed. Firstly, the operation trajectory information matrix model of distribution station is established to record the development and change of environmental information and abnormal electrical quantity information in the distribution station for a certain period of time. Then, the development process of equipment state is divided into three stages: health state, sub-health state and disease state. The distribution station operation trajectory logic matrix is proposed, and the logic quantization of the distribution station operation trajectory information matrix is carried out. Finally, the distribution station operation trajectory logic diagram is established. The healthy development process of distribution station is discussed through the change of graphic area and volume. The health status of the distribution station is quantitatively evaluated through the distribution station sub-item health status evaluation matrix and the distribution station comprehensive health status evaluation index. Through the example analysis, it can be seen that the method is simple and fast, the abnormal and defective conditions of the equipment in the distribution station can be found in time, and the safe and economic operation of the distribution network can be ensured.

Abstract: Traditional detection of major elements in food, such as chemical detection, requires REDOX, adsorption and desorption processes, which have problems such as long analysis time and expensive reagents. In order to solve this problem, the combustion products of food can be analyzed. The main elements of food are carbon and nitrogen, and the full combustion product is a mixture of carbon dioxide and nitrogen oxides. In this paper, a method is designed for quantification of mixed gases of carbon dioxide and nitrogen oxides. First, standard gas with a certain concentration gradient is configured, and then it is passed into the mass spectrometer to obtain the corresponding ion signal, and then the cross interference is removed by the way of ion debris deduction. Finally, the internal normalization algorithm is used to realize the quantification of the mixed gas.

Abstract: With the popularity of mobile Internet, Android has become the mobile operating system with the largest market share, Android applications have become a part of people’s life, but the credibility of Android applications is increasingly difficult to guarantee. According to statistics, the number of Android applications in the country has exceeded 3 million, in such a huge scale, some malicious applications mixed in, stealing privacy, threatening, malicious deduction and other untrustworthy behavior has caused great impact on the life of users. Most of the current research on Android malicious applications only focuses on how to detect malicious applications, but not on their behavior. Therefore, in this paper, we will take Android application as the research generalization, generate its sensitive API call graph by extracting the sensitive API and permission call situation of Android application, extract the untrustworthy behavior of Android application by analyzing and studying the API call graph, and finally build a template of untrustworthy behavior statement for Android application. Document Title: FPGA Implementation of Stream Cipher SOSEMANUK
Authors: Y. Shibuya; K. Iwai; T. Matsubara; T. Kurokawa
Author Affiliations: Graduate School of Science and Engineering, National Defense Academy of Japan, Kanagawa, Japan; Department of Computer Science, National Defense Academy of Japan, Kanagawa, Japan; Department of Computer Science, National Defense Academy of Japan, Kanagawa, Japan; Department of Computer Science, National Defense Academy of Japan, Kanagawa, Japan
Publication Title: 2022 Tenth International Symposium on Computing and Networking Workshops (CANDARW)
Abstract: SOSEMANUK is a synchronous stream cipher and is a finalist for Profile 1 of the eSTREAM conducted by ECRYPT. Its key length is variable between 128-bit and 256-bit, and it uses a 128-bit initial vector. SOSEMANUK consists of a block cipher Serpent and a stream cipher SNOW2.0. In Profile 1 of the eSTREAM competition, where SOSEMANUK was selected, stream ciphers were required for software applications with high throughput. Therefore, Profile 1 compared performance by CPUs. However, heterogeneous computing is now being considered, and computational resources other than CPU are increasingly used for acceleration. Furthermore, SOSEMANUK is stated to be suitable not only for software but also for hardware in several papers. Therefore, this paper presents FPGA implementation of SOSEMANUK to achieve higher throughput for the use of acceleration of stream ciphers. In this paper, SOSEMANUK is implemented on an FPGA with the aim of improving throughput performance. In the implementation, the critical path is analyzed and several parts of the circuit are consisted of duplicated fashion to cut the keystream generation cycle to be half. The algorithm is designed in Verilog-HDL using Xilinx Vivado v2020.1 and implemented on a Xilinx Artix-7 XC7A200T-2FBG676C FPGA. As a result, 4.9 Gbps throughput has been achieved at a clock frequency of 99.2 MHz, which has been an improvement in throughput over previous studies.
Author Keywords: FPGA;Implementation of Encryption Circuit;eSTREAM;SOSEMANUK;Stream Cipher
IEEE Terms: Ciphers;Conferences;Throughput;Software;Heterogeneous networks;Hardware;Encryption

Document Title: Optimization of energy consumption with hybrid cooperative NOMA for secure MEC
Authors: X. Fu; X. Yu; S. Wang
Author Affiliations: Nanjing University of Posts and Telecommunications, Nanjing, China; Nanjing University of Posts and Telecommunications, Nanjing, China; Nanjing University of Posts and Telecommunications, Nanjing, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: The widespread use of non-orthogonal multiple access (NOMA) has changed the traditional physical layer security limits on per-user transmission rates, with the attendant increase in complexity and system energy consumption. In view of this, a secure transmission method for mobile edge computing based on NOMA hybrid collaborative interference is proposed. Firstly, a multi-slot hybrid collaboration scheme is designed for each user data processing process for the task offloading problem. The scheme eliminates auxiliary interference signals transferred the offload task to local computing in the specified time slot. Then the scheme optimizes the total energy consumption of the system while ensuring fairness among users. Secondly, a closed expression for the system secrecy outage probability is derived. And the optimization problem is decomposed into three sub-problems. Finally, the block coordinate descent algorithm is used to iterate cyclically. With the objective of minimizing system energy consumption, the best offloading decision scheme for the user is obtained and compared with orthogonal multiple access and full offloading schemes. With reasonable time slots, the simulation results demonstrate the proposed solutions can well weigh the relationship between security and energy consumption. And it can effectively reduce system energy consumption while ensuring information security.
Funding Information: National Natural Science Foundation of China; National Natural Science Foundation of China;
Author Keywords: non-orthogonal multiple access (NOMA);physical layer security;mobile edge computing;outage probability;block coordinate descent

Abstract: The most important part in oilfield exploitation is to carry out oilfield water injection operation to improve the recovery efficiency of the oilfield. To solve the data transmission problem of layered water injection system in oilfield, this paper designs a radio frequency data transmission technology based on water injection system. The system uses the minimum system to realize the data transmission from ground to underground water injection Wells. The underground capture device captures the electronic tag carrying data instructions and extracts and processes the data. Finally, the data is transmitted to different reservoir water distributors through the downhole reader and the water distributors are scheduled to realize intelligent water injection. In the era of big data, prediction models based on deep learning show superior performance in the field of air quality prediction. Document Title: Simulation study of airflow-coal dust migration and diffusion law at entrance section of railway tunnel
Authors: J. Wu; Z. Sa; S. Lu; J. Liu; H. Wang; H. Yang
Author Affiliations: School of Mechanical & Automotive Engineering, Qingdao University of Technology, Qingdao, China; School of Mechanical & Automotive Engineering, Qingdao University of Technology, Qingdao, China; School of Mechanical & Automotive Engineering, Qingdao University of Technology, Qingdao, China; School of Mechanical & Automotive Engineering, Qingdao University of Technology, Qingdao, China; School of Mechanical & Automotive Engineering, Qingdao University of Technology, Qingdao, China; School of Mechanical & Automotive Engineering, Qingdao University of Technology, Qingdao, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: In order to study the law of airflow migration and coal dust diffusion in the entrance section of railway tunnel, taking a railway tunnel as the research object, using Fluent software and based on dynamic mesh technology, the law of airflow field migration in the entrance section of tunnel is explored during the train entering the tunnel. The diffusion state of clouds with different coal dust particle sizes is analyzed, and the idea of dust suppression and the direction to be explored are put forward. The results show that the shape of the airflow at the entrance of the tunnel changes in a 'trumpet' shape. The influence range of the airflow on the X-Z and X-Y sections conforms to different forms of migration laws. The influence range of the vortex at the entrance of the tunnel is positively correlated with the position of the train. With the increase of coal dust particle size, the concentration area of coal dust cloud is closer to the ground. The closer the coal dust cloud is to the ground, the lower the coal dust concentration is. The research results are helpful to understand the law of airflow-coal dust migration and diffusion in the tunnel entrance section, and have guiding significance in reducing coal loss, inhibiting coal dust diffusion and protecting the life and health of railway workers.

Abstract: A lightweight multi-task sequence model is proposed to accommodate real-time computation on embedded devices. Based on the practical problems and policy directions faced by Yunnan thermal power, this paper demonstrates the necessity and adaptability of establishing capacity compensation mechanism in Yunnan from many aspects. A capacity compensation mechanism adapted to the actual situation in Yunnan is designed, and the compensation capacity measurement method, cost measurement method, capacity electricity price verification scheme, capacity electricity price adjustment mechanism and capacity cost capital source are studied, and the impact of capacity compensation mechanism on thermal power operation is analyzed through simulation calculation. Abstract: Pulmonary infection is often one of the serious complications after renal transplantation. In serious cases, it could even endanger the survival of patients. Therefore, infection risk prediction has always been a highly-concerned research topic before and after transplantation operation. Aiming to explore an efficient risk prediction of pulmonary infection, this paper proposes a data-driven scheme to mine a group of optimal risk factor combination. Firstly, it pre-processes and cleans clinical patient data. After that, it reduces sample dimension and computes the comprehensive influence degrees of patient cases by Primary Component Analysis (PCA). Then, a Gray Relation Analysis (GRA) approach is adopted to generate the correlation degree to pulmonary infection happening or not. Finally, a fully-connected neural network (FCNN) with multi-layer structure is designed to determine optimal risk factors, via searching the highest infection prediction accuracy in given patient samples. The experiments with performance comparisons verify that our risk factor mining method is effective, obviously outperforming the other ones having been compared on given clinic patent cases.

A data mining technology, namely a convolution-gating cyclic network, is introduced to mine the characteristics of the operation situation of the distribution network. Combined with the principles of compatibility and logicality, the operation situation awareness index of the distribution network is selected. The weight value of the index is calculated by using the analytic hierarchy process. The grey prediction principle is integrated. Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: In order to clarify the production characteristics and seepage mechanism of Shenmu gas field during multi-layer combined production, a physical simulation experiment with fixed nozzle opening for double-layer combined production was designed and made by combining different cores in parallel to study the effects of reservoir physical properties, reserves, working system, etc. on the seepage characteristics of double-layer combined production of gas reservoirs. The experimental research shows that when the production system changes, there is a phenomenon of back irrigation; In multi-layer combined production, the flow of each layer is mainly affected by permeability in the early and middle stages of production, while the flow of each layer in the late stage of production is jointly affected by permeability and reserves; Low production allocation in strongly heterogeneous reservoirs is conducive to enhancing oil recovery, while high production allocation in homogeneous reservoirs is conducive to enhancing oil recovery.

All these achievements are easy to achieve in the scene of the abundant corpus, however, there are difficulties in corpus collection for 95% languages in today's world and it is difficult to get good results when facing corpus shortage yet. We propose a meta-learning approach to solve the difficulties in low-resource scenarios by learning knowledge from other languages (with a large dataset of high quality). Our model can share information between languages,makes the model trained on a small corpus a good model using the knowledge from other languages. The speech synthesized with our model sounds more natural and achieve a higher level on quality. The resultant speech is close to human’s speech in terms of fluency. We add a parameter generator to the basic end-to-end speech system and our model has smaller parameters than the multilingual model with separate parameters for each language. Abstract: Text instances in scene text images often present characteristics of complex background, arbitrary shape, varying orientation and light conditions, etc. Therefore, scene text detection has been a challenging research direction in recent years. In order to improve the performance of scene text detection algorithms, in particular on irregular-shape text instances, we propose the feature guided adaptive network (FGANet for short) for scene text detection, which jointly utilizes feature filtering and adaptive fusion mechanisms to strengthen text detection performance. In specific, FGANet designs a module that is able to filter out the channels of low efficacy from the feature maps extracted from the backbones; it devises another module that adaptively fuses the shallow features with visual details and deep features having more semantic meanings to enhance the perception ability on texts. Experiments on several benchmark scene text datasets show that FGANet achieves significantly better scene text detection performance.

Abstract: Distributed Video Coding (DVC) is an encoding mode that uses decoder-side information to reduce encoder complexity. Based on the transformation domain Wyner-Ziv (TDWZ) coding, block matching and optical flow method are used to generate initial side information frames, and a WZ reconstruction algorithm based on side information improvement and a method to improve the accuracy of correlated noise modeling are proposed by gradually updating the noise residual coefficient. Experimental results show that for WZ frames with GOP size 2, the proposed scheme can significantly improve the coding efficiency compared with TDWZ and DISCOVER while reducing the complexity of the decoding end. Therefore, a medical warning and automatic call for help model based on vital signs were constructed. Abstract: In order to solve the problem that the signal to noise ratio(SNR) is too low when the weak communication signal is used as the external radiation source to detect the target, this paper intends to use the coherent synthesis of multi-carrier frequency signals to improve the detection SNR. Firstly, the moving target detection (MTD) algorithm in radar signal processing is introduced, and a single communication signal with very low SNR is coherently accumulated for a long time, and the signal form is transformed into a simple Sinc function. Therefore, it is not necessary to consider the different modulation modes, different signal codes, phase changes and other information between multiple signals, and only need to complete the phase compensation at the peak point in the two-dimensional processing results to obtain the coherent processing gain of multiple signals with different SNR and different carrier frequencies. The statistical results of simulation data show that the calculation accuracy of coherent synthesis gain of signals with different SNR can reach 0.1dB. Field experiment results prove the feasibility and accuracy of the proposed algorithm.

Abstract: The transmission line’s ability to operate safely will be substantially compromised by the presence of the nest of birds atop the tower of either a transmission line. This research suggests a technique for detecting bird nests on transmission system towers through YOLOv5. The method consists of input, backbone, neck, and prediction. By introducing pre-training weights and various data enhancement methods, After multiple network training sessions, it is feasible to find and recognize the bird’s nest on the power system’ tower. The outcomes reveal that the YOLOv5 model’s mean average precision (mAP) of the bird’s nest on the top of power tower can reach 85.6%, and the model is only 14.4 MB in size. This work suggested a YOLOv5-based method for determining bird nests on transmission line towers that can meet the demands of high precision and low volume while also showing promise for future development.

Document Title: Voice control system for intelligent mine control platform
Authors: K. Yang
Author Affiliations: Beijing Engineering and Research Center of Mine Safe, Beijing, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: In order to reduce the operation difficulty and complexity of the operators of the intelligent mine management and control platform, a set of voice control system for the intelligent mine management and control platform is designed. The system includes voice acquisition module, voice transmission module, voice feature extraction and recognition module and command control module. First, voice signals are collected through the microphone provided by the client; Then, the voice signal is transmitted to the speech feature extraction and recognition module through HTTP protocol; After receiving the speech signal, the speech feature extraction module extracts the Fbank feature of the speech signal, and transfers the Fbank feature to the speech recognition module; After receiving Fbank features, the speech recognition module realizes the conversion of speech to text through the end-to-end model based on attention mechanism, and transmits the text information to the command control module; After receiving the text information, the command control module generates the text label through the filter module, and triggers the jump operation of the subsystem corresponding to the text label through the execution module; Through the above operations, the voice control system can realize the intelligent control of the intelligent mine management and control platform. The experiment shows that the system realizes the intelligent control of the intelligent mine management and control platform based on voice by combining the characteristics of speech recognition control technology and HTML tags. Through several groups of experiments, it shows that the voice control system proposed in this paper has a good effect, and the correct implementation rate can reach more than 95%, meeting the intelligent control needs of the intelligent mine management and control platform.

Document Title: M2M-SCM: A Spatial Channel Model for Mobile-to-Mobile Communications in the VHF and UHF Band
Authors: J. Fischer; G. Ulbricht; R. Koch
Author Affiliations: Fraunhofer Institute for Integrated Circuits IIS, Erlangen, Germany; Fraunhofer Institute for Integrated Circuits IIS, Erlangen, Germany; Fraunhofer Institute for Integrated Circuits IIS, Erlangen, Germany
Publication Title: 2022 Tenth International Symposium on Computing and Networking Workshops (CANDARW)
Abstract: Vehicular networks and Mobile Ad-Hoc Networks (MANET) are fundamental emerging technologies, leaving the scope of purely academic research. This raises the need for realistic channel models to evaluate new systems and standards under development. In this paper, we present a spatial channel model for mobile-to-mobile communications in the VHF and UHF band. Here, scatterers are randomly distributed on ellipses in such a way that the statistical properties of the propagation environment are matching those determined by extensive real-world channel measurements. Gradual fading of the multipath components avoids unwanted artifacts caused by the updating of the scatterers and a dynamic K-factor incorporates the influence of the distance between transmitter and receiver on the power delay profile of the channel. Through this, the novel model tackles shortcomings of previous models and provides a more realistic representation of the mobile-to-mobile channel.

Abstract: We consider covert communication in a network with multiple non-orthogonal multiple access (NOMA) systems, where each NOMA system consists of an Alice, a user with the reliability requirement (URR), a user with the covertness requirement (UCR), and a Willie. We first provide theoretical analysis for both covert rate and reliable rate, and then formulate the sum-rate maximization in the network as a non-convex optimization problem. To solve the highly complex optimization problem, we then resort to the reinforcement learning (RL) technique and develop a distributed stateless Q-learning algorithm to identify the optimal covert power allocation for sum-rate maximization. Document Title: Hook Point Estimation for System Call Detection by Virtual Machine Monitor
Authors: M. Sato; T. Omori; T. Yamauchi; H. Taniguchi
Author Affiliations: Faculty of Computer Science and Systems Engineering; Graduate School of Computer Science and Systems Engineering, Okayama Prefectural University, Soja, Okayama, Japan; Faculty of Natural Science and Technology, Okayama University, Okayama, Japan; Faculty of Natural Science and Technology, Okayama University, Okayama, Japan
Publication Title: 2022 Tenth International Symposium on Computing and Networking Workshops (CANDARW)
Abstract: Virtual machine monitors (VMMs) are used to monitor the behavior of virtual machine (VM) programs. System call detection is frequently used to monitor behavior. To monitor the system calls, the VMM inserts a breakpoint, called a hook point, into the memory of the monitored VM. Researchers have determined hook points based on experimental knowledge or reading the source code of operating systems (OSes). However, reading the source codes of OS requires specialized knowledge. In addition, the appropriate hook point differs among OS versions. Therefore, analyzing the source code in each OS update is impractical. We propose a method for estimating the hook point using a memory analysis technique. The proposed method acquires the memory of the monitored VM and then searches for an appropriate instruction appropriate to hook. The search instructions depend on the processor architecture. Therefore, the proposed method does not require knowledge of OS versions or reading the source code of OSes. The experimental results showed that the proposed method precisely estimates the hook point. In addition, the overhead of the proposed method is small, considering the boot time of the monitored VM.
Author Keywords: system call;virtual machine monitor;operating system
IEEE Terms: Performance evaluation;Virtual machine monitors;Codes;Source coding;Operating systems;Linux;Computer architecture

The data of new investment amount and related new investment demand influencing factors are used as training set. The parameters of the least squares support vector machine (LSSVM) were optimized by using an improved bat algorithm (IBA) and a grid investment demand forecasting model with investment interface extension is constructed. Abstract: China has traditionally been the world’s largest cotton producer, cotton importer and cotton consumer. The transportation of cotton from the processing plant to the warehouse is usually completed by manually operated handling equipment. Labor volume of cotton bale handling is large and the working environment is bad. In order to enhance the efficiency of the bale handling robot, a grey wolf optimization algorithm based on Chebyshev mapping and dynamic weight is proposed. First of all, for the problem of substantial randomness and extreme instability of the initial population of Gray Wolf algorithm, Chebyshev map is used to initialize the population. Using the monotonic increasing characteristic of tangent function interval to improve the convergence factor, the convergence speed in the initial stage of the algorithm needs to be improved. The improved weight strategy is adopted to join the non elite wolf to lead the population optimization, which improves the convergence rate of the algorithm and the performance of jumping out of local optimization. The experimental results show that the improved algorithm significantly improves the optimization performance, has a faster convergence speed and higher optimization accuracy. In the simulation of discrete complex obstacle scenes, the minimum and average distance of the algorithm is better than the comparison algorithm.

Document Title: Dynamic Community Detection Based on Similarity of Social Network Nodes
Authors: J. Jia; L. Li
Author Affiliations: School of Computer Science and Engineering, Northwest Normal University, Lanzhou, China; School of Computer Science and Engineering, Northwest Normal University, Lanzhou, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: As an important tool for analyzing the structure and composition of social networks， predicting nodes connections and the evolution process, community detection is widely used in recommendation systems, public opinion detection and other fields. Most traditional dynamic community detection algorithms rely too much on the previous community structure, ignoring the dynamic characteristics of node structure and attributes changing with time in the network, resulting in poor dynamic community detection results. Therefore, this paper proposes a dynamic community detection algorithm based on the similarity of social network nodes (DCDSN). The algorithm calculates the static similarity between nodes through structural and attribute similarity according to the three influence factors of direct influence, common neighbor and exclusive neighbor. The algorithm uses the influence of historical network information on current network information to obtain the dynamic similarity between nodes, establishes a weighted dynamic social network, then uses Louvain algorithm to achieve dynamic community detection. Experiments show that DCDSN algorithm has higher community detection quality than other community detection algorithms on Enron dataset.

Abstract: Although CFD has been widely used over the years, it has rarely been used to study the heat flow behavior of air in a climate simulation aging chamber. In addition, this paper explores the influence of different wind speed and different inlet and outlet on the heat field distribution in the aging chamber. The results show that the simulation has the best results when the wind speed is up to 1.25 m/s, and the air in the aging chamber has the best temperature uniformity and stability. However, a well-established pricing strategy that quantifies the ES’s cost is critical but lacks research. Abstract: detecting aircraft targets from visual images is the key of obtaining an effective battlefield situation assessment. In order to improve the target detection accuracy, this study puts forward an attentional YOLOv4 model featured by an innovative area attention mechanism (AAM) embedded in its convolutional layers. The proposed area attention mechanism makes YOLOv4 is able to intelligently strengthen the weights of features extracted from important areas of the images, which effectively tackles the problem that common convolutional layers can only process the features got from different areas of the image in the same way. Experimental results based on large numbers of visual images indicate that our attentional YOLOv4 model effectively enhances the power of the model's feature extraction ability and feature fusion ability, and reaches 89.4%, 85.3% and 86.1% in terms of precision, recall and mAP@0.5.

The multi-aperture deployable antenna is composed of a pointing mechanism, a deployment arm, an integrated back frame, several unlocking and releasing mechanisms, some reflectors, and back-mounted reflector pointing mechanisms. The integrated back frame is connected with reflectors and the deployment arm, and the pointing mechanism is at the root of the arm. Through the integrated back frame structure, the coverage areas between multiple beams can be achieved without overlapping; by rotating the antenna pointing mechanism, the entire beam can be rotated and covered globally; rotating the pointing mechanism behind the reflector can achieve the specific beam pointing changes. Therefore, some researchers are focusing on generating images with large unrestricted corruption. However, existing unrestricted images are noticeable, arousing human suspicion. Among them, the attack that modifies the color of images may generate images with better image quality. Author Affiliations: State Grid Anhui Electric Power Co., Ltd., Hefei, China; State Grid Anhui Electric Power Co., Ltd., Hefei, China; State Grid Anhui Electric Power Co., Ltd., Hefei, China; State Grid Anhui Electric Power Co., Ltd., Hefei, China; School of Electrical and Automation Engineering, Hefei University of Technology, Hefei, China; School of Electrical and Automation Engineering, Hefei University of Technology, Hefei, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: The construction mode of modular substation constructions combined with industrialization is the development trend of the new intelligent construction mode. However, the industrialized construction mode of modular substations still lacks a complete set of implementation plans, and the specific concept is not clear. Therefore, this paper explores and practices the smart construction of substations in terms of modular design, integrated installation, and industrialized production, and studies key technologies such as prefabricated cabin structure design, optical cable alignment channels, and standard interface design. Finally, combined with the effectiveness of the pilot prefabricated cabin substation construction of National Anhui Electric Power Co., Ltd, it proves that the modular cabin substation has practicality and promotion value. This paper is beneficial to guide the development of modular substations.
Funding Information: Natural Science Foundation of Anhui Province;
Author Keywords: intelligent substation;modularization;standardization;industrialization;prefabricated module
IEEE Terms: Integrated optics;Technological innovation;Substations;Optical design;Production;Market research;Standards

Document Title: Design of real-time ECG monitoring wearable equipment based on the Holter system
Authors: W. Liu; C. Li; J. Zhang
Author Affiliations: Guangzhou University, School of Design, South China University of Technology, Panyu District, Guangzhou City, China; Electrocardiogram Department, Affiliated Hospital of Jining Medical University, Jining City, China; Guangzhou University, School of Design, South China University of Technology, Panyu District, Guangzhou City, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: The COVID-19 epidemic has largely restricted the traditional offline medical treatment model. In this study, we designed ECG monitoring smart clothing based on the Holter system after identifying and analyzing the needs of patients and doctors. This clothing is a wearable device that integrates monitoring and remote diagnosis, building a general network platform to realize remote data transfer sharing and online interactive auxiliary diagnosis. Wearable clothing that can monitor ECG in real time is designed and developed by intelligently integrating limb lead wires, conductive fiber fabrics, lead interfaces, and electrode signal storage receivers by using the human body sensing conduction principle of real-time ECG monitoring. Wearable real-time ECG monitoring clothing can help patients achieve fast virtual medical care and auxiliary diagnosis, and solve the design issues with electrode signal storage receivers.
Author Keywords: wearable equipment;Holter system;ECG monitoring
IEEE Terms: Electrodes;Clothing;Wires;Medical treatment;Receivers;Electrocardiography;Lead

Document Title: A Star Identification Algorithm based on Radial Basis Neural Network
Authors: B. Chen; S. Qin; D. Dai
Author Affiliations: National University of Defense Technology, Changsha, China; National University of Defense Technology, Changsha, China; National University of Defense Technology, Changsha, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: This paper uses a radial basis function (RBF) neural network for star identification. A feature vector consisting of distance and angle cosine values is constructed as a library of recognition feature stars and input to the neural network. Then, the network’s output is the number of the corresponding primary star. Comparing the training efficiency and robustness of the grid algorithm with the BP neural network and radial basis function neural network for star identification, the experimental results show that the radial basis function neural network has a strong anti-interference ability against noise and pseudo-star interference. The following conclusions are drawn from the simulation tests: the sample recognition rate of radial basis function neural network algorithm can reach 96% for star position and star addition noise; when the proportion of pseudo-star reaches 20%, the sample recognition rate of radial basis function neural network algorithm is still higher than grid algorithm and BP neural network, which indicates that the radial basis function neural network algorithm has the solid anti-interference ability to both noise and pseudo-star. Therefore, the radial basis function neural network algorithm based on star Identification has specific application prospects.
Author Keywords: star identification;grid algorithm;BP network;RBF network
IEEE Terms: Training;Technological innovation;Solid modeling;Stars;Radial basis function networks;Interference;Solids

Authors: K. Wang; Z. Wang; Y. Yang; X. Li; W. Yang; C. Wang; X. Wang
Author Affiliations: China Railway Engineering Equipment Group Tunnel Equipment Manufacturing Co., Ltd., Xinxiang, China; China Railway Engineering Equipment Group Tunnel Equipment Manufacturing Co., Ltd., Xinxiang, China; Dalian E-Link Information Technology Co., Ltd., Dalian, China; Dalian Jiaotong University and Rolling Stock Engineering, Dalian, China; Dalian Jiaotong University and Electrical Engineering, Dalian, China; Dalian Jiaotong University and Mechanical Engineering, Dalian, China; Dalian Jiaotong University and Mechanical Engineering, Dalian, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Due to the influence of the tunnel environment, the tunnel horizontal vehicle may encounter obstacles in the course of operation, which may cause hidden dangers to the safety of the vehicle, in this environment, it is necessary to design an algorithm for obstacle detection to avoid the occurrence of security accidents. In this algorithm, the potential obstacles in front and around are sensed by MMW radar, and at the same time, the image of obstacle point cloud is imaged to obtain the morphological perception information, filter and identify potential obstacles around the turn, and then data visualization the warning display on all the corners. The experimental results show that the proposed method can quickly and effectively sense the obstacles in front and around, and further improve the recognition ability of the safety assistant system of the tunnel horizontal transport vehicle to the obstacles in front, so that the next step to make adjustments and optimization of the trajectory.

Document Title: Research on pricing model of electricity retail package in spot market
Authors: B. Sui; H. Wu; M. Wang; J. Zhu; H. Yin; Y. Ma; T. Li
Author Affiliations: Henan Electric Power Trading Center Co., Ltd, Zhengzhou, China; Henan Electric Power Trading Center Co., Ltd, Zhengzhou, China; Henan Electric Power Trading Center Co., Ltd, Zhengzhou, China; Henan Electric Power Trading Center Co., Ltd, Zhengzhou, China; Henan Electric Power Trading Center Co., Ltd, Zhengzhou, China; Henan Electric Power Trading Center Co., Ltd, Zhengzhou, China; North China Electric Power University, Beijing, Beijing, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: With the continuous development and improvement of the spot market, a large number of electricity sales companies are registered and set up, and they begin to participate in the purchase and sale of electricity as intermediaries between wholesale market and retail market. Then, the electricity prices in the spot market and the real-time market are connected and coupled with the sales prices in the retail market. In this paper, in order to work out the package price level suitable for users' utility and satisfying the company’s profit, a set of ideas of package optimization electricity price is established: combining with the analysis of electricity purchase cost of electricity sales companies in the spot market, the user selection model of electricity retail package based on utility maximization is established, and then the optimized pricing model of electricity retail package is further established based on the risk profit of electricity sales.

Document Title: Quantitative prediction of median particle size of conventional logged sandstone based on machine learning algorithm
Authors: Z. Zhang
Author Affiliations: College of Geosciences, Northeastern Petroleum University
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: The average rock size is the main identification basis for identifying sedimentary phases, and is an extremely important parameter for reservoir evaluation. However, there is no petrophysical method in the logging data that can directly evaluate the average rock size, and previous work has been done to calculate the average rock size (Md) based on linear and statistical analysis methods using natural gamma logging data for medium to high permeability sandstone reservoirs. However, for low-permeability sandstone reservoirs, the error of the fitted average rock size using linear multiple regression methods is too large for the application of the calculated results. Therefore, the calculation of the median particle size for low-permeability sandstone reservoirs is a difficult problem that needs to be solved. In this paper, for low-permeability sandstone reservoirs, we combine the characteristics of logging data with the learning characteristics of nonlinear mapping of BP neural networks, and select the corresponding loss and activation functions to ensure that overfitting occurs. Using the preferred sensitivity logging parameters, the average rock size is modeled and neighboring wells are predicted by shallow and deep neural networks, and the relative errors of modeling are 7.09% and 0.58%, and the relative errors of prediction are 14.44% and 8.53%, respectively. Its quantitative prediction relative error meets the application requirements. The method takes into account the nonlinear mapping relationship between logging data and the fitting problem of small sample data, and provides a systematic way of thinking for predicting rock size of low-permeability sandstone from logging curves.
Author Keywords: low-permeability sandstone;average rock size;conventional logging;BP algorithm;deep neural network
IEEE Terms: Deep learning;Sensitivity;Systematics;Neural networks;Fitting;Predictive models;Rocks

Abstract: To enhance the security of an authentication method, we proposed weaving the user's heart rate into a spatiotemporal authentication method. Currently, the method requires users to perform predetermined actions repeatedly at predetermined areas. We proposed using the heart rate as a substitute for predetermined actions at the areas. Our method avoids privacy concerns related to biometrics based authentication.

Document Title: Heat and mass transfer simulation of high temperature syngas cooled by water film and spray in quench chamber
Authors: J. Xing; Q. Zhou; X. Li; Z. Li; J. Liang; J. Ding; C. Jiang; W. Zhang
Author Affiliations: Changzheng Engineering Co., Limited, Beijing, China; Changzheng Engineering Co., Limited, Beijing, China; Changzheng Engineering Co., Limited, Beijing, China; Changzheng Engineering Co., Limited, Beijing, China; Changzheng Engineering Co., Limited, Beijing, China; Changzheng Engineering Co., Limited, Beijing, China; Changzheng Engineering Co., Limited, Beijing, China; Changzheng Engineering Co., Limited, Beijing, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Aiming at the cooling process of high-temperature syngas in the downcomer of the quench chamber, a numerical simulation method suitable for simulating the water film and spray co-cooling of the high-pressure thermal downcomer was verified. And the conditions with different proportions of water film and spray water are simulated and analyzed with this method. The reasonable proportion of water film and spray water in the high-pressure downcomer is obtained, which provides a reference for the industrial design of quench chamber washing and cooling. The research shows that, with a certain amount of cooling water, at the same water film thickness, the larger the spray water volume, the lower the average temperature of syngas at the outlet of downcomer, but the trend of water film thinning is intensified. Considering the nature of engineering safety, it is necessary to protect the downcomer from being ablated by high temperature syngas, and also ensure that the syngas can be cooled to a reasonable range. In the high-temperature and high-pressure downcomer cooled by water film and spray, the optimal proportion of water film and spray water is 7:3.
Author Keywords: Quench chamber;Water film and spray co-cooling;Multiphase flow

Document Title: A Comprehensive Model for Analysing Correlation and Traceability of Alarm Data from Power Stations by Coupling DBSCAN and SOM Algorithms
Authors: G. Wang; H. Li; S. Su; Y. Wang
Author Affiliations: Qinghai Electric Power Dispatching Control Center, China; State Grid Qinghai Information and Communication Company, China; Qinghai Electric Power Dispatching Control Center, China; State Grid Qinghai Information and Communication Company, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: The monitoring system in power stations plays an important role in ensuring security of the power plant. However, there are problems nowadays such as complex alarm data structure, insufficient data correlation among multiple power stations, and difficulties to detect internal insecure operations, hence threatening the security and stability of the power monitoring system. A multi-power station alarm data correlation traceability analysis model that integrates density clustering and SOM algorithm is proposed, which quantifies the multi-dimensional characteristics of the raw alarm data. Based on the density clustering algorithm of DBSCAN (Density-Based Spatial Clustering of Applications with Noise), results of spatial correlation analysis conducted can be clearly detected geographically. Meanwhile, the SOM (Self-organizing Maps) algorithm is used to perform secondary extraction of features in the filtered data. It improves the feature display of the attack chain, and realizes the correlation traceability of multi-power station data by mining internal aggressive behavior and its characteristics. Experimental results on the real alarm data set show that the model can efficiently capture several pieces of correlation data of the target alarm data between multiple power stations, covering the time and space dimensions, and displaying the correlation traceability results in the form of attack link graphs. The methods of analysis and network boundary detection have been effectively supplemented, which can greatly escalate the ability of the power monitoring system to analyze and process massive alarm data, and reveal the propagation path of attack behavior among multiple power stations. Eventually, this strategy ensures the security and the stability of the power monitoring system.
Funding Information: National Natural Science Foundation of China;
Author Keywords: density clustering;self-organizing network;alarm data;attack source tracing;log analysis
IEEE Terms: Self-organizing feature maps;Correlation;Clustering algorithms;Power system stability;Data models;Stability analysis;Security

Document Title: Method for detecting pollution degree of insulator based on Locality Preserving Projections Extreme Learning Machine
Authors: X. Liu; Y. Liu; L. Yang; Y. Fan; Y. Guo
Author Affiliations: State Grid Sichuan Electric Power Research Institute, Chengdu, China; State Grid Sichuan Electric Power Research Institute, Chengdu, China; State Grid Sichuan Electric Power Research Institute, Chengdu, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Southwest Jiaotong University, Chengdu, China; Department of Electrical Engineering, Southwest Jiaotong University, Chengdu, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: The Composite insulator is subjected to environmental influences, its surface can accumulate pollution, which can lead to an increase in flashover accidents. For the measurement of insulator surface pollution, the traditional detection methods have a certain degree of defects. In this paper, we use hyperspectral technology to detect the surface pollution of insulators from the perspective of high accuracy and non-contact. In this paper, firstly, artificially polluted insulator samples are produced, and then the data obtained by hyperspectral technology are subjected to black-and-white correction, standard normal variable distribution (SNV), and Savitzky-Golay convolution (SG) algorithms to reduce the interference of noise in the images and dark inrush current on the hyperspectral imaging results. Finally, we use locality preserving projections extreme learning machine (LPP-ELM) to achieve the classification of insulators with different degrees of pollution with an accuracy of 98.33%.
Author Keywords: Hyperspectral technology;insulator;locality preserving projections;extreme learning machine;pollution degree
IEEE Terms: Technological innovation;Pollution;Extreme learning machines;Convolution;Surface contamination;Insulators;Classification algorithms

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Early diagnosis of retinopathy is important for its effective treatment. Adaptive optics scanning laser ophthalmoscopy is a promising cellular-level imaging technique for detecting retinopathy at an early stage. We propose an automated ensemble method for merging identification results of retinal photoreceptors on ophthalmoscope images. The different identification results and corresponding ground truth are generated by simulation, and the identification results are merged to increase the accuracy of retinal photoreceptor identification. The effectiveness of our ensemble method is demonstrated by comparing the generated and ensemble retinal photoreceptor identification results with the ground truths in terms of precision, recall, and F1-score, which shows the proposed method can improve retinal photoreceptor identification.

Document Title: Apple size classification method based on image recognition
Authors: Q. Zhang; H. Cao
Author Affiliations: School of Mechanical Engineering, Anhui Science and Technology Universitye, FengYang, China; School of Mechanical Engineering, Anhui University of Science and Technology, FengYang, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Objective-To solve the problem that the market apple sorting equipment is less intelligent and the accuracy and stability of grading are not high. We propose an apple grading method based on image recognition technology. This method can not only reduce the mechanical damage to apples during grading but also improve the speed and stability of apple grading. This paper aims to perform fast apple grading by using apple images as the research object. Methods-Firstly, we use image preprocessing to get the image grayscale map and binary map, then we use Laplacian to extract the apple edge image to get the apple image center, then we construct a linear fitting formula to fit the apple contour pixel diameter to get the apple true straight to achieve the goal of apple grading. Finally, the apple grading comparison experiment was done with the minimum outer rectangle method. Results-The experimental results showed that the accuracy of the minimum external circle method reached 95% when 40 Dangshan Fuji appleswere used for random testing, while the accuracy of the minimum external rectangle method was only 82.5%. Conclusion-The method can not only reduce the mechanical damage to apples during grading but also improve the grading speed and stability of apples, which is suitable for grading in small orchards.
Author Keywords: Keywords-Apple;Image recognition;classification
IEEE Terms: Visualization;Technological innovation;Laplace equations;Image edge detection;Manuals;Human factors;Gray-scale
