Document Title: An Abstractive Text Summarization Method Based on Improved ConvS2S
Authors: Y. Zhao; J. Wang; Y. Peng; X. Zhang
Author Affiliations: School of Cyber Sciense and Engineering, Zhengzhou University, Zhengzhou, China; School of Computer and Artificial Intelligence, Zhengzhou University, Zhengzhou, China; School of Cyber Sciense and Engineering, Zhengzhou University, Zhengzhou, China; School of Cyber Sciense and Engineering, Zhengzhou University, Zhengzhou, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: In the abstractive text summary model, because of the asymmetry between the input document and the output summary, and because the models of the summary generate by stages according to the time step, the neural network often generates words that are not related to the original document or even do not exist in the vocabulary when generating a summary. To solve this problem, ConvS2S model uses a combination of convolutional coding and multi-head attention mechanism, it solves this problem by parallel computing at different locations of the document to obtain multiple features, and then generating the full summary in parallel. In order to better solve this problem, we introduced the improved pointer network into the ConvS2S model, and improved the ROUGE score on LCSTS dataset and Gigaword dataset, especially on ROUGE-1 boost with 1.4 and 1.3 respectively, which reflects the effectiveness of our model.
Author Keywords: Keywords-Abstractive-summarization;ConvS2S;OOV;deep-learning

Document Title: Finite Element Analysis of Mount Pile Hole Drilling Rig Support
Authors: R. Fan; Q. He; Y. Gao; H. -Y. -Q. Li; J. Dong; J. Lyu
Author Affiliations: State Grid Sichuan Electric Power Company, Chengdu, China; State Grid Sichuan Electric Power Company Dazhou Power Supply Company, Chengdu, China; School of Mechanical Engineering, Sichuan University, Chengdu, China; School of Mechanical Engineering, Sichuan University, Chengdu, China; School of Mechanical Engineering, Sichuan University, Chengdu, China; State Grid Tianfu Electric Power Supply Company, Chengdu, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: The mountain drilling rig is a kind of engineering equipment suitable for pile hole construction in plateau, mountain, hilly and other terrain. Due to the very limited transportation road conditions in mountainous areas, construction equipment is basically transported by people. Therefore, it is necessary to study a modular portable drilling rig. In this paper, the three-dimensional solid model of mountain pile hole drilling rig support is established by using SolidWorks software. The finite element analysis of drilling rig support under two working conditions is carried out by using Ansys workbench software, including static analysis, modal analysis, frequency response analysis and response spectrum seismic analysis. The strength and stiffness of drilling rig support are checked to find out its weak links, and verify the safety of the rig support. The analysis shows that in the actual drilling process of the drilling rig, the maximum stress of the drilling rig support under both working conditions appears on the mast support seat connecting the mast and underframe, the maximum deformation occurs at the top of the mast, the strength and stiffness of the drilling rig support meet the needs, and the rotation of the motor and the impact generated in the drilling process will not damage the structure of the drilling rig support, The rig support structure has sufficient seismic capacity.
Author Keywords: drill stent;static analysis;modal analysis;seismic analysis

Authors: L. Wang; T. Ohkawa
Author Affiliations: Tokai University, Japan; Tokai University, Japan

Abstract: The remote robotic hand is required to imitate the hand movements of hand joints with low latency. In this report, the design and implementation of an FPGA-based robotic hand with remote control is proposed. To reduce the latency of controlling the robot hand, the waiting time for processing data needs to be shortened. Document Title: Application of Voiceprint Recognition Based on Improved ECAPA-TDNN
Authors: X. Dong; J. Song
Author Affiliations: Shenyang University of Technology, Shenyang, China; Shenyang University of Technology, Shenyang, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: In speech signals, the characteristics of the same type of voiceprint in time usually have similar trends, and the trends of different voiceprints in time are quite different, which makes the time context information have a great influence on the results of speech recognition. Although the ECAPA-TDNN model can obtain time context information through dilated convolution to a certain extent, the time context information obtained by the model is not sufficient. Based on the ECAPA-TDNN model, this paper adds a bidirectional long-term and short-term memory network (Bi-directional LSTM, BLSTM) that can fully mine the time context, thus proposing the ECAPA-TDNN-LSTM model. The proposed model can not only emphasize channel attention, but also have the characteristics of information dissemination and aggregation, and can obtain rich time context information. Experimental results show that the recognition accuracy of the proposed algorithm reaches 89.17%, which improves the recognition accuracy of voiceprint.
Author Keywords: voiceprint recognition;bidirectional long short-term memory network;ECAPA-TDNN-LSTM
IEEE Terms: Technological innovation;Convolution;Speech recognition;Bidirectional control;Market research;Spectrogram;Long short term memory

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Driven by the prosperous development of energy internet, the requirements of real-time monitoring and reliable transmission are put forward to cloud computing center. Constrained by the single-dimensional shape and structural feature modeling of series’ self-characteristics, the extraction of the multivariate time series’ commonality is challenged. Therefore, a could center based network devices associated temporal evolutionary feature extraction and clustering scheme is constructed in this paper. A multi-temporal evolutionary feature extraction algorithm is proposed to extract the commonality of equipment groups. Then a temporal evolutionary distance correlated Kmedoids clustering is proposed to enhance the efficient monitoring of associated devices. Numerous simulations are conducted to verify the effectiveness of our proposed algorithm on the evaluation of indicators in different data sets.

Document Title: Numerical Analysis of the Effect of Ship Exits on Evacuation Efficiency
Authors: S. Fang; Z. Liu; Y. Chou; X. Wang; S. Ni
Author Affiliations: Navigation College, Dalian Maritime University, Dalian, China; Navigation College, Dalian Maritime University, Dalian, China; Navigation College, Dalian Maritime University, Dalian, China; Navigation College, Dalian Maritime University, Dalian, China; Navigation College, Dalian Maritime University, Dalian, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: In order to consider the impact of fires at different locations in ship on the human evacuation process in an emergency situation, the living deck of a training ship was used as the experimental framework, and Pathfinder was used to simulating the evacuation process. In the simulation scenarios, the unavailability of a single exit due to an accident was taken into account, and three indicators were adopted to analyze the impact of each exit on the efficiency of evacuation. The results showed that the occurrence of fire at the widest exit (exit 3) has the greatest impact on performance, and the congestion is the key restricting factor of evacuation onboard. However, the evacuation time decreased on the contrary when exit 3 undertaking heavy tasks was closed. Accordingly, when another exit near exit 3 was closed, exit 3 should take more tasks and the evacuation time increased sharply. Based on the simulation results, the types of stairs can be optimized from a scientific perspective to alleviate congestion, and the evacuation efficiency and process can be greatly improved.
Funding Information: National Science Foundation; China Postdoctoral Science Foundation;
Author Keywords: waterway transportation;evacuation onboard;Pathfinder;evacuation efficiency;layout optimization
IEEE Terms: Training;Analytical models;Technological innovation;Simulation;Stairs;Software;Behavioral sciences

Document Title: Distribution network risk prediction based on status assessment and semi-invariant method
Authors: J. Xuan; J. Zheng; Y. Shi; H. Gong; J. Wu; H. Hu; Z. Hu
Author Affiliations: State Grid Fujian Electric Power Co. Ltd; Economic and Technological Research Institute of State Grid Fujian Electric Power Co. Ltd, Fujian, China; Economic and Technological Research Institute of State Grid Fujian Electric Power Co. Ltd, Fujian, China; School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Wuhan University, China; School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Wuhan University, China; School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Wuhan University, China; School of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Wuhan University, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: In order to accurately predict the risk of the distribution network containing distributed generator devices, this paper first assesses the operation status of the distribution network, and then analyzes the distribution network with poor operation status, combines environmental factors and distribution network topology map, selects long short-term memory network for initial feature extraction of the risk data, and uses temporal pattern attention mechanism and convolutional neural network cooperate to form the temporal attention layer, and the output results are used as the initial data for risk assessment. The expectation and sensitivity matrices of node voltage and branch flow are obtained by flow calculation, the semi-invariant of the injected power at each node and converted into semi-invariant of each order of the node state vector and branch flow vector, and finally the node voltage probability density function and probability distribution function are obtained by using Gram-Charlier series expansion.

Publication Title: 2022 Tenth International Symposium on Computing and Networking Workshops (CANDARW)
Abstract: In this paper, we have created a communication dataset that addresses the problems of existing communication datasets and provides a fine-grained classification of malicious communications. Related research used publicly available datasets labeled normal and malicious to increase the accuracy of NIDS detection, as well as to study NIDS specific to certain attack scenarios. However, the existing dataset has an outdated creation date and only labels normal and malignant. Furthermore, even if attack scenarios that indicate broad policies for malicious communications are known, detailed classifications that indicate actual methods, etc., are few or unknown. To solve these problems, we created the Koga2022 Dataset, which is a detailed classification of malicious communication data collected using multiple penetration tools as well as a honeypot that is open to the outside world. This paper presents the statistics of the Koga2022 Dataset that was created. We then discuss validation methods that may be difficult with existing datasets and demonstrate the usefulness of the Koga2022 Dataset.

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: In order to improve the accuracy and reliability of EEG emotion recognition, an algorithm based on local mean decomposition (LMD) fuzzy entropy is proposed, and support vector machine (SVM) classification is performed on this basis. The LMD decomposition of the rhythm signal of the emotional EEG signal is performed to filter out the useless components of the EEG signal, and the PF components selected by the local mean decomposition algorithm are used as the input vector of the fuzzy entropy algorithm to extract the EEG signal feature parameters. Maximum correlation minimum redundancy is used for feature selection. Finally, the feature matrix is fed into the SVM classifier for binary classification in terms of validity and arousal, respectively, to achieve EEG emotion recognition. The method achieves 91.87% classification accuracy on the DEAP dataset, which can extract EEG emotion features more effectively and provides a new method for the study of EEG emotion recognition.

Document Title: Multi-board FPGA Implementation to Solve the Satisfiability Problem for Multi-Agent Path Finding in Smart Factory
Authors: P. Huang; K. Wei; H. Amano; K. Ohkoda; M. Aono
Author Affiliations: Graduate School of Science and Technology, Keio University, Japan; Graduate School of Science and Technology, Keio University, Japan; Graduate School of Science and Technology, Keio University, Japan; Amoeba Energy Co., Ltd., Japan; Amoeba Energy Co., Ltd., Japan
Publication Title: 2022 Tenth International Symposium on Computing and Networking Workshops (CANDARW)
Abstract: Many smart city applications such as optimal path planning for multiple transportation robots in factories and warehouses are formulated as highly complex combinatorial optimization problems. Since these problem-solving processes require time-critical control and low energy consumption when executed at the edge of computer networks, a promising approach is to implement high speed solvers on Field Programmable Gate Array (FPGA) by exploiting its parallelism and energy efficiency. Here we focus on a variant of the Multi-Agent Path Finding (MAPF) problem, which is a problem of finding optimal discrete space-time trajectories of the robots that are required to complete transportation requests in a semiconductor fabrication factory as early as possible without colliding with each other. According to our future aim to find a feasible solution to a large-sized problem instance in a distributed manner, the present paper proposes a multi-FPGA implementation of a variant of ‘AmoebaSATslim,’ which is a bio-inspired parallel search algorithm to search for a solution to the Boolean satisfiability problem (SAT). We design an FPGA cluster that links two FPGA boards to tackle a minimal-sized instance for two robots to transport two packages, where each of the boards is responsible for finding the trajectory of each of the robots. The proposed dual-FPGA implementation handles 22,544 variables and achieves up to approximately 17-fold faster execution speed than its software implemented on an x86-based personal computer.
IEEE Terms: Smart cities;Transportation;Search problems;Software;Production facilities;Trajectory;Time factors

Authors: L. Li; Y. Xue; Y. Yu

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: The collaborate path planning of multiple Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs) for patrolling and reconnaissance in static environment is addressed in this paper. In the application of urgent observation, two objectives are considered simultaneously, i.e., time cost and energy cost. A good plan makes sure that all the targets are observed as soon as possible, and the overall energy consumption as low as possible. The problem is formulated as a multiple traveling salesman problem (MTSP) with multiple depots, known as a nondeterministic polynomial-hard problem. A preference-based multi-objective optimization algorithm is proposed to solve the problem. Preferred range of each objective is used as preference information, and the algorithm aims at Pareto optimal solutions that match the preference. Through computational experiments, the benefit of the proposed algorithm (T-MOEA/D-2opt) is demonstrated by comparing with other existing algorithms. Experimental results show that T-MOEA/D-2opt is effective and efficient in finding preferred Pareto solutions for this path planning problem.

In this paper, we formulate an optimization problem for accurate time synchronization of power device with multiple satellite clock sources. Abstract: Renewable energy power generation replacing traditional energy power generation is the trend of power generation structure in the future, which means that the renewable energy (RE) will be vigorously developed. Therefore, deciding the exploitation priority and ranking of renewable energy resources are especially crucial to the target of sustainable development. This paper constructs a comprehensive and complete evaluation index system of renewable energy sources (RES) exploitation with 21 sub-criteria, involving uncertainties and complementarity into the traditional multi-criteria of economic, technical, social and environmental. In the process of selecting sub-criteria, measurable and quantifiable are the primary considerations in order to eliminate uncertainty of fuzzy values from qualitative indicators. An improved Fuzzy Analytic Hierarchy Process (FAHP) method is applied to determine weights of indexes and ranking of RES development, which shows reduced subjectivity and improved computing speed. Finally, a case study of Qinghai in China is analyzed and discussed in RES exploitation priorities, general weights of sub-criteria with respect to overall objective and weights of RES alternatives under every main criterion. The evaluation index system proposed in this research will help to develop RE in an orderly and planned way in the near future.

Document Title: Physical Layer Security for FSO-based Data Center
Authors: W. Lu; B. Li
Author Affiliations: School of Computer Science, Hubei University of Technology, Wuhan, China; School of Computer Science, Hubei University of Technology, Wuhan, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Wireless data center network has recently received a lot of academic attention. Relevant studies have shown that Free Space Optical (FSO) technology can bring flexible topologies, high speed transmission and low energy consumption to data centers. However, it can also make the cloud data broadcast in the data center space. Some work has shown that outdoor FSO channel is vulnerable to eavesdropping attacks due to the combined attenuation effects of atmospheric turbulence and long distance transmission. Unfortunately, it is not clear the security of FSO channel in data centers and there are few studies discussing it. We study the physical layer security of FSO link in the data center indoor scenario. A suitable tapping channel model was given based on the viable mechanism of eavesdrop communication in data center. We also numerically simulate the FSO eavesdropping channel in short distance and study the impact of the relevant factors on probability of secrecy capacity. The results show that in data centers, only path attenuation of FSO also poses a channel eavesdropping risk. Under certain conditions, the distance of a few tens of meters combined with the use of shorter wavelengths can result in serious channel security risks. At the same time, the use of long wavelengths or special window wavelengths with small attenuation of FSO in FSO-based data centers has significantly improved channel security.
Author Keywords: Data center network;Free space optical;Physical layer security;Secrecy
IEEE Terms: Wireless communication;Data centers;Wavelength measurement;Optical attenuators;Physical layer security;Optical variables measurement;Attenuation

Authors: S. Shao; J. Li; P. Shao; X. Zhu
Author Affiliations: School of Computer and Information Security, University of Electronic Science and Technology, Guilin, China; School of Computer and Information Security, University of Electronic Science and Technology, Guilin, China; School of Computer Science and Software, Zhaoqing University, Zhaoqing, China; School of Computer Science and Software, Zhaoqing University, Zhaoqing, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Privacy protection of cloud images is widely concerned, while their usability is often neglected. Therefore, an image privacy regions encryption scheme based on SIFT features and face detection is proposed. Firstly, the algorithm detects the faces of the image and obtains the face regions. Then the SIFT feature points of the image are extracted, and the image is divided into several blocks. Meanwhile, the image blocks with more SIFT feature points are selected as SIFT feature regions. The face regions and the SIFT feature regions are viewed as the regions of interest (ROIs) that require privacy protection. In the scrambling encryption step, the ROIs are combined to improve the scrambling effect. Each ROI adopts a different chaotic sequence in the diffusible encryption step to enhance chaos complexity. Experiments show that the encryption scheme saves running time, and the usability of the encrypted image is preserved. This scheme is suitable for the encryption of images such as ID cards and invoices.
Author Keywords: SIFT feature;face detection;image encryption;privacy protection;region of interest

Obtain the wavelet packet coefficients of each output zero-sequence current and zero-sequence voltage in the characteristic band, and perform product processing on them, a new method for judging faulty lines according to the polarity of their products. Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: The rapid positioning of projectile penetration into steel target or concrete structure has been a hot topic in the field of explosion and impact. The traditional artificial target-marking system has the disadvantages of low safety factor, poor timeliness, large manpower consumption, poor precision and low efficiency, and it cannot meet the needs of launch test or training task in modern and information age. Optical measurement, such as high-speed video recording, is easy to be influenced by environment, and especially when there is the complex shooting range environment, the measurement data are easy to be influenced by weather, illumination and shooting range environment, etc. Furthermore, a large amount of dust and smoke produced from the explosion process can interfere with the projectile positioning accuracy. The remote sensing measurement method to identify the projectile penetration position have many problems, such as high cost, poor timeliness and low flexibility. In view of that, the acoustic positioning measurement method of projectile penetration process is proposed, which has the advantages of large monitoring range and being unaffected by visibility. A randomly arranged 16-channels transmitter array is used to receive sound pressure signals, and a digital acquisition device using corresponding audio interfaces is used to transmit the collected signal to a computer. A total of 5 seconds of audio signals are obtained and intercepted before and after the shell hits the target, and the signal is analyzed in time domain, frequency domain and time-frequency domain. Based on the conventional beamforming (CBF) algorithm and the CLEAN-SC algorithm, the projectile location during ignition, launch and penetration process is studied. The results showed that both the CBF and the CLEAN-SC algorithms can accurately locate the explosive position of gunpowder and the first impact position of the projectile on the target plate. What’s more, the results also showed that the accuracy of CLEAN-SC algorithm is better than that of CBF algorithm by contrasting the size of the main lobe.
Funding Information: National Natural Science Foundation of China;
Author Keywords: projectile penetration;positioning;microphone array
IEEE Terms: Time-frequency analysis;Array signal processing;Projectiles;Position measurement;Optical variables measurement;Acoustic measurements;Explosions

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: With the proposal of dual carbon targets, electric vehicles are gradually replacing fuel vehicles, and their ownership has increased rapidly, which has also brought a huge demand for charging. Therefore, the accurate prediction of the electricity vehicle charging load can effectively avoid the impact of the electricity vehicle charging load on the normal operation of the power grid and improve the operation efficiency of the grid. In order to realize the accurate prediction of electricity vehicle charging load, this paper clusters the electricity vehicle charging load by k-means algorithm, and then uses multi-level discrete wavelet transform to realize the feature extraction of electricity vehicle charging load, which avoids the impact of the unsteady characteristics of the original electricity vehicle charging load sequence on the forecasting accuracy. Finally, this paper uses the deep learning prediction model LSTM tuned by grey wolf algorithm to realize the accurate prediction of electricity vehicle charging load, and verifies the effectiveness of the proposed method with actual data.

Document Title: Infrared and Visible Image Fusion Based on Two-scale Edge Preservation Decomposition and Edge Detection
Authors: K. Wang
Author Affiliations: Jilin Technology College of Electronic Information, Jilin, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: In order to obtain a clear and natural night-vision fusion image efficiently, a fusion algorithm is proposed based on two-scale edge preservation decomposition and edge detection. Firstly, the original infrared and visible images are decomposed into base and detail layers through a guided image filter. Secondly, the saliency maps containing a large number of corners and edges are constructed. Fusion coefficients of detail information are determined by normalizing the saliency maps. Finally, a new fused image is reconstructed by synthesizing these decomposition results. Results and data show that the proposed method can effectively avoid mutual interference of different characteristic images and suppress the generation of artifacts and noise, and the fusion results have better visual effect. It is superior to other methods in structural similarity, universal quality index, mutual information. In addition, the running time of the proposed method is less than 0.3 s, which meet the real-time requirements.
Author Keywords: Keywords-two-scale edge preservation decomposition;edge detection;Guided image filter;Image fusion

Authors: Z. Zhao
Author Affiliations: Faculty of Information Technology, Beijing University of Technology, Beijing, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: In the traditional software distribution mechanism, the software developer will add a hash check code to the current version of the software to ensure that the software is forgery-proof. However, in the process of software release and upgrade, there will always be hackers and some unscrupulous elements attacking some genuine software, destroying the internal functions of normal software, or adding some backdoors to steal user information and data. Blockchain is a distributed p2p system with the advantages of trusted traceability, anti-tampering and consensus mechanism, which can effectively prevent hackers from modifying the data on its chain. In order to solve the loss caused by using the attacked software, this paper proposes blockchain-based trusted software distribution mechanism, which brings a new idea for the research of trusted software release mechanism.

Document Title: Electricity Consumption Forecasting in Jiangsu Province Based on Machine Learning Model
Authors: L. Liu; J. Yang; W. Chen

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Electricity demand forecasting helps to mitigate energy consumption, reduce environmental pollution, and improve the safety and stability of the power system. This paper employs correlation analysis and Recursive Feature Elimination (RFE) methods to identify a total of six factors affecting electricity demand from eight aspects: economic development level, urbanization level, industrialization level, population number, industrial structure, household consumption level, electricity price and energy efficiency improvement. Then, we adopt the cross-validation grid search algorithm to optimize the parameters of the Support Vector Regression (SVR) model to establish the optimal power demand forecasting model. Subsequently, the historical data of electricity demand in Jiangsu Province from 1999 to 2020 is selected for empirical analysis to verify the validity of the model and its prediction accuracy. The results show that the adopted model not only has good prediction accuracy, but also has excellent generalization ability. Finally, we predict electricity demand of Jiangsu Province from 2021 to 2025 with the help of obtained model.

Document Title: The Application of Artificial Intelligence in the Factor Analysis and Scenario Forecast for Carbon Peak in Major Cities in Jilin Province
Authors: J. Tian; S. Wang; Z. Piao; W. Guo; C. Tan; H. Xu
Author Affiliations: Baicheng Power Supply Company, State Grid Jilin Electric Power Co., Ltd, Baicheng, China; Beijing Kedong Power Control System Co., LTD, Beijing, China; Baicheng Power Supply Company, State Grid Jilin Electric Power Co., Ltd, Baicheng, China; Baicheng Power Supply Company, State Grid Jilin Electric Power Co., Ltd, Baicheng, China; Beijing Kedong Power Control System Co., LTD, Beijing, China; Beijing Kedong Power Control System Co., LTD, Beijing, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Currently, domestic energy still depends on carbon as the main source of development. Carbon emissions are inevitably related to economic development. China needs to reach peak carbon emissions as early as possible to achieve economic and industrial transformation. The domestic economy should adapt to the new normal and new trends, so that the carbon peak can be achieved by 2030, thereby promoting green circular and low-carbon development and transformation. In this paper, based on Kaya identity and artificial intelligence algorithm, combined with the changing characteristics of urban carbon emissions in Jilin Province, the LMDI factor decomposition model of carbon emissions in Jilin Province is constructed. Using the basic parameters of GDP, population size, industrial scale, and carbon emissions from 2005 to 2021, the factors of carbon emissions in various cities in Jilin Province were obtained, and three scenarios were set for benchmarks, low carbon emissions, and technological breakthroughs to obtain the rate of change for each driving change. Then, the carbon peak year was finally calculated for each scenario. The conclusions are drawn as follows: 1. The urban factorization results showed that the per capita output effect is the main driving force behind the increase in carbon emissions, while the industrial structure effect and industrial carbon intensity effect has an inhibitory effect on the growth of carbon emissions; 2. The carbon peak years under the three scenarios were 2029, 2027, and 2026 respectively, and carbon emissions will drop rapidly after reaching the peak in the technological breakthrough scenario. This paper provides a reference for Jilin Province in achieving the goal of the carbon peak.

IEEE Terms: Technological innovation;Urban areas;Sociology;Force;Carbon dioxide;Predictive models;Market research

Document Title: FLC: Empower Large-Scale Multi-Label Text Classification via Free Label Correlations Derived from Massive Raw Texts
Authors: X. Shen; S. Ma; Z. Lu; S. Xu
Author Affiliations: China Nanhu Academy of Electronics And Information Technology, JiaXing, China; China Nanhu Academy of Electronics And Information Technology, JiaXing, China; China Nanhu Academy of Electronics And Information Technology, JiaXing, China; China Nanhu Academy of Electronics And Information Technology, JiaXing, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Large-scale multi-label text classification (LMTC) aims at tagging texts with its most relevant subset of labels from a large candidate label set. State-of-the-art LMTC methods are mostly based on deep neural networks trained using a cross-entropy loss. These methods require massive human labeled training data to capture the underlying label correlations implicitly, which could be a burden in real-world applications. We observe that many correlated labels are missed by human annotators, but their label names in fact co-occur often in document contexts. In this paper, we propose a novel text classification framework FLC, incorporating “free” label correlations derived from massive raw text corpora. Specifically, we design a principled similarity measurement to evaluate the label correlation based on the co-occurrence statistics of their corresponding label names. Based on the derived label correlations, we add a complementary loss to make the overall loss more robust when correlated labels were predicted by the classifier but missed by human annotators. Experiments on two real-world datasets demonstrate the superiority of FLC over state-of-the-art methods, especially when the human labels are not perfect and the training data is limited. Moreover, the computational overhead of employing FLC is negligible.
Author Keywords: label correlation;large-scale text classificstion;pmi

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: To solve the problem of multi-load AGV workshop scheduling with limited buffer capacity, a simulated annealing algorithm based on key job strategy and iterative greedy (SAKIG) is proposed for minimizing the maximum completion time. In SAKIG, with the simulated annealing algorithm (SA) as the basic framework, an Improved Interval insertion NEH (IINEH) is proposed for the initial solution, a key job strategy is designed for neighborhood search, iterative greedy algorithm (IG) is introduced for far neighborhood search. Simulation experiments demonstrate IINEH is superior over other NEH rules, IINEH as initial solution and key job strategy are valid, SAKIG is superior over other heuristic algorithms and SAKIG has more advantages in the problems of large number of machines and large limited buffer capacity.

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: In urban road traffic system, a variety of travel modes coexist and interact with each other. Micro modeling and analysis methods are difficult to capture the macro evolution characteristics and interaction of traffic flow. Based on the actual road network and vehicle trajectory data of Beijing, this paper calculates the total number of vehicles on the road section through the taxi trajectory data and the safe distance model to obtain the social vehicle data, and uses the bus moving trajectory data to obtain the bus vehicle data. Based on the three-dimensional macroscopic fundamental diagram (MFD) method, a three- dimensional MFD of social vehicle-bus vehicle is established, and the model parameters are solved by the least square method. The traffic flow data obtained by processing is used to verify its existence. According to the results of regional division, the influence of the number of buses in the two regions on the traffic capacity in the region is compared. The three-dimensional MFD model constructed in this paper can reflect the evolution characteristics of actual traffic flow, which is of great significance for traffic control of different trips.

Authors: F. Li; W. Ma; H. Li; J. Li
Author Affiliations: Department of Network Technology, Software Engineering Institute of Guangzhou, Guangzhou, China; Department of Network Technology, Software Engineering Institute of Guangzhou, Guangzhou, China; Department of Network Technology, Software Engineering Institute of Guangzhou, Guangzhou, China; Department of Network Technology, Software Engineering Institute of Guangzhou, Guangzhou, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Due to the imbalanced training samples, anomaly-based intrusion detection system (IDS) has to face many problems such as a low detection accuracy, a high false alarm rate and insufficient application value, especially in multi-classification tasks. A variety of methods are proposed in this paper to improve the effect of IDS based on machine learning. Synthetic minority over-sampling technique (SMOTE) was used to alleviate the problems caused by sample imbalance and improve the model effect, through which new samples are generated by interpolation between K-nearest neighbor and minority. A combination method was used to improve the model effect and achieve the multi-classification of intrusion traffic in this paper. The experimental results show that the performance of IDS has improved in several metrics, which is 93.2% in Macro Average Precision, 98.9% in Macro Average Recall, 95.5% in Macro Average F1Score, and 99.4% in Macro Average AUC. CIC-IDS2017 public dataset provided by the Canadian Institute for Cybersecurity was used in this research. Code is available at: https://github.com/CSFanLi/IDS/tree/main/EnsembleLearning

Document Title: Study on Improving Imaging Quality of Spaceborne SAR by Pulse Coding Technology
Authors: W. Shao; H. Huang
Author Affiliations: School of Electronic and Communication Engineering, Sun Yat-Sen University, Shen Zhen, China; School of Electronic and Communication Engineering, Sun Yat-Sen University, Shen Zhen, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Both pulse and continuous wave radar have their suitable operating conditions and disadvantages which limit their performance. Quasi-continuous wave radar can get the advantages of both of them, but it still has truncation error. Pulse coding technology can circumvent this problem. In this paper, we use pulse coding technology to improve signal-to-noise ratio (SNR), reduce the ambiguity and enhance the swath width of spaceborne synthetic aperture radar (SAR) without changing any hardware. Firstly, we describe the principle of echo reconstruction of spaceborne SAR signal by pulse coding. Suppose each subpulse echo of the coding composition has a certain linear relationship, the echo reconstruction arithmetic of the pulse coding can be simplified, and the pulse coding's applicability can be improved in spaceborne SAR system. Then, we analyze the effect of pulse coding technology on SNR, ambiguity and image width of spaceborne SAR. The simulation results show that pulse coding technology has the same effect on improving the SNR of spaceborne SAR as broadening the width of a single pulse. The Doppler phase difference between each sub-pulse of the coding group will cause the reconstruction error of the pulse coding echo, which changes with the azimuth position, resulting in the final system SNR improvement effect being slightly lower than the theoretical analysis results. Finally, the 2D image simulation results verify the effectiveness of the pulse coding technology in spaceborne SAR system and the correctness for the impact analysis of SNR.
Funding Information: National Natural Science Foundation of China;
Author Keywords: pulse coding technology;synthetic aperture radar (SAR);signal-to-noise ratio (SNR);high-resolution wide swath (HRWS);miniaturized radar

Document Title: Adaptive Block-Based Compressed Sensing Based on Pre-sampling Using LDPC matrices
Authors: Z. Xie; J. Xia; M. Ma
Author Affiliations: School of Information Science and Engineering, Yunnan University, Kunming, China; School of Information Science and Engineering, Yunnan University, Kunming, China; School of Information Science and Engineering, Yunnan University, Kunming, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Assessing the sparsity of image blocks is the key of adaptive block-based compressed sensing (ABCS) algorithms. However, in practice, the digitized image cannot be directly obtained at the sampling device, therefore it is difficult to evaluate the sparsity of the original image. To solve this problem, two different measurement matrices are used in this paper. The original image is pre-sampled using binary low-density parity-check (LDPC) matrices, the sparsity of an image block is estimated by observing the pre-sampled measurement results, the total sampling rate is estimated according to the mean of the variances of the pre-sampled measurement results of all blocks. Then, a Gaussian random measurement matrix is used for the actual sampling. Experiment results show that, compared with the latest adaptive block-based compressed sensing methods, the proposed strategies have a significant improvement in peak signal-to-noise ratio (PSNR) at the same sampling rate, and it can also adaptively change the sampling rate according to the sparsity of the image.
Funding Information: National Natural Science Foundation of China;
Author Keywords: component;Variance;adaptive block compressed sensing;perceptual;adaptive total sampling rate
IEEE Terms: Technological innovation;PSNR;Image coding;Artificial bee colony algorithm;Parity check codes;Sensors;Compressed sensing

Abstract: In this paper, a calculation method of unbalanced capital of purchasing power based on the optimal matching of power generation and consumption in spot mode is proposed. First of all, based on the low-price electricity purchase contract, the actual electricity purchase price can be obtained by preferentially matching the rural low-income electricity consumption. Secondly, the actual total expenditure of the power network agent in a certain period is calculated by considering the cost of electricity and the sharing cost of low price difference. The total electricity sales income of the power grid in a certain period of time is calculated, by considering the calculation of electricity sales income and 1.5 times user agent income of electricity purchase; then, the unbalanced fund channeling model is constructed to obtain the channeling price of power grid agent users for the whole month. Finally, the calculation example analysis, based on the above model to obtain the unbalanced capital of each period, the channelled electricity price of each period, the total unbalanced capital, the channelled electricity price.

Abstract: Living in an era of social economy and energy storage technology, according to the historical monitoring data, the remaining Useful life(RUL) of the lithium battery to make predictions is important. In this paper, the data driven method is used to systematically analyze the influence of single kernel function and super parameters of kernel function on prediction distribution. On this basis, the combined kernel function is derived. The Gaussian process regression model based on the combined kernel function is used to predict the health status and remaining life of lithium batteries offline. Compared with the prediction results of a single kernel function, the Gaussian process regression based on the combined kernel function not only guarantees the local learning ability, but also improves the generalization ability and effectively improves the prediction accuracy.

Abstract: In the global response to the COVID-19 epidemic, a reasonable prediction of the number of infections is a significant reference to reveal the trend of the outbreak and help governments take appropriate action. In this paper, we propose a new ES-LSTM model to predict the growth rate of the number of new infections per day and use a feature processor to address interventions in time series to quantify the impact of interventions to slow the spread of the outbreak. The evolutionary strategy is used to handle the problem that different interventions have different impacts on outbreak prevention and control, as well as optimize model weight to improve the accuracy of prediction results. Experimental results demonstrate that compared to the Linear model, CNN model, and the LSTM model, the MAE of the algorithm is enhanced by 72.9%, 27.6%, and 26.3%, and the RMSE is improved by 74.15%, 31.4%, and 29.5% respectively.

Document Title: How to implement non-committed card protocols to realize AND operations satisfying the three-valued logics
Authors: Y. Suga
Author Affiliations: Internet Initiative Japan Inc., Chiyoda-ku, Japan
Publication Title: 2022 Tenth International Symposium on Computing and Networking Workshops (CANDARW)
Abstract: The matching situation with AND operations between two parties is a common application in card-based proto-cols, and it is known to provide a non-embarrassing confession of love. This means that the other party does not know whether the input was 0 or 1, which is said to avoid embarrassment. In this paper, we consider an extended AND protocol that extends the usual AND operations with two input choices, 0 and 1, to allow the input of a third value, “indefinite,” which is neither 0 nor 1. Considering the continuity of the protocols, it is better to design them to satisfy the transitivity law, and in practice, we need to deal with the classification of three-element semigroups. We attempted a complete classification with restrictions to have a local AND structure, and found that except for trivial examples and considerations of the algebraic isomorphism, we could reduce the classification to only seven cases. These include cases of three-valued logics by Bochvar and Lukasiewicz respectively. We also discuss how to implement card-based protocols to realize these three-element semigroups, but the usual encoding rule of the previous works is not applied to select one value from three candidates. So we try to use the same pattern cards with indistinguishability on the backside, which is another card protocol different from the general encoding rule. Finally, we propose actual implementations with 2 types of card-shuffling; ordinary random cut and top-to-bottom swapping.
Author Keywords: Card-based protocols;Non-committed proto-cols;Five card trick;Top-to-Bottom swapping;Commutative semigroups;Three-valued logic
IEEE Terms: Protocols;Conferences;Encoding

Abstract: The Von Neumann and Harvard architectures are very efficient as the common structures of modern computers. However, they reach certain bottlenecks in parallelism, access speed, and power. In this paper, we propose a new architecture to further improve the parallelism and access speed of RISC-V computing system by adding data flow co-processors. The data flow coprocessor in the architecture is further optimized according to the computational characteristics of modern convolutional neural networks. The computation speed of floating- point numbers is increased to further improve the usefulness of the architecture. The data flow coprocessor adds an automatic access mechanism to further relieve the computational pressure on the main processor. Publication Title: 2022 Tenth International Symposium on Computing and Networking Workshops (CANDARW)
Abstract: To solve a sparse reward problem, this paper proposes a design method for an efficient reward function in the training process of reinforcement learning. Reinforcement learning is a type of machine learning, and its learning process progresses through interactions between environments and agents. In this process, the reward function obtains rewards and performs actions to obtain them. A poorly designed reward function does not provide appropriate, valuable feedback and causes inefficient learning. We propose a dynamic target-oriented method in which a reward function provides larger values as the current state approaches the target state to ensure a better learning performance. We define reward functions based on the method and evaluate them using the CARLA driving simulator, comparing them with reward functions based on other methods. We show that the proposed reward functions can obtain better training results.
Author Keywords: Reinforcement learning;Sparse reward problem;Design of reward function

Document Title: Power Supply Reliability Evaluation Method of Distribution Network Based on Improved LSTM Neural Network
Authors: F. Yang; J. Liu; B. Lu; W. Chai; L. Ren

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: As the power supply load of the distribution network itself is volatile, it is necessary to consider the reserve demand brought by the load. At present, most studies set the reserve demand of the load as 6% of the load value at that time. As an important part of the modern distribution network, the power supply department can adjust the power supply of the flexible load according to the prior contract agreement. In this paper, the flexible load is taken to optimize the island range. Based on the improved LSTM neural network, the confidence level and the influence of different types of flexible loads on islanding are solved. It is concluded that the islanding reserve demand varies with the output and confidence level of intermittent power sources. The islanding stability and economic demand under different confidence levels can be balanced by adjusting the flexible load. The equivalent value of islanding restoration can be effectively increased. Compared with the post-fault power supply restoration without considering the islanding reserve demand, the proposed strategy improves the reliability of the power supply, which shows the effectiveness of the proposed strategy. The experimental evaluation results verify that the improved LSTM neural network has better classification performance, and its classification accuracy index has stronger adaptability and anti-interference in the experiment. Besides, it has a good classification effect in the task of fault type and fault feeder identification of the photovoltaic distribution network. By balancing the power supply stability and demand under different confidence levels for the regulation model, and effectively increasing the value of restoration equivalence, the reliability of power supply is improved, which is more practical.
Author Keywords: Distribution network;Supply stability;Neural network;Flexible load model

Abstract: The point type equipment (transponder) used for vehicle ground communication of rail transit adopts frequency shift keying (FSK) signal with center frequency of 4.24MHZ and phase shift keying (PSK) signal with a center frequency of 9.032MHz. In order to make the vehicle-ground communication in the high-speed data transmission can be more rapid and accurate, Then the OQPSK signal is proposed, The modulation and demodulation of OQPSK signal is explained, And then compared with FSK signal , It has better advantages in spectrum and bit error rate. But when the on-board BTM demodulation OQPSK signal will appear due to the practical work in the process of signal amplitude, cycle, burr caused by the effects of such factors as the carrier and clock errors, For this shortcoming Costas loop algorithm and the interpolation algorithm is proposed to eliminate the error , Carrier synchronization take Costas loop can restrain carrier signal tracking of low SNR, Guarantees the carrier of the input and output of the carrier to keep the smaller frequency difference and difference, The interpolation algorithm to obtain the optimum interpolation time sampling by interpolation value signal, Which ensures the local clock frequency synchronization with the data sampling rate , The symbol synchronization can ensure the stability of the signal, In the Matlab simulation results show the algorithm can correct the error, The algorithm optimization can make the OQPSK signal demodulated by vehicle-mounted BTM more accurate. Quartus and Modelsim are combined to verify the correctness of the whole demodulation system, The results show that the OQPSK signal can be demodulated by FPGA, Which proves the feasibility of vehicle-borne BTM demodulation OQPSK signal based on FPGA.

Meanwhile, the relationship between the influencing factors and the economy benefit of the system is obtained. Residual analysis analysis are used to verify the accuracy of the model. The gray correlation analysis is used to determine the correlation between each factor and economic performance. Abstract: To solve the load skew problem caused by the built-in load balancing algorithm of Nginx, this paper proposes an improved dynamic load balancing algorithm based on weighted polling. The algorithm monitors the actual load of the background server and adjusts the weight dynamically to achieve load balancing. Firstly, the indicators such as CPU usage and memory usage are collected periodically, and the number of connections and the number of processes are introduced as statistical load factors. The connection number weight and the number of processes weight are calculated according to the connection number and the number of processes. Finally, the three weights are added together to adjust the server weight. The performance of other algorithms built in Nginx is compared with the algorithm proposed in this paper. The results show that the dynamic algorithm proposed in this paper has higher actual concurrency and lower average response time under high concurrent requests, and can better achieve load balancing and improve the performance of the server cluster.

Abstract: Relying on powerful learning and representation capabilities, Convolutional Neural Networks(CNN) have better denoising performance than traditional methods in image denoising tasks. However, these methods generally have the disadvantages of excessive smoothing and large amount of parameters. In order to overcome this shortcoming, an image denoising method based on double-branch hole residual convolution neural network is proposed in this paper. This method designs a novel network structure. By designing different voids on the branches, the detailed information at different levels of the image is fully mined. By reducing the number of convolution kerns on the branches, the number of parameters in the whole network is reduced. Compared with Denoising Convolutional Neural Network(DnCNN), the parameters are reduced by 19.6%, and the residual mechanism further accelerates the training process. On the test datasets, the proposed method not only achieved excellent performance in the two quantitative evaluation indicators of peak signal-to-noise ratio and structural similarity, but also subjectively denoised images contained richer texture details.

Abstract: Air traffic congestion (ATC) identification and prediction is a prerequisite work for air traffic flow management (ATFM) and flight delay mitigation. In this paper, we construct the ex-post evaluation index system of air traffic network (ATN) congestion and propose the ATN congestion identification model based on fuzzy C-means clustering (FCM). According to the results of congestion levels identification, this paper analyzes various factors affecting ATN congestion and constructs the ex-ante prediction index system of ATN congestion. The ATN congestion levels prediction is performed by decision tree (DT), random forest (RF), extreme gradient boosting (XGBoost), light gradient boosting machine (LightGBM) algorithms. The grid search method is used to adjust and optimize the key parameters of models. The empirical results of ATN congestion levels prediction in Northeast China show that the accuracy of XGBoost and LightGBM algorithms for ATN congestion levels prediction respectively reaches 86.4% and 86.6%, which are better than mainstream classification prediction algorithms (DT and RF). With comparable prediction accuracy, LightGBM outperforms XGBoost in computational speed and stability of prediction for different congestion levels.

Abstract: In order to solve the problem that traditional text representation learning methods ignore the structure information of the text itself and the key information with high correlation degree not mentioned in the text, a text graph representation learning method based on knowledge enhancement is proposed. Firstly, Bert, bidirectional long short-term memory network and conditional random field are fused to extract entities from financial texts, and then mapped to external large-scale financial maps for knowledge enhancement to obtain the external entity set associated with texts. The external entity set is added to the keyword generation model to realize the node construction of text representation graph. The concept fusion between nodes is realized by the community detection algorithm. According to the co-occurrence relationship of concepts in the text and the correlation relationship between concepts and sentences, the edge is built and the weight is given, so as to realize the construction of text graph representation. Experimental results show that the proposed text graph representation method performs well in the task of text similarity calculation, and performs well on CNSE and CNSS with F1 reaching 82.05 and 88.96 respectively.

Abstract: In order to improve the efficiency of robot path planning in the storage environment, this study improved the A* algorithm based on the warehouse environment. In this paper, the heuristic function of the A* algorithm is optimized based on the map of the simulated warehouse environment, and the robot path planning simulations of single target point and multiple target points are carried out respectively. To evaluate the improvement of algorithm we improved on the path planning speed of the mobile robot, this study compared the performance of the improved algorithm on the path planning ability of the mobile robot with the Dijkstra path planning algorithm, the A* algorithm and the improved A* algorithm based on dynamically weighted. Document Title: Just-In-Time Compiler System in Aspect-Oriented Programming based Building Block Platform for constructing Domain-Specific Language for HPC Application
Authors: O. Ishimura; Y. Yoshimoto
Author Affiliations: The University of Tokyo, Tokyo, Japan; The University of Tokyo, Tokyo, Japan
Publication Title: 2022 Tenth International Symposium on Computing and Networking Workshops (CANDARW)
Abstract: The recent complexity of high-performance computing (HPC) systems to create efficient programs is becoming more difficult because of the lagging of processors' performance. Domain Specific Language (DSL) is a promising approach that offers a productive environment and creates a high-efficient program. However, DSLs lack portability and make developers incur high costs. An Aspect-Oriented Programming (AOP) based platform for building DSL processing systems is proposed to solve the problem. By combining reusable aspect modules, DSL processing systems can be built into each HPC system to assist developers in creating programs with various systems config-urations. The platform is achieved by putting the application programming interface into the user's kernel code and controlling the kernel's execution according to the platform conventions. However, the platform has some problems. It is impossible to perform optimization that intervenes in the kernel code. It is also impossible to use SIMD and GPGPU efficiently. This study proposes a modification of the kernel code by introducing a Just-In-Time (JIT) compilation system into the platform and using SIMD and GPGPU. We also created benchmarks and confirmed a performance improvement of 94 % for reducing the execution time compared with the based platform and an improvement of 9% compared with handwritten code for auto compiler optimization.

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Smart grid, Client monitoring, Data model, Complex scenarSmart grids can accurately monitor the power consumption behavior of each grid node and each user. It can effectively ensure the two-way flow of information and power of all nodes in the whole transmission and distribution process and is an automatic power transmission network. The event-based method collects different types of actual load data and preprocesses them. Then, it detects the state of the event, and extracts the characteristic information for load identification. In the process of event detection, the data of this method is vulnerable to noise pollution. It can not monitor the power consumption information of electrical equipment in complex scenarios. In this paper, the variational mode decomposition is applied to obtain the data power allocation of NILM. The effective information of NILM is retained. Combined with the convolutional neural network model to realize load identification, the rationality and effectiveness of the proposed scheme in a complex operating environment are verified by example analysis. The simulation results indicate that the hybrid model can overcome the low efficiency of the single model. Finally, the superiority of the proposed scheme is proved by comparing the method based on the conditional generation countermeasure network and the method based on the holey residual network. Besides improving the load monitor accuracy of the NILM in a complex scene, the invention expands the universality and the expandability of the NILM by establishing a combined experiment, which improves the load monitoring efficiency and increases the practical use value.

Abstract: The development of Internet technology has brought massive amounts of unstructured data, extracting entity relation triples from unstructured text is crucial for the construction of large-scale knowledge graph. Most of the existing extraction methods are based on pipeline extraction. But it has the problem of error propagation and the performance of extracting overlapping triples is low. The joint extraction method can solve the above problems, while the existing joint extraction methods ignore the interaction of two subtasks, the enhancement effect of entity type information and the contribution of words under different relations and topics to sentence semantic embedding. In order to solve the above problems, a multi-information fusion entity relation joint extraction model was proposed. The model integrated the predefined entity type description information for head entity recognition, modeled the relationship as a mapping from the beginning entity to the end entity, and used conditional regularization to enhance the sentence representation, and integrated the relationship perception attention mechanism for relationship extraction. Compared with the current SOTA method, the experimental results show that the F1 value is improved by 1%.

Document Title: Refined evaluation method for aircraft unimpeded taxi-out time
Authors: L. Chen; Z. Zhao
Author Affiliations: College of Civil Aviation, Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics; College of Civil Aviation, Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: The composition of aircraft taxi-out time at airports can be divided into two components: the unimpeded taxi-out time determined by the airport runway taxiway structure and optimal taxi path, and the additional taxi-out time caused by airport congestion or non-optimal taxi routes. The additional taxi-out time is a direct reflection of airport congestion and an important indicator for taxiing efficiency assessment. An accurate definition of the unimpeded taxi-out time is the basis for calculating the additional taxi-out time. For the assessment of aircraft unimpeded taxi-out time, this paper firstly conducted an analysis of the factors influencing aircraft taxi-out time; then, for busy airports using apron control, the aircraft taxi-out process was divided into two stages: apron tower control range taxiing and ATC tower control range taxiing, and a linear regression model was established for each stage using different indicators, and a new algorithm was used to calculate the aircraft unimpeded taxi-out time. Finally, the new algorithm is validated by using some aircraft parking position at Shenzhen Baoan International Airport as the object of analysis. The validation results show that the fit of the algorithm is better than that of the classical algorithm, and the deviation of the unimpeded taxi-out time derived using the new algorithm from the simulated unimpeded taxi-out time is 3.3%.
Author Keywords: air transport;airport field flow;unimpeded taxi time;regression analysis

Publication Title: 2022 Tenth International Symposium on Computing and Networking Workshops (CANDARW)
Abstract: The number of mobile users accessing high quality video content is increasing, which increases the load of content delivery networks (CDNs). To alleviate the network load, a distributed cooperative caching technique, in which each mobile device acts as a cache server and shares the cache through device-to-device (D2D) communication, has been proposed. However, efficient content placement among mobile devices remains a challenging problem as cache capacity of each mobile device is limited and is not in a fixed location. In this study, we propose a load-based content allocation (LBCA) method that efficiently distributes cache data onto mobile devices based on the load of base station (BS). The proposed scheme suits scalable video coding (SVC) that subdivides content data hierarchically and dynamically selects video quality depending on the network load. Our experiments demonstrate that the proposed cache control scheme increases the number of users who can view content even in a congested network, resulting in improved quality of experience (QoE) for the user.

Abstract: In a drone logistics system, a message delivery system in which the drone delivers messages for other users on the way to a parcel delivery destination has been proposed. To reduce the complexity of message delivery routes, this paper proposes a message delivery method that divides logistics areas and determines the message delivery routes in each area. The method also makes it possible for a later departure drone and an early departure drone to exchange information to add, cancel, and/or exchange their messages and delivery points. Publication Title: 2022 Tenth International Symposium on Computing and Networking Workshops (CANDARW)
Abstract: Existing simple routing protocols (e.g., OSPF, RIP) have some disadvantages of being inflexible and prone to congestion due to the concentration of packets on particular routers. To address these issues, packet routing methods using machine learning have been proposed recently. Compared to these algorithms, machine learning based methods can choose a routing path intelligently by learning efficient routes. However, machine learning based methods have a disadvantage of requiring training time. Therefore, we use a lightweight machine learning algorithm, OS-ELM (Online Sequential Extreme Learning Machine), to reduce the training time in this paper. There is a previous work about reinforcement learning method using OS-ELM, though it has a problem of low learning accuracy. Hence, we propose OS-ELM QN (Q-Network) with a prioritized experience replay buffer and multi-agent learning function to improve the learning performance. It is compared to a deep reinforcement learning based packet routing method using a network simulator. Experimental results show that the introduction of the experience replay buffer improves the learning performance. In terms of learning speed, OS-ELM QN achieves approximately 2 times speedup than a DQN (Deep Q-Network). The multi-agent learning further improves the learning speed of OS-ELM QN.
Author Keywords: Reinforcement learning;Packet routing;Neural networks;OS ELM

Abstract: With the acceleration of smart distribution network construction, a large amount of distribution data has been generated. When the current edge computing technology is used to process data, it is limited by hardware resources and can not make full use of data resources, resulting in a long service time. Therefore, an effective edge computing technology is proposed for the Power Smart Internet of Things. According to the functional requirements of the electric pow intelligent Internet of things, an edge computing node architecture is established, and an information entropy suppression algorithm is applied to process original Internet of things data. To quickly process power data without the limitation of hardware resources, a side cloud collaboration mechanism is established for data interaction and collaborative computing to improve the utilization of data resources. Finally, the scheduling strategy based on the ant lion algorithm is designed to realize the cooperative autonomy of the distribution area. Document Title: A driver-based approach for DMA transfer between FPGA-GPU
Authors: S. Kasai; Y. Osana
Author Affiliations: Graduate school of Science and Engineering, University of the Ryukyus, Nishihara, Okinawa, Japan; Department of Engineering, University of the Ryukyus, Nishihara, Okinawa, Japan
Publication Title: 2022 Tenth International Symposium on Computing and Networking Workshops (CANDARW)
Abstract: Many recent HPC clusters employ GPUs as accelerators to improve their performance per watt, but the power wall is still there. The use of FPGAs draws attention to achieving more power efficiency because the users can design their application-specific custom accelerator. The hybrid approach with GPUs and FPGAs is also a hopeful solution. Still the data transfer between FPGA and GPU is a significant bottleneck because there is no native support for direct FPGA-GPU DMA transfers. This paper shows the implementation and evaluation of two direct FPGA-GPU data transfer methods. By mapping FPGA memory on the BAR address space, the GPU's DMA gained only 300 MB/s, which was slower than indirect transfer through the host's main memory. The second method maps GPU memory on the BAR address space by NVIDIA GPUDirect API, and the FPGA's DMA initiates data transfer. Although GPU-to-FPGA data transfer is not still succeeded with this method, the FPGA-to-GPU bandwidth on the Gen3 x4 bus reached 3.25 GB/s: more than 80% of peak bandwidth. This result outperformed FPGA-Host-GPU transfer by 1.6x, even faster than Host-GPU DMA transfer. Since the second method is implemented by a small extension on Xilinx's XDMA driver, it is expected to be portable for other FPGA DMA controllers.
Author Keywords: GPUDirect API;XDMA;PCIe-AXI Bridge;BAR
IEEE Terms: Conferences;Graphics processing units;Bandwidth;Data transfer;Field programmable gate arrays;Bars

Abstract: In order to solve the problems of low positioning accuracy and poor stability of basic received signal strength (RSSI), a virtual vertical line and Optimized particle swarm positioning algorithm (OPSO-LAVPB) was proposed. Firstly, the distance between the reference node and the target node is obtained by the RSSI ranging model, and then a small range of location area is determined by the virtual vertical positioning algorithm (LAVPB) as the search area of the optimized particle swarm optimization algorithm (OPSO). The average positioning error is taken as the target function of OPSO to be searched, and then the coordinate of the minimum fitness value obtained is the coordinate of the required target node. The simulation results show that, the positioning accuracy and convergence speed of OPSO-LAVPB are significantly improved which is compared with the approximate triangle Interior point test (APIT) positioning algorithm, the vertical line positioning algorithm (LAPB) and the improved vertical line segmentation algorithm (PB-APIT).

Abstract: To reduce the false negative rate in power data anomaly detection, enhance the overall detection accuracy and reliability, and create a more stable data detection environment, this paper designs a power big data anomaly detection method based on improved support vector machine technology. Document Title: Gathering despite a linear number of weakly Byzantine agents
Authors: J. Hirose; J. Nakamura; F. Ooshita; M. Inoue
Author Affiliations: Nara Institute of Science and Technology, Ikoma, Japan; Toyohashi University of Technology, Toyohashi, Japan; Fukui University of Technology, Fukui, Japan; Nara Institute of Science and Technology, Ikoma, Japan
Publication Title: 2022 Tenth International Symposium on Computing and Networking Workshops (CANDARW)
Abstract: We study the gathering problem to make multiple agents initially scattered in arbitrary networks gather at a single node. There exist $k$ agents with unique identifiers (IDs) in the network, and $f$ of them are weakly Byzantine agents, which behave arbitrarily except falsifying their identifiers. The agents behave in synchronous rounds, and each node does not have any memory like a whiteboard. In the literature, two algorithms for solving the gathering problem have been proposed. The first algorithm assumes that the number $n$ of nodes is given to agents and achieves the gathering in $O(n^{4}\cdot\vert \Lambda_{good}\vert \cdot\ X(n))$ rounds, where $\vert \Lambda_{good}\vert$ is the length of the largest ID among non-Byzantine agents, and $X(n)$ is the number of rounds required to explore any network composed of $n$ nodes. The second algorithm assumes that the upper bound $N$ of $n$ is given to agents and at least $4f^{2}+8f+4$ non-Byzantine agents exist, and achieves the gathering in $O((f+\vert \Lambda_{good}\vert)\cdot X(N))$ rounds. Both the algorithms allow agents to start gathering at different times. The first algorithm can terminate agents simultaneously, while the second one not. In this paper, we seek an algorithm that solves the gathering problem efficiently with the intermediate number of non-Byzantine agents since there is a large gap between the numbers of non-Byzantine agents in the previous works. The resultant gathering algorithm works with at least $8f+8$ non-Byzantine agents when agents start the algorithm at the same time, agents may terminate at different times, and $N$ is given to agents. To reduce the number of agents, we propose a new technique to simulate a Byzantine consensus algorithm for synchronous message-passing systems on agent systems. The proposed algorithm achieves the gathering in $o(f\cdot\vert \Lambda_{good}\vert \cdot X(N))$ rounds. This algorithm is faster than the first existing algorithm and requires fewer non-Byzantine agents than the second existing algorithm if $n$ is given to agents, although the guarantees on simultaneous termination and startup delay are not the same.
Author Keywords: Distributed algorithms;Byzantine environments;Gathering
IEEE Terms: Upper bound;Conferences;Consensus algorithm;Delays;Behavioral sciences;Reliability;Time complexity

Document Title: Accelerating Next Generation Genome Sequencing Leveraging High Bandwidth Memory on FPGAs
Authors: T. Lehmann; L. Wenzel; M. Plauth; S. Köhler; A. Polze
Author Affiliations: Hasso Plattner Institute for Digital Engineering, Operating Systems and Middleware Group, University of Potsdam, Germany; Hasso Plattner Institute for Digital Engineering, Operating Systems and Middleware Group, University of Potsdam, Germany; Hasso Plattner Institute for Digital Engineering, Operating Systems and Middleware Group, University of Potsdam, Germany; Hasso Plattner Institute for Digital Engineering, Operating Systems and Middleware Group, University of Potsdam, Germany; Hasso Plattner Institute for Digital Engineering, Operating Systems and Middleware Group, University of Potsdam, Germany
Publication Title: 2022 Tenth International Symposium on Computing and Networking Workshops (CANDARW)
Abstract: Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) technology im-poses high demands on the performance of read mapping software, leading to increased interest in leveraging hardware accelerators such as field programmable gate arrays (FPGAs). Only few works accelerating the state of the art read mapper BWA-MEM focus on the memory latency bound supermaximal exact match (SMEM) subroutine. With the advent of FPGA devices with on-package high bandwidth memory (HBM) resources, the applicability of such accelerators to the SMEM problem deserves reconsideration. This work introduces BWA-HBM, which accelerates the SMEM algorithm of BWA-MEM by offloading it towards an HBM-supported accelerator card. On a human reference genome the pure SMEM algorithm of BWA-HBM achieves a speedup of 36%, resulting in an overall runtime improvement of 15% compared to BWA-MEM.
Author Keywords: Field Programmable Gate Arrays;High Band-width Memory;Next Generation Sequencing;BWA-MEM;SMEM Algorithm;FM-Index

Therefore, high-quality physical assets management is related to the safety and stability of power grid business. Therefore, changing the thinking of asset evaluation, analysis and management, improving the management efficiency of physical assets and maximizing the value of physical assets will help to reduce the company’s costs and is of great significance to the company to increase revenue and reduce expenditure. Based on the concept of life cycle management, this paper deeply studies the evaluation method of life cycle management of physical assets, discusses the management points of the whole life cycle of physical assets planning and design, bidding construction, operation and maintenance, retirement and scrap, establishes the evaluation index system of the whole life cycle of physical assets, provides quantifiable evaluation tools for the management of physical assets at each life stage, and assists the staff to maximize the value of physical assets.

Therefore, this paper designs a joint trading platform for the electricity-carbon market based on blockchain technology. On the hardware, the ZYNQ-7045 core processor is designed. In the aspect of software, this paper establishes the joint transaction function module and analyzes the software architecture of the platform.
