Document Title: Improving Adversarial Detection Methods for SAR Image via Joint Contrastive Cross-entropy Training
Authors: Z. Zhang; S. Liu; X. Gao; Y. Diao
Author Affiliations: College of Electronic Science and Technology, National University of Defense Technology (NUDT), Changsha, China; College of Electronic Science and Technology, National University of Defense Technology (NUDT), Changsha, China; College of Electronic Science and Technology, National University of Defense Technology (NUDT), Changsha, China; College of Electronic Science and Technology, National University of Defense Technology (NUDT), Changsha, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Adversarial examples (AEs) have become a critical security concern for intelligent synthetic aperture radar (SAR) target recognition system. Current defense methods design certain distance metric to characterize the difference between AEs and natural samples in feature space, but expose severe performance degradation against SAR AEs with small perturbation scale. By exploiting Siamesed sample augmentation and feature wised contrastive regularization, we propose a joint contrastive cross-entropy training method to endow natural SAR test samples with more consistent distribution to training samples and higher separability from AEs. Experiments demonstrate that our method significantly improves the performance of current adversarial detections against SAR AEs especially when the perturbation scale is small.
Funding Information: National Natural Science Foundation of China;
Author Keywords: component;adversarial example;adversarial detection;synthetic aperture radar
IEEE Terms: Training;Representation learning;Technological innovation;Target recognition;Perturbation methods;Supervised learning;Radar detection

Document Title: Stress classification using multispectral imaging technology
Authors: K. Hong
Author Affiliations: Jiangxi University of Finance and Economics, Nanchang, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: The stress classification algorithms are proposed based on multispectral imaging (MSI) system in this study. By extracting spectral features from the facial region, it is feasible to arrive at some quantity which can be related to the physiological property or functionality. The proposed method has been tested, and the accuracy for the classification of physical stress (PS) and emotional stress (ES) is over 90% by using the MSI techniques. Therefore, the classification feature of emotional stress and physical are successfully obtained. Experiments show that the classification result is encouraging, and the highly successful rate stems from the fact that the manipulated spectral quantity agrees with the physiological ground truth very closely. This study can lead to a practical system for the noninvasive classification of stress states.

Abstract: This paper mainly studies the information fusion algorithm of healthy bracelet. At present, there are many healthy bracelets in the market and the quality is uneven. Since the medical measuring instruments with large volume and accurate measurement cannot be used in the design of healthy bracelets, only small volume optical heart rate sensors, accelerometers, thermometers, hygrometers, gyroscopes, light sensors, bio-resistance sensors, GPS and so on can be used, so that the measured data such as temperature and humidity, heart rate, blood pressure, oxygen saturation, individual action information are not accurate. At the same time, the amount of data collection is too large, the data analysis is complicated, and the market application is limited. In order to improve the performance of the bracelet, the advantages of the weighted average method and the probability and statistics method are absorbed in the design of the health bracelet algorithm, and the multi-sensor information fusion algorithm of projection pursuit method is integrated. The algorithm improves the real-time, reliability and adaptability of the health bracelet, and improves the functions of healthy bracelet in environmental temperature and humidity control, abnormal heart rate and blood pressure alarm, fall alarm, abnormal blood oxygen saturation alarm, sleep apnea alarm, location sharing medical assistance and motion step.

Document Title: Metamorphic Relations Prioritization And Selection Based on Test Adequacy Criteria
Authors: D. Huang; Y. Luo; M. Li
Author Affiliations: School of Computing, University of South China, Hengyang, China; CNNC Key Laboratory on High Trusted Computing, Hengyang, China; CNNC Key Laboratory on High Trusted Computing, Hengyang, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Metamorphic testing is the mainstream technique to solve oracle problems, and the effectiveness of metamorphic relations directly affects the testing cost. Most existing studies are summaries of engineering experience and lack theoretical discussions. A distance-based definition of metamorphic relation validity is provided, and a quantitative relationship model based on distance and test coverage is established to guide metamorphic relation selection and ranking. Experiments on four procedures and nearly 50 metamorphic relations show that, compared with random, coverage-based, and distance-based methods, this method has higher defect detection capability and can improve test effectiveness under the condition of using the same number of metamorphic relations. The number of metamorphic relations used in this method is lower than the number of programs under test and the cost of testing is lower while meeting the same defect detection level.
Author Keywords: component: Metamorphic relation;validity;test adequacy;Distance

Document Title: Relational Sequence Encoding Graph Attention Network for Aspect-based Sentiment Analysis
Authors: Y. Yang
Author Affiliations: Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications, Beijing, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Aspect-based sentiment analysis (ABSA) aims to classify all the aspects’ sentiment polarity in a sentence. However, most of the related research didn’t take full advantage of the dependency relations between words, the interaction between the node and its corresponding dependency relations is not taken into consideration, which causes the aspect words mistakenly focus on other context word. To solve these problems, a graph attention network model with relational sequence encoding (RSE-GAT) is proposed in this paper. The model constructs an aspect-rooted syntactic dependency tree, which constructs the representation of virtual connections and relation between aspect words and other words by dependency sequence encoding. At the same time, the composition operator is applied to enhance the interaction between word embedding and relation embedding. Finally, GAT is utilized for feature extraction. The experimental results on three public datasets demonstrate that the proposed RSE-GAT model achieves better results. Compared with the classical GCN-based model ASGCN[5], the accuracy on RES14, LAP14[9] and Twitter[10] is increased by 3.05%, 2.05% and 3.68% respectively.
Author Keywords: aspect-based sentiment analysis;syntactic dependence;Graph Convolutional Network (GCN);attention mechanism
IEEE Terms: Sentiment analysis;Technological innovation;Analytical models;Syntactics;Feature extraction;Encoding;Convolutional neural networks

Authors: J. Wang; C. Xie; C. Dong
Author Affiliations: Key Laboratory of Networked Control System Shenyang Institute of Automation Chinese Academy of Sciences Institutes for Robotics and Intelligent Manufacturing, Chinese Academy of Sciences ShenYang, China; Key Laboratory of Networked Control System Shenyang Institute of Automation Chinese Academy of Sciences Institutes for Robotics and Intelligent Manufacturing, Chinese Academy of Sciences ShenYang, China; Key Laboratory of Networked Control System Shenyang Institute of Automation Chinese Academy of Sciences Institutes for Robotics and Intelligent Manufacturing, Chinese Academy of Sciences ShenYang, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: The protocol Powerlink which is one of real-time Ethernet protocols included in the Standard IEC FDIS61784-2, has been widely used for the communication of both IO devices in industrial fields and drives for motor control applications to provide deterministic data transmission. When the Powerlink network is running in the industrial field environment, the online measurement of time related indicators is an appropriate method to evaluate the performance of the network in real time and detect communication faults between devices. In this paper, several time related indicators are proposed and analyzed to estimate the real time performance of the network when all devices get into the operate state. Further more, an efficient method to measure the proposed indicators based on frame analysis is presented and implemented on a PC-based monitor station that stores all the frames which transfer in the network and contain timestamp added by an FPGA-based probe. The measurement method is tested on a real network consisting of one master node and two slave nodes, and some experimental results are presented.
Author Keywords: industrial ethernet;Powerlink;frame analysis;time related indicator;measurement
IEEE Terms: Performance evaluation;Technological innovation;Protocols;Stability criteria;Ethernet;Real-time systems;Time measurement

Abstract: Rapid and effective space target recognition using ISAR images is a hot topic in the field of space situation awareness. Secondly, the ISAR image data is enhanced to improve the stability of the subsequent algorithm. Then, the network model is built based on MLP-Mixer framework. Abstract: In order to improve the performance of feature extraction, this paper proposes a new retrieval model based on coupled feature extraction. In this paper, we preprocess the big data, process the big data by distributed fusion, analyze the characteristics of the big data, extract its statistical features, and construct the big data distribution structure model. Document Title: Collaborative Governance Method of Power Application Data Based on Blockchain Technology
Authors: T. Zuo; E. Song; Z. Du
Author Affiliations: Guizhou Wujiang Hydropower Development Co., LTD., Guiyang, China; Guizhou Wujiang Hydropower Development Co., LTD., Guiyang, China; Guizhou Wujiang Hydropower Development Co., LTD., Guiyang, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: With the explosive growth of power application data, enterprises mainly carry out collaborative management of data quality through a manual review mechanism, which leads to a long time for standard terms to apply for review in the process of governance. In view of the problem that the audit time is too long, this study introduces the block chain technology into the governance process, and designs a new collaborative governance method for the power application data. Firstly, data collection mechanism and data consensus mechanism are combined to realize the collection and storage of power application data. The data cleaning mechanism is established to remove invalid data. Then, based on the block chain technology, a data quality collaboration model is built to standardize the data. Finally, the secure sharing of the power application data is realized through smart contracts. The experimental results show that when the number of spare words is 6×103, the time of application and approval of standard words is only 0. 83 min, which effectively improves the time efficiency of data collaborative governance.

Document Title: Neighbor-items Aware Graph Neural Networks for Session based Recommendation for large rotating units
Authors: J. Duan; X. Zhu; Y. Liu; G. Zhu
Author Affiliations: College of Software Engineering Jilin University, Changchun, China; College of Software Engineering Jilin University, Changchun, China; College of Software Engineering Jilin University, Changchun, China; College of Software Engineering Jilin University, Changchun, China
Publication Title: 2022 International Conference on Mechanical, Automation and Electrical Engineering (CMAEE)
Abstract: A lot of results have been achieved so far for session-based graph neural network recommendations, which aim to predict user behavior based on anonymous sequences of user actions. However, a large number of graph neural network-based session recommendations focus on the current session, which is short in length and contains limited information in most cases. Therefore, in this paper, we propose a novel graph neural network recommendation model based on neighbor item awareness. The model designs a session-aware encoder that efficiently aggregates neighbor item information with the help of global session information, and achieves session information enhancement while reducing the introduction of noise. Specifically, NA-GNN constructs a global session graph and a current session graph to model the influence of neighboring items on items and sessions: (1) Global session graph, by creating links to related items in all sessions and constructing root-mean-square-valued session perceptrons to explore the influence of neighboring sessions on items, and finally fusing out session representations of neighboring item features. (2) Current session graph, exploring item embedding by modeling pairwise item transitions in the current session. And, in this paper, we fuse the session representation with neighboring item information and the current session representation through an attention mechanism. Extensive experiments on two real-world datasets show that our approach consistently outperforms state-of-the-art methods.
Author Keywords: Recommender systems;Session-based recommendation;Graph networks

Document Title: Estimation of Underdetermined Sources of Co Frequency Interference Signal Based on GAVMD-SVD
Authors: R. Liu; Z. Yu
Author Affiliations: Rocket Force University of Engineering, xi’ an, China; Rocket Force University of Engineering, xi’ an, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Sharing the same frequency band for electronic equipment is easy to cause mutual interference of the same frequency, and the effective way to reduce interference is blind source separation technology. One of the necessary conditions for its implementation is to accurately estimate the number of source signals. In order to solve the problem that the number of the same frequency source signals is difficult to estimate accurately in the underdetermined case, a method for estimating the number of underdetermined sources based on genetic algorithm optimization of the combination of variational mode decomposition (GAVMD) and singular value decomposition (SVD) is proposed. First, the number of modes and penalty factors are combined and optimized through genetic algorithm, then VMD decomposition is performed on the observed signal using the optimal combination parameters, and new modal functions are obtained by combining multiple groups of modal components, and then singular value decomposition is performed on its covariance matrix. Finally, the estimated value of the source number is obtained through the analysis of singular values. The simulation results show that the method has good adaptability and estimation effect.
Author Keywords: Same frequency interference signal;Variational modal decomposition;Genetic algorithm;Singular value decomposition;Source number estimation

Abstract: In the province of Loreto only 56.3% have access to the public water network and only 8.2% of the population is stored 24 hours a day. Generating a problem for the inhabitants in the capital called Iquitos due to climate change and rapid population growth being a very important priority for life, however, rainwater in this area has an average rainfall of 7.07 mm / month, with a contact area of 28.15 km2 producing 199038.87 m3 / month of rainwater, currently the storage of this rainwater is controlled and monitored manually. This research shows the automation of the rainwater filling control for the supply by means of a filter to prevent damage to the components, in addition to low- and high-level indicators in the tanks as a safety and control measure. Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: During the construction of highway, railway and subway tunnel projects, the sections where the frame structure has not been re-strengthened are subject to a variety of internal and external stresses and are prone to deformation. when the deformation exceeds a certain threshold, there will be landslides, settlement and other dangerous situations. In order to solve this problem, a distributed millimeter wave radar deformation monitoring system is exploited and a high precision ranging algorithm is proposed to realize three-dimensional micro-deformation measurement of the target. Field experiments show that the system together with the deformation monitoring algorithm realizes the real-time deformation monitoring of tunnel cross-section structure during construction, and its accuracy and stability meet the requirements of tunnel environment. It provides a great safety guarantee for tunnel construction.

Document Title: Simulation Research on Path Planning of Manipulator Based on RRT* Improved Algorithm
Authors: X. Li; W. Qi; C. Zhang; H. Xu; M. Lei
Author Affiliations: PLA Troops of 63896, Luoyang, China; PLA Troops of 63896, Luoyang, China; PLA Troops of 63896, Luoyang, China; PLA Troops of 63896, Luoyang, China; PLA Troops of 63896, Luoyang, China
Publication Title: 2022 International Conference on Mechanical, Automation and Electrical Engineering (CMAEE)
Abstract: Path planning refers to searching for a collision-free path between the starting point and the target point according to some evaluation criteria in the environment with obstacles, which has always been the research focus in the field of robotics. In recent years, RRT* algorithm has attracted much attention because it can realize the gradual optimal solution of path planning, but it still has some shortcomings such as slow convergence speed, low path utilization rate and unsmooth path. In addition, unlike the path planning of mobile robots, which only needs to consider the path collision, the mechanical arm belongs to a series robot, and the links are clamped to each other, which directly affects the pose of the end effector through the change of the joint angle, so it is relatively more complicated to consider the rod collision. The main work of this paper is to propose an improved algorithm I-RRT* based on RRT *, and apply it to the path planning of manipulator. The simulation results show that this algorithm can well complete the task of path planning of manipulator, and it is advanced compared with traditional algorithms.
Author Keywords: path planning;manipulator;collision;joint angle;I-RRT*

Abstract: In the trusted transaction of virtual power plants based on the blockchain, the safe, efficient and flexible consensus mechanism is the key to determine the development of the future blockchain trading system. In order to meet the requirements of privacy and efficiency of power data consensus, a distributed consensus mechanism VPP-PBFT suitable for virtual power plant transaction blockchain is proposed. Firstly, a multi-agent based trusted transaction architecture of virtual power plant blockchain is designed to meet the transaction needs under large-scale node access. Secondly, credit evaluation indicators of market entities are designed, and a distributed consensus mechanism VPP-PBFT is proposed for virtual power plant transactions. Based on the credit value, system selection and node status change are realized, and monitoring node consensus process is added. Based on this, the consistency protocol of traditional PBFT consensus algorithm is simplified. The simulation of the example shows that VPP-PBFT consensus mechanism has the ability to judge the credit of market entities, improve the efficiency of consensus on the premise of ensuring the reliability of consensus, meet the transaction requirements of virtual power plants, and encourage market entities to maintain their own credit.
Author Keywords: virtual power plant;electricity trading;blockchain;consensus mechanism;credit evaluation;pbft;supervision node

Abstract: The automatic emergency braking system (AEB) can help the driver perform emergency braking. In this paper, the environment is modeled in Prescan, and the front information is detected through the sensor module. At the same time, the control strategy model of the automatic emergency braking system is established in Simulink, and the TTC algorithm is studied and analyzed. In the Prescan software, the virtual road traffic environment is established, the simulation test and analysis of auto emergency braking system are carried out, and the reliability of TTC algorithm in different road traffic environments is verified. Simulation analysis shows that the algorithm can accurately predict obstacles, thus ensuring personnel safety.

Document Title: Research on lightweight security aggregation transmission method for massive vehicle network interaction data
Authors: M. Yao; J. Zhang; S. Li; T. Yang
Author Affiliations: State Grid Tianjin Electric Power Company, Tianjin, China; State Grid Tianjin Electric Power Company, Tianjin, China; State Grid Information and Telecommunication Group Co., Ltd, Beijing, China; Tianjin University, Tianjin, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: In the process of vehicle-network interaction, privacy data is easy to leak and data collection and transmission resources are large. The existing aggregation algorithms cannot efficiently complete the rapid aggregation of vehicle-network interaction data and ensure safety. In this paper, an interactive data security acquisition scheme of vehicle network based on compressed sensing is proposed. Firstly, the whole network is randomly divided into non-overlapping clusters, and each electric vehicle node is regarded as a data sample. Then the random value is generated by using the Bernoulli matrix, which is used to construct the global sparse measurement matrix. Finally, the cluster head receives the measurement value and the Bernoulli random value from the child node, and the compression observation is carried out by the sink node. On the other hand, the aggregator can verify the collected data and send it to the power system control center for decryption. Due to the introduction of a trusted third party, this scheme can ensure the integrity of the data and deal with disputes between the smart grid control center and the user side. According to the test results, this algorithm has smaller reconstruction error and aggregation cost, which can effectively meet the safety efficiency requirements of the vehicle network interaction process.
Author Keywords: vehicle-network interaction;compressed sensing;the Bernoulli matrix;smart grid

Document Title: A Normal Vector Guided Partition Method for Atmospheric Phase Compensation in GB-SAR
Authors: P. Ou; T. Lai; Y. Tan; Q. Dan
Author Affiliations: School of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Sun Yat-sen University, Guangzhou, China; School of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Sun Yat-sen University, Guangzhou, China; School of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Sun Yat-sen University, Guangzhou, China; School of Electronics and Communication Engineering, Sun Yat-sen University, Guangzhou, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Ground-based synthetic aperture radar (GB-SAR) is a novel deformation measurement technique emerging in recent ten years and is widely used in the field of geological disaster and buildings deformation monitoring. The additional phase caused by the delay of electromagnetic wave propagation in the atmosphere, which is defined as the atmospheric phase (AP), is the main factor affecting the accuracy of the GB-SAR deformation measurement. The traditional compensation method based on the regression model has limited accuracy for the complex atmospheric environment due to few parameters and low order. With the idea of using plane instead of surface locally in surface integral, we propose a high-precision AP compensation method: Firstly, the atmospheric phase surface (APS) is divided into several sub-regions by using the spatially constrained normal vector (SCNV). Then, a three-dimensional plane is used to approximate a surface to obtain the estimation result of the APS in the subregion. The experimental results show that the proposed method can achieve high precision compensation results while minimizing the number of subregions and avoiding serious over-fitting, which is suitable for application in complex atmospheric environments.
Author Keywords: atmospheric phase;normal vector;ground-based synthetic aperture radar;complex atmospheric environment

Document Title: An Overview of Current technology of Skin-Attachable Haptic Interface
Authors: A. Dong
Author Affiliations: College of Electronic Science and Engineering, Jilin University, Changchun, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Skin-attachable haptic interface is a type of skin-integrated electronics aiming to create a vivid tactile experience on human skin. They are malleable, extensible, and portable. In this review, we explain the primary mechanism of the skin-attachable haptic interface based on the skin's tactile perception. Then we show the necessity of developing proper actuators for tactile sense generating. For these actuators, we categorized them as vibrotactile and kinesthetic actuators. Here we introduce their components, mechanism, and properties. And then, we show how to achieve high-resolution and multimodal operation in a skin-attachable haptic interface. Afterward, we discuss the advantage and disadvantages of current technology. The limitation of the energy system, the lack of synchronization of different types of sensing, and the block to external interference are mentioned in the discussion. In conclusion, we look forward to the future of the skin-attachable haptic interface and conclude that a crucial step for the skin-attachable haptic interface is to improve the application value to promote the development of the related industry. This paper has a guiding significance for understanding the development situation of skin-attachable haptic interface and looking for related research direction.
Author Keywords: vibrotactile actuator;kinesthetic actuator;high resolution;multimodal operation
IEEE Terms: Actuators;Materials science and technology;Technological innovation;Psychology;Interference;Skin;Haptic interfaces

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Computing tasks offload of the edge computing has a significant impact on edge devices energy consumption and load balancing. To reduce the total cost, an offloading strategy that combines energy consumption and load balancing degree is proposed. A task partitioning model is given to perform fine-grained division of computing tasks. Furthermore, the energy consumption model of computing task offloading is obtained through the time delay model, and then the cost function of computing task offloading is constructed in combination with the load balancing degree and energy consumption. With the task offloading strategy, the minimum cost of task offloading is obtained under the multiple constraints, and the path of computing task offloading is determined. The simulation results demonstrate that the strategy can significantly improve the load balancing of the edge server and the overall performance of the edge server.

Abstract: This research was carried out because of the communication barriers that currently exist between hearing impaired and hearing people. These barriers hinder their integration into society and affect their interpersonal relationships. The objective of the study was to propose the development of a stationary assistive robot capable of displaying sign language interpretation through the combination of data gloves and the D-CNN and LSTM algorithm to facilitate the communication of hearing-impaired children in Huancayo. The triple diamond research design was used, where the mind map and the lotus diagram were used for the delimitation and definition of the problem. In addition, the IDEF0 technique was used to obtain a structured design of the project system. A morphological matrix was also used to choose the best solution for the problem. The chosen design contemplates the use of an Arduino UNO, flex sensors, accelerometers and gyroscopes for sign detection. The main algorithm consists of the union of a deep convolutional neural network and a LSTM for a correct sign classification module. The proposed design proposes to visualize the conceptual development of the project mentioned above.

Abstract: Power internet of things (PIoT) is essential for enhancing the resilience and adaptability of power grid. Given the broad electricity coverage, the deployment of PIoT devices to remote areas is inevitable, which poses high challenge on the PIoT devices’ information acquisition, owing to the limited battery capacity of devices and coverage of BS. Therefore, a coverages coordinated multi-UAV trajectory optimization paradigm is constructed in this paper, where the UAVs and BSs are coordinated to supply comprehensive and efficient sensing services for PIoT devices. An adjacency correlated multi-UAV deployment scheme is proposed to maximize the covering areas. Then a coverage intersection based particle swarm optimization algorithm is proposed, where multi-UAV are coordinated to enhance the information acquisition efficiency of PIoT devices. Extensive simulation results validate the effective coverage rate and efficient information sensing of our algorithm.

Abstract: Meta multi-task learning-based virtual dispatching method for electric power is proposed to address the problem of insufficient capacity of electric power dispatchers in handling dispatch bearers of new energy sites, and to better improve the dispatching speech recognition accuracy and to conduct a comprehensive analysis of dispatching resources of new energy sites. We use multi-task learning to recognize the scheduling speech, analyze the accurate scheduling target, and use particle swarm optimization algorithm to obtain the best scheduling path to reach the scheduling target by minimizing the operating cost of new energy field stations, and issuing the scheduling command to the field stations. The analysis results show that the proposed scheme significantly improves the scheduling recognition time as well as the accuracy, and the speech recognition accuracy is higher than that of the Viterbi algorithm, which proves the effectiveness of the proposed method.

Publication Title: 2022 International Conference on Mechanical, Automation and Electrical Engineering (CMAEE)
Abstract: Growing renewable energy access poses serious challenges for traditional distribution network, especially from the point of view of uncertainty and volatility. In this paper, a new type of distribution network structure called honeycomb distribution network (HDN) is introduced, as well as the core device smart power/information exchange station (SPIES), which performs as the agent for power exchange and electricity trading. Firstly, the characteristics and benefits of HDN are described. Then the mathematical physics models of HDN system with the functions of multi-agent system are established. The two-level optimization operating model of HDN with multi-agent system is proposed and then solved and verified through a numerical simulation of simplified HDN system. The optimal results show that HDN with multi-agent system can realize the economic operation of the distribution network and the consumption of renewable energies, which reveal the potential of HDN in the future new power network.
Author Keywords: Distributed renewable energy;multi-agent system;microgrid cluster;smart grid;optimal dispatching

Document Title: Analysis of extreme operating gust influence on aerodynamic performance of wind turbine
Authors: W. Zhou; D. Zhang; M. Yang
Author Affiliations: College of Physics and Electrical Engineering, Liupanshui Normal University, Liupanshui, PR China; School of Mechanical Engineering, Dalian University, Dalian, PR China; College of Physics and Electrical Engineering, Liupanshui Normal University, Liupanshui, PR China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Wind turbines operate in an unstable and complex atmosphere environment, the unsteady loads caused by turbulence or sudden change in wind velocity/direction are not only affect the power output, but are also impact the fatigue life of structure. Common sources of the unsteady loads are the yawed flows and gusts, which easily spawned within the wind farm. The present study established a computational fluid dynamic (CFD) model in ANSYS FLUENT, for analyzing aerodynamic performance of full- scale horizontal axis wind turbine subject to extreme operating gust condition. The effects of extreme operating gust on low-speed shaft torque, angle of attack and lift/drag coefficients are investigated. The results show that in the extreme operating gust condition, if the value of upstream wind velocity exceeds the rated wind velocity, a significantly discrepancy of the low-speed shaft torque is shown during the process of wind velocity increasing and decreasing. The presence of extreme operating gust affects the sectional angle of attack, and variation continuously of angle of attack leads to the hysteresis of aerodynamic loads, leading to a dynamic stall phenomenon consequently. The dynamic stall degree gradually increases from the tip towards the root of the wind turbine blades.
Funding Information: Liupanshui Normal University;
Author Keywords: Wind turbine;Extreme operating gust;Aerodynamic characteristic;Dynamic stall;Numerical simulation

Document Title: The Temporal and Spatial Analysis of County Poverty Prevention in Ningxia Based on Night Light Remote Sensing Data
Authors: J. Li; Q. Zou; S. Luo; Y. Huang; J. Wang; Y. Lu
Author Affiliations: Ecological Spatiotemporal Big Data Perception Service Laborator, Guilin, Guangxi, China; Guilin University of Technology, Guilin, Guangxi, China; Guilin University of Technology, Guilin, Guangxi, China; Guilin University of Technology, Guilin, Guangxi, China; Guilin University of Technology, Guilin, Guangxi, China; Ecological Spatiotemporal Big Data Perception Service Laborator, Guilin, Guangxi, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Poverty is a perennial challenge for humanity in the 21st century, especially in developing countries. China is the world's largest developing country and its effectiveness in reducing poverty can serve as a reference for other countries in implementing poverty reduction. Luminous remote sensing images can reflect changes in social and economic development and provide a new means of monitoring poor and backward areas. This paper selects Ningxia, a western region with deep poverty, as the study area, establishes the Sustainable Livelihoods Framework (SLA) multidimensional poverty indicator system, extracts the Total Night Light Index (TNL) and the Average Night Light Index (ANL) based on night light remote sensing images, and uses them to construct a night light poverty index model, analyze the spatial distribution characteristics of Ningxia's poor counties, and conduct an in-depth probe into the influencing factors of poverty in Ningxia. The analysis of the results shows that in the Ningxia region, the nighttime light poverty model (MPITNL) constructed using the total nighttime light index (TNL) is better, with an R2 of 0.792 for the MPITNL model and an average relative error of 16.07%. Based on the poverty index fitted by MPITNL, a grading of poverty was carried out at the county level scale, and it was found that the poverty level in Ningxia deepened from the north to the south, with the south-central part of Ningxia being the region most vulnerable to poverty, with the six main influencing factors being altitude, per capita disposable income of urban residents, per capita disposable income of rural residents, the proportion of employed workers, urbanization rate, and investment in fixed assets. Finally, a two-factor interaction detection between the main factors was carried out using a geographic probe, in which the interaction between the share of employed workers and fixed asset investment had the greatest explanatory power, and the combined effect of these two factors had the most significant impact on the divergence of poor counties in Ningxia, where the resource allocation of social capital and human capital influenced the economic development of Ningxia.
Author Keywords: Luminous Remote Sensing;NPP-VIIRS;Multidimensional poverty;Poverty Index

Abstract: Under the background of building a new power system with new energy as the main body, the traditional grid investment benefit evaluation model can no longer meet the needs of the new situation. The traditional grid investment considers more issues such as grid operation security and stability, and pays less attention to the analysis of investment costs and investment benefits. Therefore, it is of great significance to carry out the research on the investment benefit analysis of grid projects considering large-scale distributed PV access. In this study, a calculation model of the maximum access capacity of distributed photovoltaic (DPV) system is constructed, with the maximum access capacity as the objective function and the operation safety of power grid equipment as the constraint condition; Secondly, taking the maximum access capacity of distributed PV as the boundary condition, a quantitative model of grid investment benefit considering distributed PV access is proposed; Finally, assist in formulating the DPV access strategy to improve the grid investment benefit, and maximize the grid investment benefit under the premise of ensuring the consumption of DPV.

Abstract: Digital twin emerges as a promising technology to bridge the connection gap between physical and information spaces. The high reliability and low latency sensing of the running state data of physical entities is the basis for the construction of digital twins. However, limited resources in edge cannot satisfy the extensive demands of physical entities. Therefore, a network sensing edge deployment optimization mechanism is constructed in this paper, where the edge deployed based on the network state to improve the management efficiency of physical entities. Firstly, a time-frequency correlation based activity estimation model is proposed to quantify the network state. Abstract: Automatic identification by machine vision is a promising technology which has been widely used in various field nowadays. Kiwi fruit is an important part of the fruit industry in Guizhou Province, Southwest China. When kiwi fruit grows ripe in large quantities, a manual sorting procedure will waste too much time to miss the best period of kiwi fruit on the market. Moreover, the cost of manual sorting is high. To solve those problems over Kiwi fruit harvest with inconsistent standard and low efficiency of macaque picking, this paper has proposed and designed a set of quality detection and sorting system for kiwi fruit based on vision sensors as well as pressure sensors. In the study, an STM32 micro-processor is as a control unit. A pressure sensors is to obtain fruit quality of kiwi and the image sensor is to obtain the size of kiwi. Afterwards, the obtained data return to the main controller to realize the classification of kiwi. The sorting system can save labor costs and improve the sorting efficiency and accuracy. The experimental results show that the proposed system can effectively complete the sorting tasks by using its cross-section area and weight, with a 98% accuracy.

Author Affiliations: Key Laboratory of Energy Big Data Simulation of Tianjin Enterprise, State Grid Tianjin Information & Telecommunication Company, Tianjin, China; Key Laboratory of Energy Big Data Simulation of Tianjin Enterprise, State Grid Tianjin Information & Telecommunication Company, Tianjin, China; Key Laboratory of Energy Big Data Simulation of Tianjin Enterprise, State Grid Tianjin Information & Telecommunication Company, Tianjin, China; Key Laboratory of Energy Big Data Simulation of Tianjin Enterprise, State Grid Tianjin Information & Telecommunication Company, Tianjin, China; Tianjin Key Laboratory of Energy Big Data Simulation Enterprises, State Grid Tianjin Information & Telecommunication Company, Tianjin, China; State Grid Tianjin Electric Power Company, Tianjin, China; State Grid Tianjin Electric Power Company, Tianjin, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: This paper proposed a new trust evaluation algorithm for Zero Trust Architecture (ZTA). Combined the score- based approach and the criteria-based approach, we introduced a Tag based Trust Evaluation (TBTE) framework. The tag generating process takes full consideration of the factors that affect the trust of an access subject, quantifying the security of the user behavior and the security posture of device. A simple trust evaluation rule is given by using the tag’s positive and negative feature, which improves interpretability of the trust result compared with the trust score-based evaluation and reduce the complexity of the authorization policy compared with the condition-based policy.
Author Keywords: Zero Trust Architecture (ZTA);Trust Evaluation (TE);Tag Access Control

Abstract: In order to address the impact of vehicle-station-grid interaction on multiple parties, a comprehensive evaluation method of "vehicle-station-grid" interaction strategy based on data-simulation fusion analysis is studied using entropy power method and hierarchical analysis for grid, traffic, users and charging stations, etc., which provides an economic, flexible and reliable interaction resource for the system and provides subsequent interaction The method will provide an economical, flexible and reliable interactive resource for the system, and provide directions for the improvement of the subsequent interactive operation strategy.

Document Title: Image Super-Resolution based on Feedback Non-Local and Second-Order Attention
Authors: X. Zhao; M. He; D. Zhou; X. Zhou
Author Affiliations: School of Information, Yunnan University, Kunming, China; School of Information, Yunnan University, Kunming, China; School of Information, Yunnan University, Kunming, China; School of Information, Yunnan University, Kunming, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Convolutional neural network has shown strong feature extraction capabilities in the field of image super resolution (SR). However, the existing image SR technology has the problem of not being able to make full use of the generated SR image features and making the effect poor. Therefore, a super-resolution reconstruction algorithm under the condition of limited network parameters is proposed. The suggested algorithm can enrich the generation of shallow features by using deep features through feedback transmission and improve the performance of image reconstruction without increasing computational complexity. Experimental results show that PSNR is 0.33dB higher than some existing methods, with better visual effects and richer texture details.
Author Keywords: convolutional neural network;image super-resolution reconstruction;feedback transmission;second order channel attention;non-local information enhancement

Document Title: A Web-Based Audio-to-Sign Language Converter for Chinese National Sign Language
Authors: P. Wang; N. Yin; K. Sujatha
Author Affiliations: College of Science and Technology, Wenzhou-Kean University, Wenzhou, China; College of Science and Technology, Wenzhou-Kean University, Wenzhou, China; College of Science and Technology, Wenzhou-Kean University, Wenzhou, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: About 20.54 million people in China suffer from hearing impairment, accounting for a quarter of the disabled population. However, only hundreds of thousands of people in China have revived formal sign language training. Therefore, for hearing-impaired people, how to communicate with ordinary people becomes a problem. Some articles have looked at converting sign language into text or audio. However, very few articles have dealt with how to help hearing-impaired people understand what ordinary people say. Therefore, this paper proposes a new method to convert audio into sign language video and play it on the web page. The main idea is to build a database based on Chinese common sign language and collect audio through computer microphones. After that, this method uses the Chinese word segmentation method of HanLP to segment words, and the obtained phrases are processed and matched with the database. After obtaining the database output, the videos are sorted and spliced by matching the original phrase list. Eventually, the stitched video will be played on the web. Experimental results show that the accuracy of this method is 90%. The relative code can be found at https://github.com/MelanthaWang246/A2SL-CN.
Author Keywords: Sign Language;Database;Speech Recognition;NLP
IEEE Terms: Training;Technological innovation;Databases;Sociology;Web pages;Gesture recognition;Oral communication

Document Title: Safe and Efficient Mobile Robot Path Planning in Open World Environments
Authors: Z. Yu; Q. Liu; D. Zhou; Q. Zhang
Author Affiliations: Department of Computer Science and Technology, Dalian University of Technology, Dalian, China; Department of Computer Science and Technology, Dalian University of Technology, Dalian, China; Department of Software Engineering, Dalian University, Dalian, China; Department of Computer Science and Technology, Dalian University of Technology, Dalian, China
Publication Title: 2022 International Conference on Mechanical, Automation and Electrical Engineering (CMAEE)
Abstract: An open world environment in mobile robot path planning generally refers to a working space with unpredefined/unknown obstacles. It is a challenging task for path planning in open world environments, especially those having multiple dynamic obstacles with time-varying moving speed. In this context, safety become the key performance indicator, resulting in most of global path planning algorithms (e.g., A*, RRT*, etc) no longer in force due to their inadequate adaptability to dynamic environments. Therefore, we propose in this paper a novel safety-aware RRT* algorithm for the path planning of mobile robots in open world environments with dynamic obstacles. We leverage the safety-field model (firstly developed for self-driving cars with constrained path, i.e. vehicle lane) to mobile robot path planning (with unconstrained moving routes in the working space in general). In particular, a fine-grained energy map is developed as a safety indicator illustrating the real-time risk to the working space caused by dynamic obstacles in terms of distance away from the robot (which presents the potential energy), moving direction and moving speed (which present the kinetic energy). This is in strong contrast to the artificial potential field model that is widely utilized in the obstacle avoidance in dynamic environments, which only considers the potential energy and provides a coarse risk indication to robots. In order to improve the efficiency of the proposed safety-aware RRT* algorithm, we further propose a pruning strategy for the sampling process of RRT* based on the fine-grained energy map to guide the rapidly-exploring random tree growing in a safe direction. The parent node re-selection and rewiring process of the proposed algorithm also incorporates the safety-field based energy map. Experimental results show that the proposed safety-aware RRT* algorithm can provide excellent safety and efficiency in dynamic environments.
Funding Information: National Science Foundation of China(grant numbers:62071083,U1908214); Fundamental Research Funds for the Central Universities(grant numbers:DUT21GJ208,DUT21TD107);
Author Keywords: path planning;mobile robot;RRT*;safety field

Document Title: Numerical study of aerodynamic noise characteristics of bionic pantograph head for high-speed trains
Authors: B. Cai; C. Liu; L. Wei; X. Zhou; B. Chen
Author Affiliations: School of Locomotive and Rolling Stock Engineering, Dalian Jiaotong University, Dalian, China; School of Locomotive and Rolling Stock Engineering, Dalian Jiaotong University, Dalian, China; School of Locomotive and Rolling Stock Engineering, Dalian Jiaotong University, Dalian, China; School of Locomotive and Rolling Stock Engineering, Dalian Jiaotong University, Dalian, China; School of Locomotive and Rolling Stock Engineering, Dalian Jiaotong University, Dalian, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: In recent years, the noise problem for high-speed trains is increasingly the focus of researchers. The pantograph is an important device to receive power from the pantograph catenary. The bowhead in the pantograph is the major noise source of the pantograph. Based on the bionic principle, the bowhead with semicircular cross-section is proposed through the resistance- breaking swimming behavior of penguins. The CFD and noise simulation models for rectangular bowhead and the optimized semicircular bowhead are built by using the separated vortex simulation and the FW-H acoustic analog equation. The aerodynamic noise characteristics and spectral characteristics for rectangular bowhead and semicircular bowhead are analyzed. The results show that the semicircular bowhead with bionic structure could decrease the noise of pantograph, and the far-field noise is reduced by 7.384dB, 7.264dB and 8.123dB under three monitoring points at the speed of 350km/h.
Author Keywords: high-speed train pantograph;bionic bowhead;aerodynamic noise characteristics;spectral characteristic curve

Document Title: Modeling and Simulation of Dedicated Railway Transportation Dispatching System Based on Petri Net
Authors: X. Bai; Q. Chen; L. Sun; Q. Teng
Author Affiliations: Center for Cadre Education Research Chongqing, Chongqing Technology and Business University, China; Center for Cadre Education Research Chongqing, Chongqing Technology and Business University, China; School of Automation and Electrical Engineering, Lanzhou Jiaotong University, Lanzhou, China; School of Automation and Electrical Engineering, Lanzhou Jiaotong University, Lanzhou, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: With the continuous expansion of production and transportation scale of enterprises, and the complex and changeable workflow, the current railway transportation dispatching system has fallen far short of satisfying the demands of the enterprises' ongoing development. How optimize the transportation dispatching system to improve quality and efficiency, and ensure safety and reliability is an urgent problem to be solved. Firstly, this paper discusses the characteristics of the railway transportation dispatching system, analyzes the typical transportation workflow in detail, and the Petri Net theory which is suitable for describing concurrent, synchronous, and resource-competitive systems is proposed to analyze the system. Secondly, a typical complex business system is selected as an example and modeled using Petri Net, performance analysis and correctness validation of the model are realized, and an optimization strategy is proposed. Finally, the simulation results show and verify the feasibility and effectiveness of the Petri Net theory applied to the complex system of enterprise railroad transportation dispatching, which provides theoretical support for optimizing business processes and scientific model support for the system design and development.
Funding Information: National Natural Science Foundation of China; Chongqing Technology and Business University;

Authors: F. Wang; J. Wang; H. Wang; R. Zheng

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Aiming at the composition analysis and identification methods of ancient glass products, this paper proposes a clustering method based on Topsis and K-means. It uses the Topsis method to divide the subcategories of ancient glass based on K-Means unsupervised classification. Among the high- potassium glass types, the composite score index of silica (SiO2), potassium oxide (K2O), alumina (Al2O3), and calcium oxide (CaO) was higher. Among the lead-barium glass types, the composite score index of silica (SiO2), lead oxide (PbO), barium oxide (BaO), and phosphorus pentoxide (P2O5) was higher. The top four elements with the total score were selected, k-means clustering was used to subclassify ancient glass artifacts, and the model’s sensitivity was well-known by linear regression. It points out a new method of analyzing and identifying glass products, which is of great significance for investigating the exchange and dissemination of ancient glass objects and technologies.
Author Keywords: K-means algorithm;topsis method;unsupervised classification;sensitivity analysi

Document Title: Consumer-transformer Relationship Identification Based on UMAP and Mini Batch K-Means
Authors: F. Chen; H. Tang; S. Zhou; W. Hua; Y. Zhao; X. Zeng; Y. Li; P. Hu
Author Affiliations: Electric Power Research Institute, State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power, Hangzhou, China; Taizhou Power Supply Company, State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power, Taizhou, China; College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; Electric Power Research Institute, State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power, Hangzhou, China; Taizhou Power Supply Company, State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power, Taizhou, China; Taizhou Power Supply Company, State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power, Taizhou, China; College of Electrical Engineering, Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; Electric Power Research Institute, State Grid Zhejiang Electric Power, Hangzhou, China
Publication Title: 2022 International Conference on Mechanical, Automation and Electrical Engineering (CMAEE)
Abstract: The accuracy of the relationship between single-phase users and transformers in low-voltage areas has an important impact on the analysis of line loss management. At the moment, the identification of consumer-transformer relationship mainly relies on manual checking, which is lack of efficiency. Therefore, an efficient and reliable method for identifying the relationship between consumer and transformer is urgently needed. In this paper, a consumer-transformer relationship identification method based on voltage data recorded by a smart meter is proposed, which provides a reference for the line loss analysis in low power distribution network. Firstly, the UMAP technique is chosen to reduce the dimensionality of the voltage data to deal with the redundancy caused by the high dimensionality of the original load characteristics of the users in the station area. After that, the mini batch K-means algorithm is applied to realize the identification of the consumer-transformer relationship in the low-voltage area. Finally, the proposed method is validated in simulation models. The results indicate that the method works.
Author Keywords: UMAP dimensionality reduction;Mini Batch K-means Algorithm;Consumer-transformer Relationship Identification

Authors: X. Zhang; Y. Lin; M. Wang; D. Yang; X. Zhou

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: In order to solve the problem of equipment shutdown or damage during key periods caused by frequent voltage sags. An ultra short-term power load prediction method based on improved load derivation method is proposed. By analyzing the types and characteristics of load in key periods, the power load in key periods of equipment is predicted. According to the prediction results, the guarantee strategy of diesel generator in key periods is formulated, and relevant verification test are carried out. The results show that the prediction accuracy rate is over 90%, the average relative error of the system is 4.7%, and the average prediction accuracy of the system is over 95%. Predictive analysis results are applied to power guarantee during key periods, improving the reliability and stability of power supply.

Authors: W. Huang; L. Liang; Q. Zeng; R. Zhou; B. Ao

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Aiming at the problems of poor accuracy and efficiency of intelligent construction site behavior anomaly recognition, this paper proposes a method of intelligent construction site behavior anomaly recognition based on Markov random field. The video clip conversion is used to complete the image acquisition of abnormal behavior of smart construction site. Build an image data set of abnormal behaviors of intelligent construction site, and use feature word mining to achieve intelligent construction site behavior classification and image processing of abnormal behaviors of intelligent construction site. Based on the classification of abnormal behavior images of intelligent construction site in Markov random field, the identification function of abnormal behavior of intelligent construction site is constructed, and the result of abnormal behavior identification of intelligent construction site is obtained. The experimental results show that the method in this paper takes only 22.6s to identify the abnormal behavior of intelligent construction site, the recognition accuracy is 99.6%, which shows that the method in this paper has a good effect on identifying the abnormal behavior of intelligent construction site.

Document Title: Research on distribution of power supply chain based on risk propagation model
Authors: X. Xie; H. Ji; X. Xu; B. He
Author Affiliations: State Grid Shanghai Extra High Voltage Company, Shanghai, China; State Grid Shanghai Municipal Electric Power Company, Shanghai, China; State Grid Shanghai Extra High Voltage Company, Shanghai, China; State Grid Shanghai Extra High Voltage Company, Shanghai, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: The risk of a power network will bring huge social influence. To ensure the stable operation of transmission lines, the risk of the power network should be assessed and emergency supplies should be allocated to ensure the emergency needs. Based on the transmission network risk transmission model, this paper predicts the possible risk scale, takes the shortest emergency rescue time and minimum transmission network loss as the goal, and optimizes the distribution route of emergency rescue materials for transmission lines based on the NSGA-II algorithm. The distribution plan shows that the distribution of vehicle loads and travel distances is reasonable, which can complete the transportation of emergency supplies in the shortest time and at the lowest cost. Simulation results show that the improved NSGA-II algorithm can effectively solve the multi-objective distribution path optimization problem of emergency supplies.

Document Title: Image defogging algorithm based on sky area recognition
Authors: Y. Li; Y. Fan
Author Affiliations: School of Electrical and Control Engineering, Liaoning University of Engineering and Technology, Liaoning, China; School of Electrical and Control Engineering, Liaoning University of Engineering and Technology, Liaoning, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Foggy weather severely reduces the image quality and increases the difficulty of obtaining aerial image information from UAVs. In this paper, an image defogging algorithm based on sky region recognition is proposed, which solves the problems such as inaccurate estimation of sky region transmittance, halo, and color distortion after restoration. Firstly, this paper uses the improved Otsu algorithm to divide the image into sky region and non-sky region, and obtains the atmospheric light value by identifying the sky region. Secondly, the light transmittance of non-sky region is obtained by using the adaptive dark channel constructed by local information entropy, and the light transmittance of sky is obtained by using the improved linear model. Then, the overall transmittance is fused and refined. Finally, Leigh obtained the initial recovery image in the atmospheric scattering model, and the final image was obtained by adaptive color adjustment. The experimental results show that the algorithm has a good defogging effect, and both subjective and objective evaluation is better than the related algorithms.
Author Keywords: unmanned aerial photography;computer vision;image defogging;atmospheric scattering models;adaptive dark channel
IEEE Terms: Image quality;Adaptation models;Technological innovation;Image recognition;Image color analysis;Atmospheric modeling;Scattering

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Automatic image segmentation is critical for medical image segmentation. For example, automatic segmentation of infection area of COVID-19 before and after diagnosis and treatment can help us automatically analyze the diagnosis and treatment effect. The existing algorithms do not solve the problems of insufficient data and insufficient feature extraction at the same time. In this paper, we propose a new data augmentation algorithm to handle the insufficient data problem, named Joint Mix; we utilize an improved U-Net with context encoder to enhance the feature extraction ability. Experiments in the segmentation of COVID-19 infection region using CT images demonstrate its effectiveness.

Document Title: Depthwise Separable Convolutions based relation network for few-shot learning
Authors: Q. Liu; X. Ke; T. Xue
Author Affiliations: Shanghai University, Shanghai, China; Shanghai University, Shanghai, China; Shanghai University, Shanghai, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: In recent years, few-shot learning has attracted more and more attention, because it is very similar to human learning mechanism, requiring only a small amount of data to learn concepts. Relation network is a very classic few-shot learning model, which adopts end-to-end training method. Recent research in the field of meta-learning shows that exploring the relationship between features can effectively improve the accuracy of the model. In this paper, a depthwise separable convolution based relation network is proposed to learn the relationship between the channel features of the support set and the query set. First, the wide residual network is introduced to extract more abundant features, and the depthwise separable convolution is used to replace the original relational model. Experiments show that the performance of the model proposed in this paper is better than the original relational network. Our method pushes 5-way 1-shot mini-Imagenet accuracy to 52.25% (2.09% higher than the baseline) and 5-way 5-shot mini-Imagenet accuracy to 66.79% (1.47% higher than the baseline) .
Author Keywords: Few-shot learning;Feature representation;Metric-based model
IEEE Terms: Training;Technological innovation;Convolution;Feature extraction;Residual neural networks

Document Title: Model and Algorithm for Pick-up Site Optimization Considering Evacuation Demand and Crowd Convenience
Authors: M. Gao
Author Affiliations: School of Traffic and Transportation, Lanzhou Jiaotong Uniersity, Lanzhou, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: The location of crowd pick-up sites is of great practical significance in the regional evacuation planning. Most of the previous studies were from a single point of view of managers or evacuees, and there is a lack of comprehensive studies. Considering evacuation demand and the convenience of evacuees, a two-objective optimizing model is constructed to optimize the selection of evacuation pick-up sites from the set of alternative ones, in which the goal is to maximum the coverage of evacuation demand and to minimize the total walking time of evacuees. Based on the characteristics of the model, an improved algorithm based on heritage algorithm is designed, and a numerical example is given. The results show that a more feasible site selection scheme can be obtained by combining the two aspects.
Author Keywords: Bus evacuation;Location of pick-up sites;Requirements coverage;Total walking time;multi-objective optimization

Document Title: Classification of Blueberry Varieties Based on Improved EfficientNet
Authors: M. Yi; C. Zhao; F. Liao; W. Yao
Author Affiliations: College of Physics and Electronic Information Engineering, Zhejiang Normal University, Jinhua, China; College of Physics and Electronic Information Engineering, Zhejiang Normal University, Jinhua, China; College of Chemistry and Life Sciences, Zhejiang Normal University, Jinhua, China; College of Physics and Electronic Information Engineering, Zhejiang Normal University, Jinhua, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: A method to classify blueberry varieties based on an improved EfficientNet is proposed, aiming at the high cost of manual classification and the difficulty of manual confirmation of new varieties. First, considering that there are few datasets of blueberry leaf samples available on the internet, blueberry leaf samples from different seasons are collected and photographed, and four blueberry leaf image datasets are established, including germination, maturity, dormancy, and mixed stages. Second, to better allocate feature weights, an improved EfficientNet is introduced to generate a blueberry variety classification model. Finally, experiments on different datasets are conducted using different models for blueberry variety classification. For the recognition results of the dormant-stage dataset, the accuracy rate of the improved EfficientNet method reaches 99.85%, exceeding EfficientNet-B1 by 3.05%. For the recognition results of datasets of the germination, maturity, dormancy, and mixed stages, the accuracy rates of the improved EfficientNet method are 98.50%, 99.65%, 99.85%, and 97.92%, respectively. These results show that the improved EfficientNet can be applied to blueberry variety recognition with a high recognition rate, and it has a certain robustness to different periods of leaves. This research can provide new inspiration and technical support for blueberry variety recognition.
Author Keywords: component;blueberry variety identification;leaf images;EfficientNet-B1;CBAM
IEEE Terms: Training;Technological innovation;Image recognition;Costs;Manuals;Interference;Feature extraction

Document Title: Simulation Analysis of Ammonia Diffusion from Vent Mast
Authors: T. Zhan; Z. Jiang; T. Wang; C. Zhao; W. Zeng
Author Affiliations: Sunrui Marine Environment Engineering Co., Ltd, Qingdao, China; Sunrui Marine Environment Engineering Co., Ltd, Qingdao, China; Sunrui Marine Environment Engineering Co., Ltd, Qingdao, China; Sunrui Marine Environment Engineering Co., Ltd, Qingdao, China; Sunrui Marine Environment Engineering Co., Ltd, Qingdao, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Based on the vent mast of LNG ship type, this paper simulates the concentration distribution of ammonia when it is discharged through the vent mast with the maximum discharge in three cases: windless weather, bulk carrier and container ship, and explores the optimal safety range of the vent mast and whether it can meet the relevant requirements of Classification Society. The results show that when there is no wind, when the ship is docked or bunkered, the safe distance radius of the vent mast is at least 30m. On the premise that the distance from the ventilating mast to the stern is 150m, the bulk carrier sails at a speed of 25km/h, and the dangerous space should be above the range of 40m×20m×150m (width×height×length). Large container ships sail at a speed of 45km/h, and the dangerous space should be more than 30m×20m×150m (width×height×length). In the event of large-scale leakage or discharge of ammonia gas, crew members need to wear protective equipment when entering this area.
Author Keywords: Ammonia;Vent Mast;Diffusion Simulation
IEEE Terms: Ammonia;Wind;Vents;Containers;Ventilation;Discharges (electric);Safety

Document Title: Design of Daily Clearing and Monthly Settlement System for Electricity Market
Authors: M. Wu; Y. Hong; X. Li; F. Liu

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: With the accelerated construction of power spot market, the complexity of regional market transactions is increasing, the scale of trans regional and trans provincial transactions is increasing, and the development of inter provincial and intra provincial spot markets put forward new requirements for power grid inter provincial electricity settlement. This paper analyzes the functional requirements of the electricity settlement system in the electricity market environment, proposes the design scheme of daily and monthly electricity settlement system for the electricity market from two aspects of functional architecture and technical architecture, and designs detailed electricity settlement rules to improve the efficiency of electricity settlement and support the stable operation of the electricity market.

Document Title: A Backbone Grid Planning Method against Disasters in Transmission Grid
Authors: Y. Tang; Y. Lin; Y. Shi; R. Guo; W. Wu
Author Affiliations: Department of Power Grid Planning, State Grid Fujian Economic Research Institute, Fuzhou, China; Department of Power Grid Planning, State Grid Fujian Economic Research Institute, Fuzhou, China; Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; Zhejiang University, Hangzhou, China; Department of Power Grid Planning, State Grid Fujian Economic Research Institute, Fuzhou, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: The frequent occurrence of natural disasters in recent years has posed a great threat to the power system, especially to the transmission grid. The backbone power grid consists of transmission lines with higher design standard, and is assumed to be able to stand against natural disasters. A backbone grid planning model against disasters is proposed to deal with this problem. This model aims to minimize the cost of differentiated strengthened lines and ensure critical loads supply. Moreover, the backbone grid should meet both the constraints of normal operating state and the secure operating constraints under disasters. Meanwhile, the model adopts "virtual flow" to ensure the connectivity of the backbone grid. The method of inequality constraint separation is used to convert the model into a 0-1 mixed integer linear programming model. The validity of the proposed model and algorithm is verified through simulation tests in IEEE 118 bus system.
Author Keywords: transmission grid planning;transmission grid against disasters;backbone grid;planning cost;topology connectivity
IEEE Terms: Technological innovation;Power transmission lines;Costs;Design standards;Power grids;Planning;Mixed integer linear programming

Document Title: Simulation design and performance analysis of Aircraft Landing Gear Hydraulic Extension/Retraction System
Authors: A. Yao; C. Ma; Z. Qian; Z. Zhao; Y. Lu
Author Affiliations: School of Civil Aviation, Northwestern Polytechnical University, Xi'an, China; School of Civil Aviation, Northwestern Polytechnical University, Xi'an, China; School of Civil Aviation, Northwestern Polytechnical University, Xi'an, China; School of Civil Aviation, Northwestern Polytechnical University, Xi'an, China; School of Control Science and Engineering, Dalian University of Technology, Dalian, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Aircraft Landing Gear Extension/Retraction System is an indispensable flight security supporting system on the aircraft, which is very important for the normal take-off and landing of the aircraft. Therefore, it is urgent to simulate the internal state of aircraft landing gear and the correlation between components. Aiming at the problems of wide fault relationship, difficult positioning, strong coupling and difficult analysis in the landing gear extension/retraction system of a certain type of aircraft, the control principle of the system is analyzed, and the AMESim software is used to design the control loop of the hydraulic extension/retraction system of the aircraft landing gear, and the system simulation model is established.Through the simulation analysis of the dynamic and static characteristics of the system, the influence of the change of the performance parameters of these components on the working characteristics of the system is studied, and then the key state parameters of the system are monitored and analyzed. The internal working conditions of the system are mastered in time, and the fault symptoms are found as soon as possible to improve the reliability of the system. The simulation results show that the state data of various aircraft landing gear hydraulic telescopic systems during operation can be simulated by reasonably setting the performance parameters of each component, which lays a large amount of data foundation for the subsequent health management of the landing gear hydraulic extension/retraction system.
Author Keywords: aircraft landing gear;hydraulic;system simulation;AMESim

Authors: J. Shen; X. Jiang; J. Zhong; S. Yao

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: With the development of the short video, video processing technology is becoming more and more important, among which video scene change detection is an important basic technology. However, due to the inconspicuous feature of scene gradual change, the current algorithm cannot detect it very well. Based on this, we proposed a new scene change detection algorithm. The new algorithm is designed based on the structural similarity (SSIM) algorithm, an index to measure the similarity of two images, and the changing law of structural similarity sequence during scene change. Meantime, we designed a new measurement based on sequence statistics to measure the variation law of SSIM sequences. Experiments show that the algorithm has the characteristics of anti-interference and anti-noise, and it can well solve the above difficulty.

Abstract: In the era of Big Data, the Internet constantly penetrates people's lives, work and research. People are generating new data all the time. In order to separate new data from a large amount of data and get satisfactory results, search engines came into being. One of the essential branches of research in natural language is text similarity computing. This paper proposes a weight-based optimisation algorithm based on a multi-feature fusion algorithm. Using a non-uniform partitioning method, the granularity of the feature fingerprints is varied, resulting in a wide variation of accuracy. The most important feature is the flexible and fast resizing of the partition number to change the vector value. It has been demonstrated experimentally that the method in this paper can save partitioning time. The method in this paper can solve the problem of many vector dimensions in word frequency statistics methods and can better measure the similarity between texts. The method can be widely used in various query scenarios, such as searching taxi maps, orders and routes.

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: In order to solve the problem of low accuracy of image classification caused by incomplete feature information extracted by convolutional neural network and indistinguishable feature information, an image classification algorithm combining local feature and attention was proposed. Firstly, patch layer is added to obtain multiple patch images before extracting image features, and feature extraction is carried out at both global and local levels. VGG16 is used as the backbone network to extract patch image features. Then, for each patch image, feature attention is carried out in the channel domain and spatial domain respectively to obtain important patch channel information and spatial information. In addition, in order to further constrain the feature attention of patch image, the patch attention aggregation loss is proposed to penalize the weights of irrelevant regions and strengthen the attention of important patch regions, which makes the extracted feature information more discriminative, so as to facilitate classification and improve the final classification performance. The experimental results on CIFAR-10, CIFAR-100 and RAF-DB datasets show that the classification performance of the proposed algorithm is significantly improved compared with other advanced methods.
Author Keywords: attention mechanism;image classification;deep learning

Document Title: Analysis of spatial distribution characteristics and influencing factors of rural tourism in Zhejiang Province based on ArcGIS
Authors: Y. Wu
