Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: This article lists 100 beautiful rural demonstration villages in Zhejiang Province and 200 demonstration villages in Zhejiang Province for high-standard rural household waste classification As the research object, the spatial distribution direction, scope, spatial structure type and spatial distribution density of rural tourism in Zhejiang Province were systematically analyzed by using the econometric geographic analysis method, the standard deviation ellipse method, the average nearest neighbor method and the kernel density analysis method by using the Econometric geographic analysis method. The results show that the development of rural tourism in Zhejiang Province is relatively balanced, and there is not much difference between north and south, among which the development of rural tourism in northern Zhejiang is slightly better than that in southern Zhejiang. According to the spatial distribution characteristics of rural tourism in Zhejiang Province, we summarize the influencing factors of rural tourism in Zhejiang Province, among which tourism location, policy factors, infrastructure construction and tourism resources are the key elements of rural tourism in Zhejiang Province to promote the high-quality development of rural tourism in Zhejiang Province, and at the end of the paper, we propose that future research can consider traffic factors such as road density and distance between rural and urban areas as key elements of rural tourism.

Document Title: Design of ultra-broadband metamaterial absorber based on impedance matching theory

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: We propose an absorber design method based on the equivalent circuit model and impedance matching theory, and verify its capability by designing an ultra-wideband fractal disc metamaterial absorber. In this paper, we calculated the absorption characteristics and electromagnetic field distribution by using the finite-difference time-domain method. The numerical results show that the absorption band of the absorber ranges from 300 nm to 6000 nm with an average absorption rate of 97.4%. The proposed absorber has a bandwidth of 5700 nm with an absorption rate greater than 90%, and the analysis of the arbitrary polarization angle shows that the absorption rate is insensitive to the polarization angle. For TM and TE waves with large angular oblique incidence, the average absorption still exceeds 85%. The wideband and high absorption is mainly attributed to surface plasmon resonance, localized surface plasmon resonance, slow-wave effects, and their interactions. An absorber with ultra-wide absorption band, high absorbance, insensitivity to polarization, and wide-angle absorption has potential applications in solar energy harvesting, optical communication, and invisibility devices.
Funding Information: Nature; Key Research and Development Program of Jiangxi Province; Research and Development;

Abstract: Coordinated Multiple Points (CoMP) is proposed to improve the performance of cellular communication systems further. While improper base station selection may hurt network performance, building an appropriate base station cluster for users is essential. However, many current methods will damage edge users’ Quality of Service (QoS) while increasing the total system throughput; hence, fairness between users cannot be guaranteed. In this paper, based on the theoretical basis of many-to-many matching, we have defined the preference list of users and base stations and described the exchange matching conditions, matching blocking pairs, and stable matching. While ensuring the overall quality of service fairness of users, we can help each user find the best number of service base stations as much as possible to improve the system’s total throughput. The simulation results show that, compared with the distance-based clustering algorithm and Reference Signal Receiving Power (RSRP) based clustering algorithm, our proposed method increases the total system throughput by 12%, and more than 88.56% of users reach the average system throughput.

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: To solve the problem of overlapping, repeated and contradictory terms in different kinds of electric power standards, we propose a method of discrepancy distinguishment for the electric power standard clauses based on natural language processing (NLP). The proposed method converts the unstructured text into triples using the entity relation extraction method for power standard terms, and stores them in knowledge graph to reduce the query time and the processing time. Then, the text similarity calculation method is used to compute the similarity of triples. Finally, the discrepancy distinguishment of standard terms can be obtained. Taking power grid equipment technical standard difference clause data as an example, experiments were carried out, and the recall and the precision reached 82.2% and 70.6% respectively. The experimental results illustrate that the recognition rate and adoption rate reached 82.2% and 70.6% respectively. It also shows that the proposed method could provide a solution to the discrepancy distinguishment of standard documents in various industries.

Abstract: As the key component of the solid rocket engine, the tailpipe nozzle's performance impacts on the motion torque or the motion force a lot. The servo system is undoubtedly a determining factor on adjusting quality of the tailpipe nozzle. In order to guarantee high precision and great efficiency, the electro-hydraulic servo system is a good choice. For the simple reason that the output torque or output force of just one actuator in the electro-hydraulic servo system is not enough for adjusting heavy load, the synchronous control of at least two actuators is adopted. An electro-hydraulic system with two cylinders is designed in this paper. The detailed system design is introduced in the beginning. And then the start process and the halt process for synchronous control is presented. The experimental part demonstrates performance of the electro-hydraulic system. At last, the conclusion part summarizes its applications. The electro-hydraulic system designed in this paper provides an ideal choice for adjusting of the tailpipe nozzle.

Authors: H. Liu

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Predicting traffic flow is a crucial component of the Intelligent Transportation System. However, the complicated spatiotemporal correlation of traffic road network nodes proposes challenges for traffic flow prediction. To improve modeling performance, we propose an innovative deep learning-based model named DTSTGNN. Decoupled Traffic Spatial-Temporal Graph Neural Network (DTSTGNN). In DTSTGNN, the original traffic signal is decoupled into an instantaneous fusion signal and a long-term dependent signal, which are captured by two well-designed modules, the instantaneous fusion module and the long-term dependency module. To capture the varying dependencies between nodes, we design an adaptive dynamic adjacency matrix in the instantaneous fusion module. Long-term dependencies are caught by introducing multi-head self-attention layers. The effectiveness of our model is demonstrated by extensive experiments on two real traffic datasets.
Author Keywords: Keywords-traffic flow prediction;graph neural network;spatial-temporal dependencies;attention mechanism

Authors: Y. Xiong; W. Wang; L. Luo; H. Chen; J. Gong; X. Wu
Author Affiliations: Economic Research Institute State Grid Jiangxi Electric Power Company, China; Economic Research Institute State Grid Jiangxi Electric Power Company, China; Economic Research Institute State Grid Jiangxi Electric Power Company, China; School of Electric Power Engineering, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, China; Economic Research Institute State Grid Jiangxi Electric Power Company, China; School of Electric Power Engineering, South China University of Technology, Guangzhou, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Affected by many factors such as the development of the electricity market and extreme weather, it is very difficult to obtain high-performance short-term load forecasting methods. The day-ahead load forecasting of power system is deeply studied by dividing 24-hour period into several time sub-periods, clustering similar days separately, and building multiple sets of models for collaborative optimization. As a result, an improved short-term load forecasting method is proposed by considering similar days and time division. First, the total data set is divided into several data subsets based on the time division result. Then, Fuzzy C-Means (FCM) algorithm is applied to each data subset and several classes are grouped according to the characteristics of load segments. Next, multi-groups of Whale Optimization Algorithm (WOA) and least squares support vector machine (LSSVM) models are established to train the data subsets filtered by the category of the day before the prediction date. Finally, the improved model which considering similar day clustering and period partitioning, the FCM and WOA-LSSVM combined model which does not consider period partitioning and the traditional WOA-LSSVM model are used to predict the day-ahead load data of Jiangxi Province. The result of the experiment shows that the improved method can combine the advantages of similar day clustering and optimization based on load characteristics in different periods, which has high prediction accuracy and practical application value.
Author Keywords: Load forecast;Least squares support vector machine;Fuzzy c-means;Whale optimization algorithm;Electricity market

Abstract: In view of the problem that the current extracorporeal cardiopulmonary support equipment only has the function of pumping blood, and requires full-time personnel to operate frequently, and the degree of intelligence is low, this paper designs an intelligent flow control system for extracorporeal cardiopulmonary support based on blood oxygen feedback, which realizes the system’s independent constant flow blood perfusion. The overall design idea and architecture of the system based on STM32 and TX2 are given. The hardware composition based on STM32, software design idea and implementation method are described in detail. Experiments are carried out based on the human simulation platform. The experimental results show that the system can perform constant flow blood perfusion autonomously and adjust the perfusion volume intelligently to maintain the human oxygen saturation between 65% and 75%. At the same time, the system can be connected with the remote control center through the Internet of Things to achieve remote monitoring of equipment status. The degree of automation and intelligence of extracorporeal cardiopulmonary support equipment has been generally improved.

Abstract: As an important power equipment in the power grid, the high-voltage cable faces the hot spot temperature problem caused by excessive load fluctuation, long-term operation, and other factors. The overheating of high voltage cable not only accelerates the aging of insulation, but also causes a lot of economic losses due to serious inter-turn short circuits. The heat generated in long-term operation will also cause deformation or even burning damage to the cable core. In this paper, a digital twin of high-voltage cable based on the driving model and data-driven is proposed, which simulates the dynamic operation process of time and space with the traditional modeling, and depicts the overall structure of high-voltage cable digital space. The high-voltage cable digital twin platform is established through the multi-field coupling model and the temperature prediction model to realize the real-time multi-physical field distribution of the high-voltage cable and calculate the thermal aging situation according to the hot spot temperature, thus completing the construction of the high-voltage cable digital twin. Experiments indicate that the error between the multi-physical field simulation based on the digital twin model and the test value is very small, which meets the needs of the project, has a stable prediction ability, improves the calculation accuracy and fitting degree, and proves the feasibility of the method used.

Authors: Z. Liu

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: With the rapid development of power switching in the semiconductor industry, the switching frequency levels of power electronic circuits are rising rapidly, placing higher demands on real-time simulation. Existing real-time simulation platforms have limited simulation speed, and faster real-time simulation methods are needed. This paper analyses discrete iterative algorithms. An improved trapezoidal method, analysed from the point of view of the computational process, is proposed to improve the speed of operations by using historical data. The computational flow of the variable-step algorithm in real-time simulation is analysed on basis of the classification of switching events. An improved trapezoidal method is applied to the variable-step algorithm to establish a numerical computation structure using weight value improvements, saving the computational resources of the FPGA. A real-time simulation platform based on a fixed number of points was built on an FPGA development board, and the effectiveness of the simulation platform building method was further demonstrated by comparing the results with offline simulation software.

Abstract: The maintenance and management of power equipment in substation is the key to ensuring the power system operation's stability. Currently, the substation information management system needs more intuition and authenticity when displaying information in a 2D way, and it is challenging to render 3D model data. To solve this problem, on the basis of using 3ds Max to build the substation 3D model, the coarse-grained culling algorithm based on CPU and GPU batch processing technology is adopted to improve the rendering efficiency of 3D model data. Based on Unity3D platform and MySQL database, a 3D visualization management platform for substation equipment is designed and developed. Interactive functions such as roaming from different perspectives, visual information management, and query and update of equipment maintenance information are designed, which can intuitively display the components, specific information, and operating status of each device. Finally, a regional substation scene is taken as an example for testing, and good application results are achieved.

Author Affiliations: The College of Information and Communication Engineering, Hainan University, Hainan, China; The College of Information and Communication Engineering, Hainan University, Hainan, China; The College of Information and Communication Engineering, Hainan University, Hainan, China; The College of Information and Communication Engineering, Hainan University, Hainan, China; The College of Information and Communication Engineering, Hainan University, Hainan, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: A nonlinear gain adaptive sliding mode control method based on disturbance observer is designed to solve the problem of ship modeling error and 3DOF fully driven ship trajectory tracking control disturbed by unknown external environment. In this method, the error between the current position and the expected position of the ship and the error between the current speed and the expected speed are comprehensively considered to design a nonlinear gain adaptive dynamic sliding mode surface. the nonlinear gain effectively weakens the chattering phenomenon of the traditional sliding mode control input, and a disturbance observer is introduced to estimate the uncertain disturbances caused by external unknown environmental disturbances and modeling errors. By selecting the appropriate Lyapunov function, the controller can ensure the ultimate uniform boundedness of all signals in the trajectory tracking system. Finally, the simulation verification is carried out based on a transport ship, and the results show that the designed controller can ensure that the transport ship can achieve effective trajectory tracking, and has high tracking accuracy and strong robustness to modeling errors and unknown disturbances caused by the external environment.
Author Keywords: adaptive sliding mode control;disturbance observer;trajectory tracking

Document Title: A parameter selector of OFDM waveform based on GAMP algorithm
Authors: J. -Y. Wang; C. -s. Yang; J. -H. Lia

Abstract: Orthogonal frequency division multiplexing (OFDM) signal has become one of the most promising technologies in satellite communication modulation due to its effective anti-frequency selective fading and high spectrum resource utilization. However, in power limitation of satellite communication, OFDM signal produces nonlinear distortion with clipping because of the high peak-to-average power ratio issue. It was recently shown that generalized approximate message passing (GAMP) algorithm has good effect in dealing with the problem of nonlinear distortion of the clipped OFDM signal, but it will also lead to the reduction of signal spectrum utilization. This puts forward higher requirements for the design of OFDM waveform parameters. In this paper, an improved waveform parameter selector based on GAMP algorithm is proposed, which for design the signal system of OFDM and optimize the parameters of OFDM signal with different clipping ratios requirements. The simulation results show that the spectral utilization of OFDM is significantly improved.

Author Keywords: Orthogonal frequency division multiplexing (OFDM);Peak to Average Power Ratio (PAPR);generalized approximate message passing (GAMP);spectral utilization;waveform parameter selector

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: The connectivity of a graph is a fundamental property of a graph. Connectivity is a portrayal of the degree of connectivity of a diagram. The level of connectivity of a graph is an important representation of the structural properties of the graph, and many properties of the graph are related to it. It corresponds to the "degree of reliability" of the network in communication networks. The connectivity of the communication network topology is the key to ensure that the system can operate properly. However, communication networks are often subject to different types of attacks that can cause nodes to lose their ability to transmit information. To this end, this paper proposes a path connectivity assessment algorithm based on continuous sniffing to identify the attacked nodes based on a new definition of connectivity assessment in response to randomness attacks. The experimental validation of this algorithm is also carried out with an 8th order undirected network as an example, and finally, the research idea of network connectivity is discussed, which will be an effective and novel idea for network connectivity assessment.

Abstract: In order to improve the throughput of power Internet of Things and reduce end-to-end delay, a congestion control algorithm based on bandwidth estimation for power Internet of Things is proposed. Build the architecture of the power Internet of Things, and estimate the bandwidth of the power Internet of Things from the perspectives of the bandwidth of the external channel of the node and the bandwidth occupied due to the queuing delay according to the architecture characteristics. Authors: T. Wang

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Software systems introduce an increasing number of configuration options to provide flexibility and customizability for users. As configurations in mature systems become increasingly complex, configuration errors have become one of major causes of software failure. Due to the complexity of the correlation between configuration options and operating environment, misconfiguration diagnosing faces many challenges, such as low efficiency of program analysis and incomplete statistical data. In order to improve the efficiency and accuracy of diagnosing configuration errors, we propose a method to construct a database of historical configuration errors, and use information retrieval to troubleshoot configuration errors. We design and implement ConfErrShooter, which first extracts log features for known configuration errors and recommends potential misconfigurations by detecting the similarity between the new failure logs with known log features. We use manual and real-world error cases from MySQL, PostgreSQL and Httpd to evaluate the effectiveness. The result shows the accuracy reaches 86% for the manual error cases, and 73% for real-world cases.

Authors: Y. Sun; G. Lu; J. Zhao; W. Yang; D. Wang; S. Zhang; M. Guo; C. An
Author Affiliations: China Research and Development Academy of Machinery Equipment, Beijing, China; China Research and Development Academy of Machinery Equipment, Beijing, China; China Research and Development Academy of Machinery Equipment, Beijing, China; China Research and Development Academy of Machinery Equipment, Beijing, China; China Research and Development Academy of Machinery Equipment, Beijing, China; China Research and Development Academy of Machinery Equipment, Beijing, China; China Research and Development Academy of Machinery Equipment, Beijing, China; China Research and Development Academy of Machinery Equipment, Beijing, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Warning radar simulation is an extensive research topic, in which intervisibility simulation, radar echo simulation and receiver noise simulation are technical difficulties. Extensive research has been carried out at home and abroad to solve this problem. This paper presents a warning radar simulation model, which includes the basic module of warning radar simulation, frequency matching and jamming power simulation, intervisibility simulation, radar echo simulation, receiver noise simulation, comprehensive signal to interference ratio simulation, discovery probability simulation and so on. The key technology of warning radar simulation is realized. Combined with the actual project, good results have been achieved.
Author Keywords: insert warning radar;simulation model;frequency matching;jamming power

Document Title: Modeling and Analysis of Airport Surface Traffic Flow Based on Variable Cell Transmission Model
Authors: M. Guo; M. Hu; F. Liang; Z. Zhao
Author Affiliations: National Key Laboratory of Air Traffic Flow Management, Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, Nanjing, China; National Key Laboratory of Air Traffic Flow Management, Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, Nanjing, China; National Key Laboratory of Air Traffic Flow Management, Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, Nanjing, China; National Key Laboratory of Air Traffic Flow Management, Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, Nanjing, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Based on the analysis of the macroscopic characteristics of the traffic flow in a large busy airport, this paper explores the relationship between the basic parameters of the traffic flow and its phase transformation process. Firstly, considering the physical structure of airport surface and ground control rules, this paper uses the variable cell transmission model to simulate the surface operation. Then, the macro characteristics of the traffic flow in taxiway and apron area are analysed by constructing the fundamental diagrams. It is proved that there is an interconnection between the basic parameters such as flow, velocity and density. With the change of parameters, the traffic presents three phase states as free-flow state, metastable state and blocked state, and the evolution characteristics of traffic flow are different in different states. The results of this paper can provide theoretical support for airport surface operation management.
Author Keywords: Cell Transmission Model;Surface Operation;Traffic Flow
IEEE Terms: Analytical models;Technological innovation;Atmospheric modeling;Computational modeling;Roads;Airports;Surface treatment

Document Title: Chinese text summary generation based on Seq2Seq framework
Authors: L. M. Meng; W. M. Qi; Y. K. Zhou
Author Affiliations: Jianghan University, Wuhan, China; Jianghan University, Wuhan, China; Jianghan University, Wuhan, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: The sequence-to-sequence model based on recurrent neural network shows good results in the practical application of text summary generation. However, most of these models have two problems: generating summary repetition and exposure bias. To solve the text repetition problem, a combined self-attention mechanism and a pointer network are used to overcome the problem by storing attention for each generated time step, using a combined reinforcement learning and maximum likelihood estimation to alleviate exposure bias, correcting the loss function through secondary training. When the scheme is evaluated in the LCSTS Chinese dataset, the ROUGE value is calculated to prove that the model can be alleviated by text repetition and reinforcement learning by training the pointer network, and the scheme is very effective on the test set.
Author Keywords: text summary generated;reinforcement learning;pointer network
IEEE Terms: Training;Technological innovation;Maximum likelihood estimation;Recurrent neural networks;Reinforcement learning;Hybrid power systems;Decoding

Publication Title: 2022 International Conference on Mechanical, Automation and Electrical Engineering (CMAEE)
Abstract: Face detection is widely used in human-computer interface, security access, visual surveillance and other fields, but the accuracy and speed are two key problems which need to be solved. We proposes an improved face detection method based on the existing AdaBoost algorithm. By locating the face area according to the structural features and skin color features, we can judge whether it is the final target face according to the overlap of the detected target area. Experiments show that the method has obvious effect in improving the detection accuracy.
Author Keywords: AdaBoost;Face detection;Skin color features;Face structure

Document Title: Research and application of substation operation auxiliary command technology

Abstract: Based on the application of MR technology in the power system, mainly focusing on the three-dimensional display of the whole resources of the power grid, this paper projects the whole resources of the power grid to the real world through the technology of holographic projection, superimposes the power grid resource data based on 3D GIS, spatial GIS, spatial modeling and other technologies, and realizes the roaming interaction of the whole resource of the power grid through gesture operation. It mainly realizes the command function of a series of related tasks such as ticket making, simulation rehearsal, and reverse gate operation, automatically generates the operation process according to the operation ticket, and checks the accuracy of equipment and location in real time, and adopts high-tech means such as cloud computing, intelligent analysis, wireless positioning, and graphic recognition functions to ensure that the operation is simple, systematic and intelligent, and ultimately maximizes safety benefits.

Document Title: Operation of Residential Integrated Energy System under Integrated Demand Response
Authors: Z. Bo; L. Bin; C. Ximing; G. Yeping; Z. Kangzhen; W. Pin; Z. Yuanjie; Z. Shikang
Author Affiliations: Marketing Department, State Grid Anhui Electric Power Co., Ltd, Hefei, Anhui, China; Marketing Service Center, State Grid Anhui Electric Power Co., Ltd, Hefei, Anhui, China; Marketing Service Center, State Grid Anhui Electric Power Co., Ltd, Hefei, Anhui, China; Marketing Service Center, State Grid Anhui Electric Power Co., Ltd, Hefei, Anhui, China; Marketing Service Center, State Grid Anhui Electric Power Co., Ltd, Hefei, Anhui, China; Marketing Service Center, State Grid Anhui Electric Power Co., Ltd, Hefei, Anhui, China; Marketing Department, State Grid Anhui Electric Power Co., Ltd, Hefei, Anhui, China; Marketing Department, State Grid Anhui Electric Power Co., Ltd, Hefei, Anhui, China
Publication Title: 2022 International Conference on Mechanical, Automation and Electrical Engineering (CMAEE)
Abstract: The integrated energy system is an important carrier to improve energy utilization efficiency and promote the coordination and complementarity of multiple energy sources. In view of the complex multi-energy flow load demand in the residential integrated energy system (RIES) and insufficient consideration of the subsidy mechanism for user participation in demand response, a solution is proposed. The economic dispatch method of intelligent buildings that takes into account the comprehensive demand response. First of all, a building integrated energy system model of combined cooling, heating and power is constructed. Secondly, according to the user's temperature comfort and electricity price demand response, a flexible load demand model including cooling and heating load reduction and electric load transfer is established, and a comprehensive demand response mechanism based on stepped compensation is established. Then, an economic dispatch model with the goal of maximizing system operating profit is constructed, and the CPLEX optimizer is used to solve it. Finally, a simulation example shows that the building integrated energy system optimization strategy that takes into account the comprehensive demand response can coordinate the resources on both sides of supply and demand, and improve the economic benefits of the system and users.
Author Keywords: RIES;Building heat storage characteristics;integrated demand response;Multi-energy optimal scheduling

Document Title: Machine-Learning based Transportation Network Sparsification for IoT Trucking Automation and Optimization
Authors: D. Chang; Z. Wang; X. Zhang
Author Affiliations: Department of Computer Science, University of Georgia, Athens, Georgia, USA; School of Artificial Intelligence, Jianghan University, Wuhan, China; School of Artificial Intelligence, Jianghan University, Wuhan, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: As the rapid manufacturing and industrial development, Internet of things (IoT) has become a key role in AI-smart transportation network especially for smart trucking automation and routing optimization. A maximum spanning k-tree algorithm is proposed to optimize the minimal loss of information from original network G to the spanning k-tree. The proposed network sparsification algorithm re-modelling IoT network in one of major U.S. trucking companies achieves great improvement of over performance. The novel Markov k-tree based network sparsification automates route generation, which practically results in increasing truck velocity, accelerating freight to recover service, creating a flexible inventory of loads-in-transit, re-balancing capacity and freight demand. In summary, it also gives a feasible approach to more practically and safely utilize auto-pilot truck based on a real-time sparsified IoT network.
Author Keywords: Markov k-tree network learning;stochastic graph learning;transportation network sparsification;Internet of things;IoT trucking network;real-time optimization algorithm

Document Title: Learning from the history: Identifying configuration change in software development
Authors: Y. Zhang
Author Affiliations: College of Computer Science, National University of Defense Technology, Changsha, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Configuration design and implementation is a major develop activity of modern software systems. With the everyday evolution of code base, configuration changes also happen frequently. These changes contain a wealth of information and knowledge for developers to better design and manage their software configuration. However, those changes are drowning in the tremendous of commits, which are difficult and time-consuming for developers to find and study on. To help developers and users better understand configuration design and implementation. This paper presents a method to automatically identify configuration change in software development. By understanding the code pattern of configuration code, we design a text-based configuration program analysis for code diffs in commits. The experiment result shows that our tool can achieve an average of 87.7% accuracy.
Funding Information: National Natural Science Foundation of China;
Author Keywords: component;Configuration Change;Software Evolution;Commit Identification

Document Title: An Adaptive Rate Allocation Method for Distributed Compressive Video Sensing
Authors: J. Xia; M. Ma; Z. Xie
Author Affiliations: School of Information Science and Engineering, Yunnan University, Kunming, China; School of Information Science and Engineering, Yunnan University, Kunming, China; School of Information Science and Engineering, Yunnan University, Kunming, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: The rate-distortion performance of distributed compressive video sensing (DCVS) can be improved by adaptive block-based compressive sensing (ABCS). However, the original frames are not available in DCVS, ABCS cannot directly perform adaptive rate allocation according to the sparsity of blocks. To solve this problem, this paper proposes an inter-block correlation based adaptive rate allocation method for distributed compressive video sensing. Specifically, we define the inter-block correlation and calculate the inter-block correlation of each block from the initial measurement. By exploiting these inter-block correlations, more measurements are allocated to texture regions in the original frame, while fewer measurements are allocated to smooth regions. Meanwhile, we use the multihypothesis method to estimate the side information frame at the decoder. Experimental results indicate that the performance of the proposed scheme is effectively improved when compared with other adaptive sampling schemes.
Funding Information: National Natural Science Foundation of China;
Author Keywords: Keywords-distributed compressive video sensing;adaptive rate allocation;inter-block correlation;multihypothesis

Document Title: Intentional knowledge map representation learning method based on fusion of action roadmap
Authors: W. Wu; X. Gong; Y. Wang
Author Affiliations: School of Computer Science and Engineering, NanJing University of Science and Technology, NanJing, China; Troop of 63850, BaiCheng, China; School of Computer Science and Engineering, NanJing University of Science and Technology, NanJing, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Affective knowledge graph constructs the objective world from the perspective of knowledge representation learning, and has certain reasoning and analysis capabilities. The reasoning analysis of the objective world includes intention analysis. The action and behavior route of the intention analysis is constructed as an event knowledge graph, and the relationship between the nodes in the event knowledge graph is used to explain the intention, and the intention analysis task can be completed by constructing the knowledge representation. However, in intention analysis, the number of actions and the position of actions in the overall action route are important indicators in the task of intention analysis. However, most of the knowledge graphs are two-node relationships, and the study of the position of nodes in the relationship only considers Symmetrical relationship. Aiming at the problem, a representation model of super nodes is proposed, in which information is integrated into the model, and attention is paid to network data set to test knowledge link prediction tasks. Experiments show that the model also achieves good results in the link prediction task.
Author Keywords: Event Knowledge Graph;Intent analysis;supernode;knowledge link prediction Introduction
IEEE Terms: Representation learning;Technological innovation;Correlation;Knowledge graphs;Transforms;Predictive models;Data models

Document Title: Research on NEV Battery Fixation State Detection Based on CNN
Authors: Y. Zhang
Author Affiliations: Department of Electronic Information, University of South China, Hengyang, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: As the heart of the new energy vehicle, the battery is extremely important to ensure its safety on the road, and all screws used for fixing must be firmly installed. Therefore, based on the CNN framework, a model is designed that can monitor and judge whether the screws on the lower surface of the car battery fall during the process of power change. The algorithm solves a classification problem, and there are two kinds of output results: normal screw fixation and screw fixation abnormal. The model design takes convolution, pooling layer, and normalization as the main three functions to carry out the extended design. Reasonable samples and thresholds are designed to output normal or risk pictures and result in information after a series of processes such as input pictures, cropping, feeding models, and inference results. Through a reasonable model to achieve the goal of intelligent judgment. The implementation of this algorithm is not limited to one kind of battery fixed detection and can be extended to various industrial scenarios later. It only needs to adjust the judgment area, which has excellent application value.

IEEE Terms: Heart;Technological innovation;Convolution;Roads;Fasteners;Inference algorithms;Batteries

Document Title: Spacecraft Operation Process Monitoring and Fault Diagnosis System
Authors: F. Yang; J. Cai; J. Liu; J. Wang; M. Wang; F. Guo
Author Affiliations: Beijing Institute of Control Engineering, Beijing, China; Beijing Institute of Control Engineering, Beijing, China; Beijing Institute of Control Engineering, Beijing, China; Beijing Sunwise Space Technology LTD, Beijing, China; Beijing Institute of Control Engineering, Beijing, China; Beijing Institute of Control Engineering, Beijing, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: With the growth of spacecraft scale and the complexity of spacecraft functions, the management of spacecraft operation process is developing automatically and intelligently. In this paper, based on the telemetry data, a knowledge-based diagnostic rule base is constructed by using flexible diagnostic rule customization methods to achieve automatic interpretation and early warning of spacecraft operation status. According to the fault state, this system matches the fault diagnosis model and intelligently diagnoses and reasons the fault mechanism. Through reasoning the results, the fault contingency plan is launched and the fault is handled. The application of the system achieves the automatic on-orbit maintenance, improves the efficiency of the ground test, enhances the ability of fault detection and emergency treatment of the on-orbit spacecraft, and reduces the working pressure of the on-orbit maintenance personnel in the TT&C base.

Document Title: Distributed Optical Fiber Monitoring Technology for Monitoring the Ultra-high Temperature and Pressure in Exploitation by Fire Flooding
Authors: F. Zhang; T. Li
Author Affiliations: Drilling & Production Technology Institute of Liaohe Oilfield Company, Panjin, China; Drilling & Production Technology Institute of Liaohe Oilfield Company, Panjin, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Fire flooding, a key successive technology in later stage of thermal recovery of heavy oil, has entered the stage of industrialized field test. To make effective monitoring on ultra-high temperature and pressure in the process of ignition for fire flooding, gold coated pure silicon optical fiber was selected, a type of "1+6" structural twisted optical cable armored in steel tube was designed and intrinsic optical fiber F-P cavity pressure sensor with microgroove was developed. Further, 1064nm-wavelength laser device was selected as the core for demodulating gold coated optical fiber and distributed temperature demodulator under double actions of 1064nm-wavelength and 980nm-wavelength lasers was developed. On this basis, an ultra-high temperature and pressure monitoring system for exploitation by fire flooding was researched and developed. Based on the test results of temperature and pressure at each oil reservoir, the well depth was corrected in four steps, including depth correction after well completion, depth correction after setting by packer, depth correction at oil reservoir and verification after ignition. Moreover, the ignition scheme for fire flooding was optimized as per the law of well temperature changing with ignition time and well depth as shown dynamically in the spectrogram in order to guarantee the successful implementation of industrialized field test for fire flooding.
Author Keywords: Fire flooding;Distributed optical fiber;Temperature and pressure monitoring
IEEE Terms: Temperature sensors;Temperature measurement;Pressure sensors;Gold;Oils;Ignition;Reservoirs

Document Title: HiL Virtual System for an Industrial Process, Control and Monitoring: Sulfuric Acid Production
Authors: J. F. Toaquiza; A. E. Tutasig; E. P. Pruna; I. P. Escobar
Author Affiliations: Universidad de las Fuerzas Armadas ESPE, Sangolqui, Ecuador; Universidad de las Fuerzas Armadas ESPE, Sangolqui, Ecuador; Universidad de las Fuerzas Armadas ESPE, Sangolqui, Ecuador; Universidad de las Fuerzas Armadas ESPE, Sangolqui, Ecuador
Publication Title: 2022 International Conference on Mechanical, Automation and Electrical Engineering (CMAEE)
Abstract: Virtual environments allow the incorporation of new forms of study in process control. Thus, the Hardware in the Loop takes shape in training fields. In this article, a virtual environment of the sulfuric acid production process is developed. The three-dimensional model of the system is based on a natural system that is replicated in Blender software, and the virtual system is implemented in Unity 3D to simulate its behavior. This system is developed in the Hardware in The Loop approach, in which a process is simulated, and real devices perform the control. The interaction with the outside is a Human Machine Interface; this interface allows control and monitoring. In addition, the system provides support in the learning process of an operator in the process control area because interacting with a PLC in a physical way and applying tuning methods in real control loops without running risks brings the user closer to the work environment. The main result of this project is to obtain professional training tools in the field of process control.
Author Keywords: Virtual Environment;Control and Monitoring;Hardware in The Loop

Document Title: Application of Machine Vision Technology in 3D Printing Quality Inspection System
Authors: Y. Zhang; Y. Zhang; X. Song; Y. Li
Author Affiliations: Department of Robot Engineering, Xijing University, Xi’an, China; Department of Mechanical Engineering, Xijing University, Xi’an, Shaanxi, China; Department of Mechanical Engineering, Xijing University, Xi’an, Shaanxi, China; Department of Mechanical Engineering, Xijing University, Xi’an, Shaanxi, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: 3D printing has the characteristics of rapid prototyping, but this technology by layer-by-layer printing to construct objects, the prevalence of low precision molding problems. Machine vision technology is easy to realize information integration because of its automation and intelligence. It is of great significance to improve the accuracy of 3D printing products by analyzing the size, location, distribution and type of printing defects by using the processing algorithms related to machine vision technology. This paper summarizes the image processing algorithm of 3D printing quality detection system based on machine vision. Through the fusion and upgrading of traditional processing algorithms, combined with the image acquisition characteristics and reconstruction requirements of 3D printing process, the accuracy of image acquisition and preprocessing, feature point extraction and image matching is improved.

Document Title: Robust Singular Spectrum Analysis
Authors: W. Zhu
Author Affiliations: School of Mathematical Sciences, Beihang University, Beijing, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: As an adaptive signal decomposition method, singular spectrum analysis has been affected by sparse outliers, which bring serious deviation. In order to correct the singular spectrum distribution, we study a novel robust singular spectrum analysis method. Convex relaxation robust principal component analysis and Hankel matrix structured constraints construct robust singular spectrum analysis (RSSA) to recover potential singular spectrum and estimate sparse noise. RSSA can be used as a preprocessing method, and improve the robustness of subsequent applications to outliers. Preliminary experiments show the effectiveness of RSSA.
Author Keywords: robust singular spectrum analysis;robust principal component analysis;hankel matrix;outliers;proximity operators

Document Title: Optimized implementations of stream cipher ZUC-256 algorithm
Authors: S. Wang; R. Zhao; Z. Yu; L. Wang
Author Affiliations: Research Institute of Frontier Information Technology, Zhongyuan University of Technology, Zhengzhou, China; Research Institute of Frontier Information Technology, Zhongyuan University of Technology, Zhengzhou, China; National Supercomputing Center in Zhengzhou, Zhengzhou University, Zhengzhou, China; Research Institute of Frontier Information Technology, Zhongyuan University of Technology, Zhengzhou, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: ZUC-256 is a more secure stream cipher based on ZUC-128 developed independently by China, which emerged mainly to cope with the advent of 5G communication and the post-quantum cipher era. Based on the ZUC-256 encryption algorithm, this paper focuses on its working phase and proposes two optimization methods for the working phase, one is a pipelined structure that focuses more on increasing the frequency, and the other is based on the specificity of the modulo operation in the algorithm, which focuses on reducing the resource overhead. The final validation results show that the first method increased frequency by 37.2% and the second method reduced resource overhead by 18.7%. These two optimization methods show that the ZUC algorithm is quite flexible in balancing different throughputs with resource overheads.
Author Keywords: Stream Cipher;ZUC-256;Pipelined Structure;Modulo Operation

Document Title: Face Recognition Based on Collaborative Sparse Representation with Dictionary Learning
Authors: M. Yao; Y. Feng; Y. Lu; B. Jin
Author Affiliations: Ocean College, Jiangsu University of Science and Technology, Zhenjiang, China; Ocean College, Jiangsu University of Science and Technology, Zhenjiang, China; Tongcheng Network Technology Co., Ltd, Suzhou, China; Ocean College, Jiangsu University of Science and Technology, Zhenjiang, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: For sparse face recognition algorithm lacking of identification information, face recognition based on collaborative representation with dictionary learning is proposed. Firstly the LC-KSVD dictionary learning algorithm is used to get a discriminant dictionary. The collaborative sparse representation algorithm is conditioned to complete the classification, the sparse coefficients of the sample in the dictionary are solved by using the L2 norm instead of the L1 norm. The collaborative representation is accustomed to calculate the residuals of each category. Finally, the category is got by comparison. Experimental results on the common face database show that the algorithm can effectively improve the recognition rate without reducing the speed.
Author Keywords: Face recognition;dictionary learning;sparse representation;sparse coding;image processing

Author Affiliations: State Grid Intelligence Technology Co., Ltd., Jinan, China; State Grid Intelligence Technology Co., Ltd., Jinan, China; State Grid Intelligence Technology Co., Ltd., Jinan, China; State Grid Intelligence Technology Co., Ltd., Jinan, China; State Grid Intelligence Technology Co., Ltd., Jinan, China; State Grid Intelligence Technology Co., Ltd., Jinan, China; State Grid Intelligence Technology Co., Ltd., Jinan, China; State Grid Intelligence Technology Co., Ltd., Jinan, China; State Grid Intelligence Technology Co., Ltd., Jinan, China; State Grid Intelligence Technology Co., Ltd., Jinan, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: With the continuous expansion of transmission line scale, line inspection has faced great challenges. To solve the problems of high labor intensity, low efficiency, and difficult working conditions in traditional manual inspection, autonomous inspection based on unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) came into being. In this paper, an electrical component recognition algorithm based on improved yolov5s is proposed. Self-calibrated convolutions (SCConv) is introduced to improve the feature extraction capability. The Gamma transform is used to preprocess the image set, which can improve the robustness of the algorithm to overexposed and underexposed scenarios. The experimental results show that the proposed algorithm can be used for real-time electrical component recognition at the front end of UAV. The recognition accuracy of various typical components can reach more than 98%, which can significantly improve the acquisition quality of inspection images and lay a good foundation for further data processing at the back end of inspection system.
Funding Information: Research and Development;

Document Title: A command and control partition system based on unified access platform
Authors: Y. Yang; H. Zeng; T. Chen; M. Lv
Author Affiliations: Northwest Institute of Nuclear Technology, Xi’an, China; Northwest Institute of Nuclear Technology, Xi’an, China; Northwest Institute of Nuclear Technology, Xi’an, China; Northwest Institute of Nuclear Technology, Xi’an, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: In order to improve the maintainability of the components of the command and control system, the command and control partition system based on middleware has been paid more and more attention. However, the traditional command and control system based on middleware only divides a number of partitions according to the scale of command and control software, without considering the operating characteristics of each component of command and control software, resulting in insufficient or excessive allocation of hardware resources. At the same time, each command and control partition adopts different parsing protocols, and needs to build additional data format conversion modules, which increases the workload of building command and control system. In view of the above problems, this paper proposes a command and control partition architecture adapted to the communication middleware. Compared with the original single partition mode, the architecture divides a number of independent partition for the components of a single command and control software. , which avoids the problem that the performance of command and control software is reduced due to unreasonable partitions. To solve the problem of different command and control software parsing protocols, a unified access platform (UAP) for heterogeneous protocols is designed. Compared with the traditional middleware, UAP has the ability of unifying the format between external protocol data and internal topic data, which solves the problem of unifying the format of information transmission in each partition of the command and control system. Finally, from three aspects of delay characteristics, throughput characteristics and packet loss rate, the command and control partition system based on the unified access platform is experimentally verified. The results show that under the distributed heterogeneous partition environment, the command and control partition system based on the unified access platform supports the access of multiple protocol programs, and has the performance requirements of the command and control system.
Author Keywords: Communication Middleware;Virtualization Technology;Command and control System
IEEE Terms: Command and control systems;Technological innovation;Protocols;Architecture;Packet loss;Computer architecture;Throughput

Document Title: Research on data security sharing mechanism and application based on blockchain and privacy computing
Authors: B. Ma; C. Chi; J. Tian; Y. Zhang
Author Affiliations: China Academy of Information and Communications Technology, Beijing, China; China Academy of Information and Communications Technology, Beijing, China; China Academy of Information and Communications Technology, Beijing, China; China Academy of Information and Communications Technology, Beijing, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: The rapid growth and massive accumulation of various types of data have driven all walks of life to achieve high-quality development, and have had a major and profound impact on social governance and people’s lives. However, there are many problems in the traditional data transaction and sharing, such as the loss of data ownership and the leakage of original data information. How to ensure the invisibility of data and the determination of data ownership while sharing data is an urgent problem. Based on this, combining the advantages of emerging technologies such as blockchain and privacy computing, this paper proposes a data security sharing architecture and mechanism based on blockchain and privacy computing to ensure the effective protection of personal information in the process of data sharing, to realize the safe circulation and sharing of data.
Author Keywords: blockchain;privacy computing;data security sharing;secure multi-party computation;trust computing
IEEE Terms: Industries;Data privacy;Technological innovation;Data security;Information sharing;Pricing;Blockchains

Document Title: PN code tracking aided by GMSK signal algorithm based on GMSK+PN-FH
Authors: S. Liu; S. Luo
Author Affiliations: School of Information and Electronics, Beijing Institute of Technology, Beijing, China; School of Cyberspace Science and Technology, Beijing Institute of Technology, Beijing, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: GMSK+PN-FH has the development potential with the advantages of constant envelope, high spectral efficiency, high precision ranging and time synchronization, and anti- interference. It is a research hotspot in the field of covert anti- interference communication ranging integration system. GMSK+PN-FH requires accurate carrier synchronization. However, the existing carrier tracking loop assisted code tracking loop algorithm cannot achieve accurate carrier synchronization at high hop speed, which limits the improvement of hop speed and the ability of covert anti-interference. This paper proposes an algorithm named PN code tracking aided by GMSK signal algorithm based on GMSK+PN-FH, which sacrifices 25% of the communication efficiency and can work stably in a high-speed frequency-hopping (FH) system where one period PN chip is transmitted in four FH time slots, and the mean square error of the code tracking error is less than 0.0419 chip.
Author Keywords: GMSK+PN-FH;Coherent carrier synchronization;code tracking;code tracking error
IEEE Terms: Tracking loops;Time-frequency analysis;Technological innovation;Codes;Spectral efficiency;Simulation;Interference

Publication Title: 2022 International Conference on Mechanical, Automation and Electrical Engineering (CMAEE)
Abstract: This article presents the control and virtualization of an ammonium nitrate granulation process using the Hardware In the Loop (HIL) technique and the implementation of an industrial AS-Interface (AS-i) network. A virtual process with similar characteristics is implemented using CAD tools and the Unity 3D graphics engine, with the aim of simulating the behavior of an industrial process; which by using Arduino cards allows the generation and reception of standard electrical signals, which enable direct connection to an AS-i network. The result is an interactive and immersive virtual environment between the user and the industrial process, as well as successfully achieving the connection of the simulated process with an AS-i network and with a Programmable Logic Controller (PLC), until it ends in a supervision system. The dynamic modelling of a complete ammonium nitrate granulation process is incorporated into the virtual environment, as well as the virtualization of sensors and actuators typical of an industrial process, so that the virtualization is faithful to a real process.
Author Keywords: component;Granulation Process;Ammonium Nitrate;Hardware In the Loop;AS-interface

Authors: Y. Li; F. Zou; Z. Wang; X. Wang; S. Qin; L. Zhang
Author Affiliations: Shandong Institutes of Industrial Technology, Jinan, China; Shandong Institutes of Industrial Technology, Jinan, China; School of Electrical Engineering, University of Jinan, Jinan, China; SIASUN Robot & Automation CO.,Ltd, Shenyang, China; SIASUN Robot & Automation CO.,Ltd, Shenyang, China; Shandong Institutes of Industrial Technology, Jinan, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Aiming at the problems of incomplete segmentation of small objects when the sample is not balanced and low accuracy in the current commonly used semantic segmentation models, an improved DeepLabV3+ network is proposed in this paper. By using the structural reparameterization method, this paper replaces the normal convolution in the partial structure of the network with DBB module, which allows the network to have a simple structure while maintaining the high segmentation performance that comes with complex multi-branch network. In addition, the network is trained by using a hybrid loss function consisting of cross entropy and dice loss function to further improve the segmentation accuracy. The proposed algorithm is verified on the Cityscapes dataset and the obtained mIoU value is 78.84% and MPA is 89.49%, which are 3.69% and 3.94% higher than the original model, respectively. Experiments show that the improved segmentation algorithm proposed in this paper can effectively improve the segmentation accuracy and achieve better segmentation effectiveness.
Author Keywords: component;Image Semantic Segmentation;DeepLabV3+;Structure Reparameterization;DBB module;dice loss
IEEE Terms: Training;Technological innovation;Convolution;Semantic segmentation;Semantics;Inference algorithms;Entropy

Document Title: 3D virtual environment of the sugar refining process and automatic control using the hardware in the Loop technique
Authors: M. F. C. Taco; E. P. P. Panchi
Author Affiliations: Dept. Electrica y Electrónica, Universidad De Las Fuerzas Armadas ESPE, Sangolquí, Ecuador; Dept. Electrica y Electrónica, Universidad De Las Fuerzas Armadas ESPE, Sangolquí, Ecuador
Publication Title: 2022 International Conference on Mechanical, Automation and Electrical Engineering (CMAEE)
Abstract: This paper proposes the design of a 3D virtual environment of the sugar re-fining process for the implementation of the Hardware in the Loop (HIL) technique and the design of PID controllers by means of a commercial programmable logic controller (PLC), developing operation and control tests in the plant. The 3D modeling of the virtual environment is developed from the P&ID diagram of the process, which indicates the arrangement of equipment and instruments with-in the virtual environment, the mathematical models of the process were developed from base equations, theorems and experimentation to determine the dynamics of operation of the sugar refining process, while the animations and realism were designed in the Unity 3D graphics engine. The interchange of information between the virtualized plant and the PLC, using the Modbus TCP/IP protocol, determined a fast and reliable communication. Finally, different control tests were developed, allowing to demonstrate that the HIL technique presents a complete control over the virtual plant as if it resembled reality.
Author Keywords: Sugar refining process;PID;PLC;Unity 3D;Modbus TCP/IP

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: With the further deployment of the regulation cloud technology, it has become a trend to migrate DTS to the cloud platform, so as to give full play to the advantages of the cloud platform in resource sharing, efficient computation, etc. However, with insufficient intelligence and automation, dispatching training on cloud DTS still requires the participation of real instructors throughout the process, which seriously restricts the application efficiency and effect. Therefore, this paper firstly analyzed shortcomings of existing DTS and proposed the architecture of the cloud DTS based intelligent instructor system (IIS) integrating with the adaptive learning model in order to meet the personalized and intelligent training needs for random concurrency of multiple dispatchers under cloud training mode. Then the application scenarios and functions of the IIS was described in detail, mainly from three aspects as automatic preparation of training cases before training, intelligent interaction and control of drill process during training and comprehensive evaluation for adaptive recommendation after training. Once fully developed, the IIS can provide continuous support for cloud DTS to become the daily and autonomous training tool for dispatchers at anytime and anywhere.
Funding Information: Science and Technology Project of State Grid;

Document Title: Study on Automated Alignment Methods for Electric Vehicles Wireless Charging
Authors: Q. Kong; H. Zheng
Author Affiliations: YK Pao School, Shanghai, China; Ningbo University, Shanghai, China
Publication Title: 2022 International Conference on Mechanical, Automation and Electrical Engineering (CMAEE)
Abstract: For many Chinese people, even those just above the poverty line, owning a medium-quality car has evolved from a luxury to a survival device of surmountable importance. Also, the sales of green energy cars, under the great support of funds and discounts offered by the Chinese Government, had flown sky high in China's urban areas. Channels of charging if these green vehicles vary from situations, the most common types being static, dynamic, and quasi-dynamic wireless charging. Compared to wired charging, these techniques surpass it in ways of easier access, safety, and durability. Many wireless transmitters expose body parts that get easily damaged due to environmental factors. As the transmission is wireless, the device can be charged at a far wider range of angles and positions in which the wired chargers can never succeed. However, current wireless transmissions still faced technical barriers such as low charging speed and expensive installation. Furthermore, in contrast to the rapidly increasing market demands, the population of charging poles and pads provided a great difficulty for cars to maneuver themselves into parking spaces while aligning with transmission devices. Based on these issues, I successfully fabricated an automated alignment system based on computer-driven kinematic models to help solve such an issue. This study aims at analyzing possible solutions to this problem and why this system outperforms than other computational methods to deduct difficulty for drivers when parking with their green energy vehicles. Under 48 trials and errors investigating the general effectiveness of my method, considering misalignments in both coordinative and angular respectively, I concluded that the experiment subject method of automatic alignment could resolve this issue while keeping up with high efficiency of powering both small and large vehicles.
Author Keywords: Autonomous Driving;Robotics;Path Planning;Wireless Charging;Alignment

Abstract: With the rapid development and advancement of ship electronic system technology, the requirements for the availability of ship electronic systems are becoming higher and higher. In this paper, a method for evaluating the availability of ship electronic systems based on Bayesian inference is proposed. Because of the advantages of multi-source information fusion and being applicable for small samples, the theory of Bayesian inference can be used to model the availability of ship electronic system, and the availability evaluation results of ship electronic systems can be obtained by Monte Carlo simulation. This method improves the reliability evaluation system of the ship electronic system and lays the foundation for improving the usability level.

Document Title: Numerical Simulation of Engine Nacelle Icing with a Propeller
Authors: N. Guan; X. Hou; Q. Zhu; F. Chen
Author Affiliations: ShanDong JiaoTong University, Jinan, China; ShanDong JiaoTong University, Jinan, China; ShanDong JiaoTong University, Jinan, China; ShanDong JiaoTong University, Jinan, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: For the icing phenomenon in the nacelle of a propeller aero-engine, this paper uses numerical simulations to study the subcooled water droplet impact and icing characteristics on the propeller blade and nacelle lip at different incoming velocities, and analyzes the icing distribution on the surfaces of the propeller blade and nacelle lip. The results show that the rotational speed and the twist angle of the blade both have obvious effect on the collection and icing of water droplets, and the collection of supercooled water droplets on the surface of the propeller blade is not only related to the incoming flow velocity, but also to the position of the blade in the spanwise direction. Besides, in the area close to the propeller root, the icing thickness increases significantly with the increase of the incoming flow velocity, and the maximum icing thickness with the incoming flow velocity 180m/s is 5 times that of 60m/s. However, the maximum icing thickness differs by only 24% under different inflow velocities in the area near the propeller tip.
Funding Information: Natural Science Foundation of Shandong Province; Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics; Natural Science Foundation of Shandong Province;
Author Keywords: aircraft engine;engine icing;propeller;icing protection
IEEE Terms: Water;Technological innovation;Propellers;Blades;Lips;Ice thickness;Velocity control

Authors: X. Wang; Y. Miao; Y. Chen
Author Affiliations: Jiangsu Academy of Safety Science and Technology, Nanjing, China; Nanjing Zhipu Technology Co., Ltd, Nanjing, China; Jiangsu Academy of Safety Science and Technology, Nanjing, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: The Volatile organic compounds (VOC) gas leak can have harmful effects on both the environment and human health. However, traditional VOC gas leak detection technologies such as electrochemical gas sensors are limited in the outdoor space. We make combination of the advanced Optical Gas Imaging (OGI) system and the deep-learning based temporal convolution network to overcome the drawbacks of the above methods. The Gas Leak Temporal 3D Network (GLT3DNet) are demonstrated in this work, which involves several layers of temporal 3D convolutional operator and identifies the unique spectral signatures of various VOC gases. The synergy of GLT3DNet and the OGI system provides a comprehensive solution for gas leak recognition in infrared videos. The high performance of GLT3DNet enables the OGI system to achieve state-of-the-art results on real-world data captured in various chemical industrial plants.
Author Keywords: component;Volatile Organic Compounds (VOC);Gas Leak Recognition;Deep Temporal Network

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Great time consumption tracing cigarettes with abnormal physical index data on the integrated test stand，which leads to the problems such as inaccurate analysis of abnormal causes, delayed adjustment of equipment, and increased cost of quality. The model of the stepper motor was selected via programming, 3D modeling, simulation, and motion analysis. The key characteristic parameter—time consumption for cigarette clearing—was investigated. Next, a cigarette traceability system controlled by an SCM with a PC computer automatically sending commanders was designed for the integrated test stand based on a scheme. In addition, the time consumed in abnormal cigarette positioning was quantitatively analyzed by reference to the material inspection process of 3 brands. With a SODIM test stand in a making-packing workshop as the test object, the test results showed that after the system was applied, the time consumed in tracing abnormal cigarettes was shortened from the original average of 31.7 min to 0.7 min, and the efficiency was enhanced by over 3100%. This system can rapidly trace cigarettes and provide support for deep cause analysis.
