Authors: L. Wang; S. Qin; C. Cheng
Author Affiliations: College of Safety Science and Engineering, Xi’an University of Science and Technology, Xi’an, China; College of Safety Science and Engineering, Xi’an University of Science and Technology, Xi’an, China; College of Safety Science and Engineering, Xi’an University of Science and Technology, Xi’an, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: In order to improve human-machine matching in the field of automobile manufacturing, shorten the assembly production cycle and improve the existing assembly mode, according to the product assembly process flow. Risk management of automobile assembly process was carried out by identifying risk points and the LEC method, and the safety ergonomics of instrument panel assembly process was studied by JACK simulation software. First, virtual man-machine engineering simulation was carried out on the assembly process of the assembly process instrument. Through the action decomposition of the instrument panel assembly process, the environment and human body were simulated. Second, using the lower back spine of the assembly process, static strength prediction, working posture analysis, and rapid upper limb assessment research, it is identified that the movement of controlling manipulator grasping the dashboard and loading into the car skeleton has the risk of personnel health injury. Finally, the assembly process design was improved for safety man-machine, the improved operating environment and operation process were simulated and reanalyzed.The results show that the man-machine relationship, working environment and operation process are improved through parameter optimization,and it provides a new idea and method for man-machine matching degree in automobile assembly process.
Author Keywords: The dashboard;Risk management;Safety ergonomics;Jack

Document Title: Flexible Pressure Sensors and Their Applications in Wearable Electronics
Authors: M. Yu; Y. Zhang; Y. Han; Y. Zhang
Author Affiliations: School of Communications and Information Engineering, Nanjing University of Posts and Telecommunications, Nanjing, China; Suzhou Foreign Language School, Suzhou, China; Electronic and Electrical Engineering, University of Sheffield, Sheffield, United Kingdom; Maynooth International Engineering College, Fuzhou University, Fujian, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: With the development of modern technology, flexible human-machine interaction, artificial intelligence, portable detection, and other emerging fields have been built up. The demand for high flexibility in these fields leads to flexible pressure sensors getting more and more attention. Using flexible materials can enable them to realize the pressure sensing function while giving them lighter weight, smaller size, and better deformation ability. These characteristics make flexible pressure sensors can be widely used in emerging fields and have more longterm development potential. In recent years, many technologies have been devoted to improving the performance of flexible pressure sensors. Among them, microstructure engineering is the most significant for high-performance flexible sensors. This review focuses on the rapid development of flexible pressure sensors and the microstructure of high-performance flexible sensors. This article describes four sensing mechanisms: capacitive, resistive, piezoelectric, and triboelectric. Besides, the microstructure system, which can improve the sensitivity of capacitive flexible pressure sensors, is discussed comprehensively. In addition, the current applications of the capacitive flexible pressure sensor are introduced. Furthermore, this article discusses prospects for developing direction and application fields of high-performance flexible pressure sensors according to some currently developed microstructure technologies. The research in this review has essential foreshadowing significance and reference value for developing flexible pressure sensors in various intelligent fields in the future.
Author Keywords: pressure sensors;wearable electronics;and flexible electronics
IEEE Terms: Pressure sensors;Electrodes;Industries;Technological innovation;Sensitivity;Robot sensing systems;Capacitive sensors

Document Title: Dynamic reconfiguration of distribution network with distributed power supply based on improved artificial fish-swarm algorithm
Authors: Q. Lu; X. Wang; J. Xiao
Author Affiliations: College of Logistics Engineering, Shanghai Maritime University, Shanghai, China; College of Logistics Engineering, Shanghai Maritime University, Shanghai, China; College of Logistics Engineering, Shanghai Maritime University, Shanghai, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: The time-varying characteristics of wind power, photovoltaic power and load are considered comprehensively to solve the problem of distribution network reconfiguration with distributed power generation. The grid connection of distributed power generation will lead to changes in the topology structure and the power flow distribution of the distribution network. In view of the fact that the existing artificial fish swarm algorithm is not enough to deal with it, the artificial fish swarm algorithm is improved and then the distribution network is solved. The hierarchical agglomerative clustering algorithm is used to divide the solar and wind load into time periods. The objective function is network loss and voltage offset. Finally, the improved artificial fish swarm algorithm is used to solve the problem. The defect of the initial AFSA algorithm in the later stage is that it will fall into the local optimum, and the convergence speed and search accuracy are low. In this regard, combined with the differential evolution algorithm, the cross-mutation and other operations are performed on the fish school to increase the diversity of the population, and it can quickly jump out of the local optimum and improve Convergence speed and search accuracy. Experimental results show that the algorithm is feasible and effective for reconstruction.
Author Keywords: distributed power generation;hierarchical agglomerative clustering;distribution network reconfiguration;improved artificial fish swarm algorithm

Document Title: Development of Ship Navigation Performance System based on Wireless Sensor Nodes
Authors: S. Yang; X. Ma; L. Shi; L. Kong
Author Affiliations: Marine Design & Research Institute of China Laboratory of Science and Technology on Water Jet, Shanghai Key Laboratory of Ship Engineering, Shanghai, China; Shanghai Key Laboratory of Ship Engineering, Marine Design & Research Institute of China, Shanghai, China; Shanghai Key Laboratory of Ship Engineering, Marine Design & Research Institute of China, Shanghai, China; Marine Design & Research Institute of China, Shanghai, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: In this paper, a monitoring system of ship navigation performance based on wireless sensor nodes, gateway, measurement instruments is proposed, which could monitor ship position, speed, course, propeller’s speed and shaft power, navigation environment (wind and wave), rudder angle, motion and acceleration. The equipment, composition, implementation, integration and function of this system is introduced in detail. In this system, the signal of longitude and latitude, speed, heading and track angle can be gained from BD DGPS, and the propeller shaft revolution and power are monitored by wireless torque sensor nodes. The relative wind speed and direction, the wave height, the rudder angle and the acceleration of ship are monitored by wireless anemometer sensor nodes, radar wave meter, wireless voltage sensor nodes and wireless accelerometer sensor nodes respectively. The sampling frequency of wireless sensor nodes could be configured according to user’s measurement needs. The system has been applied to continuously monitor the navigation performance of "YUFENG" ship belong to Shanghai YUHAI Shipping Company for one year, in that a large number of measurement data were collected. The results show that the system of ship navigation performance based on wireless sensor nodes has strong reliability and robustness.
Author Keywords: WSN;Ship Navigation Performance;Radar Wave Guider;BD GPS
IEEE Terms: Wireless communication;Shafts;Wireless sensor networks;Navigation;Logic gates;Robustness;Frequency measurement

Abstract: In Peru, according to the National Road Safety Observatory of the Ministry of Transport and Communications, there were a total of 47629 traffic accidents that caused 1853 deaths and left 30850 with serious injuries. This work develops the mechatronic design through actuators, with approach sensors of an intelligent road for the prevention of accidents on the Qatac-Aija route. For the prototype was made with the Arduino IDE using Autodesk inventor following the use of the VDI 2206 standard, which the pavement was designed with the DIAASHTO-93 methodology. Obtaining a sensor actuator approaching the edges of the Qatac-Aija Road with red and green light signals releasing alarm sounds when approaching 5cm, finally for the vehicle c3 composed of a single axle was obtained a pavement of asphalt layer of 2 inches and a granular base of 4 inches, which contain the mechatronic design.

Authors: H. Yu
Author Affiliations: Avionics Integration Department, Shanghai Aircraft Design and Research Institute, Shanghai, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: The application of civil aircraft data loading function in airliner retrofit can greatly improve the efficiency of software upgrade and reduce the cost of equipment return. However, the distribution of field loadable software involves a series of processes from the generation of equipment suppliers to the final installation. In order to ensure the successful loading of software on the aircraft, the integrity of the software needs to be verified with necessary check methodology. The implementation of a SHA-1 for the manual verification of the software data digest fits this application scenario well, and maintenance crew can quickly and reliably achieve the goal of field loadable software check. Two message digest algorithms of SHA-1 and MD5 are compared as used in the message digest generation of civil aviation loadable software, with a recommendation of SHA-1 algorithm which win a priority in some area.

Document Title: A Loop Closure Detection Method Based On CNN For Extracting Global And Local Features
Authors: Z. Xie; H. Jiang; W. Zhang; B. Wang
Author Affiliations: College of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Fuzhou University, Fuzhou, China; College of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Fuzhou University, Fuzhou, China; College of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Fuzhou University, Fuzhou, China; College of Electrical Engineering and Automation, Fuzhou University, Fuzhou, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Loop closure detection (LCD) is an important module of visual SLAM (Simultaneous Localization and Mapping), which can be regarded as an image retrieval task. The correct LCD can effectively reduce the cumulative errors during visual SLAM localization and obtain a globally consistent map. The currently common approach to LCD is based on a bag-of-words (BoW) and traditional manually designed features. However, The BoW-based method ignores the spatial location information and semantic information of visual features, and image aliasing will affect the detection accuracy of the algorithm. Meanwhile, the artificially designed features are very sensitive to light changes. This paper proposes a LCD algorithm based on convolutional neural networks (CNN) to extract global and local features. Extensive experiments on six publicly available datasets have shown that the method provides high recall with 100% accuracy in most of the evaluated datasets relative to traditional algorithms and some deep learning-based methods.
Author Keywords: Loop-closure detection;Convolutional neural networks;Global features;Local features;SLAM
IEEE Terms: Location awareness;Learning systems;Visualization;Technological innovation;Simultaneous localization and mapping;Semantics;Feature extraction

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Industrial automation and computer vision are developing quickly and, while labor costs have significantly increased as a result of the aging population, it is urgent to improve the level of automation and information technology in industrial production. Automatic assembly based on an industrial robotic arm has obvious advantages over the traditional manual assembly method in various aspects such as efficiency, accuracy, and flexibility. But there are still many shortcomings in the application of industrial robotic arms in automatic assembly. The main technical bottleneck is the problem of classification and identification of industrial fasteners during automatic grasping. The existing methods for fastener classification and recognition are not accurate and lack public targeted industrial fastener datasets. In this paper, a new industrial fasteners dataset -- the YNU-Industrial Fasteners Dataset (YNU-IFD) -- is proposed and a Transformer-based classification neural network-RtNet is constructed. By comparing the experiments of various deep learning models on the self-built dataset (YNU-IFD), the results show that this dataset has better performance in application to standardized mechanical sorting.
Author Keywords: industrial fastener dataset;deep learning;computer vision;industrial fastener classification

Abstract: Robotics is known as the "crown jewel of the manufacturing industry" and is an important symbol of a country's innovation capability and industrial competitiveness. At the same time, with the continuous improvement of people's material living standards, people's pursuit of spiritual life is also At the same time, with the continuous improvement of people's material living standard, people's pursuit of spiritual life has become more intense. In this thesis, we have chosen "the algorithm implementation of a two-armed Rubik's Cube solving robot" as the topic of choice, and have focused on the optimisation of the relevant algorithm and the development of the robot. This thesis is aimed at the frontiers of robotics and the needs of the service robot industry. This thesis is aimed at the frontiers of robotics and the needs of the service robotics industry. Since its invention in 1974, the Rubik's Cube has challenged users to solve a colorful puzzle in record time. The puzzle can be solved at a higher speed by building a robot. Abstract: The demand for yellow corn according to the Ministry of Agrarian Development and Irrigation Midagri in the period 2020, Peru had an annual growth of 4.9%, having a national production of 1.2% of which had to import 3.7%. This work develops the classification of corn grains separating impurities to improve production times in the company “Inversiones Santana”. For the simulation of the classification of corn grains with impurities, the Factory IO and TIA Portal software was used, where a vision sensor sends to the interactive screen of HMI, to then see the production time in the Anylogic software, for which a working time of 8 hours and 13.8 minutes was obtained initially without the automation proposal. Abstract: Nowadays, gesture recognition based on vision plays an increasingly important role in fields such as augmented reality. However, most of the existing researches focus on the ideal lighting conditions, while gesture recognition in complex lighting conditions is not highly concerned, which also leads to the low recognition rate in this scene. To address the above problems, this paper proposes a static gesture segmentation recognition network with feature fusion: first, the input image is pre-processed with noise, then the feature map of the image is extracted by using DeepLabV3, then the pre-processed image is masked by the obtained feature maps, and the masked result is fused with the pre-processed image as the input of the network, and then Resnet18 is used for gesture recognition. The experimental results in both datasets show that the proposed method in this paper has higher recognition accuracy under different lighting conditions compared to Resnet and its variants.

Authors: Y. Chen; Q. Li; Y. Zou; Y. Jia; Y. Wu; M. Cai
Author Affiliations: Nanchang Hangkong University, Nanchang, China; Nanchang Hangkong University, Nanchang, China; Electric Power Research Institute, National Network Jiangxi Electric Power Co., Ltd, China; Nanchang Hangkong University, Nanchang, China; Nanchang Hangkong University, Nanchang, China; Electric Power Research Institute, National Network Jiangxi Electric Power Co., Ltd, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: The opening/closing coil current waveform of circuit breaker varies with the manufacturers and the voltage levels and shows different morphological characteristics. The traditional circuit breaker fault identification is mainly based on the key extreme points of the coil current waveform, however, some extremum points in the actual waveform may be missing, which can easily lead to inaccurate extraction of the key points, or even misjudgment. To solve the problem, firstly, this paper proposes a method to extract the key points based on sliding window detection, the method can adaptively and accurately locate the key points for different current waveforms; Secondly, a fault diagnosis model that integrates principal component analysis (PCA)、grid search(GS) and support vector machine (SVM) is proposed. Finally, the key point positioning algorithm performance of sliding window method and the fault identification effects based on PCAGS-SVM are experimentally verified. The sliding window detection method is suitable for the extreme point positioning of the opening/closing current of different kinds of circuit breakers. Furthermore, compared with the traditional identification models, the fault diagnosis model proposed in this paper has a fault classification accuracy rate of 96.67% and 95.00% in the case of opening/closing statues, respectively, fault identification accuracy is improved.
Author Keywords: Fault identification;Sliding window detection;Feature extraction;Key points;Support vector machine

Abstract: At present, the way to get the alarm location information in China is mainly by telephone communication, the police officer needs to obtain the accurate location through verbal communication, which seriously affects the emergency rescue efficiency, resulting in a large number of tragic cases. This paper reviewed the technology status and development trend in the field of emergency alarm, designed the technical scheme of Emergency Position Service (EPS) according to the application requirements of emergency rescue in China, developed the EPS platform, and carried out pilot applications in Guangdong Province. After field testing, the communication time of alarm location was decreased from an average of 3.1 minutes to a second-level system query, which effectively improved the efficiency of receiving and handling alarms and accelerated the application of emergency rescue positioning services in China.

Abstract: Manhours estimation and automatic approval plays an important role in project scheduling and reducing the development cost for factory. Traditional approaches usually have some limitations, such as technical text formatting limitations and industry-specific limitations. This paper presents a software system that estimates the manhours and approves the technology texts that have been submitted. Firstly, we collect a technology texts dataset and complement the dictionaries. Secondly, the word2vec is used to extract the features implicated in the technology text, and a DNN (deep neural network) model is proposed to estimate the manhours. Finally, an Odoo-based software system is developed, which provides the estimation manhours and approves automatically of the submitted technology texts. Abstract: At present, the smart grid has entered the stage of rapid construction and development, and the data interaction between various businesses and entities in the power industry is becoming closer and closer. It is urgent to ensure the safety of data assets under the rapid development of smart grid through effective risk assessment and risk prediction. Therefore, by analyzing the business scenarios and business models of smart grid, this paper forms a classification list of polymorphic data sharing risks of data loss risk, data leakage risk and data tampering risk, designs a data sharing risk measurement model, and carries out an example application of the risk measurement model combined with the "all in one network" business of electric power.

Author Affiliations: Aerospace IoT Technology Co., Ltd, Beijing, China; Aerospace IoT Technology Co., Ltd, Beijing, China; Aerospace IoT Technology Co., Ltd, Beijing, China; Aerospace IoT Technology Co., Ltd, Beijing, China; Aerospace IoT Technology Co., Ltd, Beijing, China; Aerospace IoT Technology Co., Ltd, Beijing, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Public transport travel can reduce air pollution, improve safety, and save many travel costs. However, as the passenger flow and traffic conditions change over time, it is difficult for bus schedules to respond in time. Therefore, it is meaningful to conduct real-time bus dispatching according to the current passenger flow and traffic conditions to reduce bus companies' costs and improve passengers' experience. Although deep reinforcement learning has made good progress in public transport control, most relevant research has made continuous decisions on whether to dispatch in a very short time interval. In this study, we consider bus timetable optimization as a reinforcement learning problem and thoroughly consider the practical application. The Proximal Policy Optimization (PPO) is used to determine the next departure interval. Therefore, the bus timetable is formulated dynamically and timely to cope with changes in traffic conditions and passenger demand. Specifically, we propose a novel deep reinforcement learning framework with a novel environment model, adding human experience to avoid learning from scratch and reconsider the step size, observation, and reward function to provide more effective information to the deep RL system. The experimental results show that our method is superior to the existing methods
Author Keywords: Bus timetable;deep reinforcement learning;proximal policy optimization;public transit
IEEE Terms: Deep learning;Technological innovation;Schedules;Costs;Decision making;Optimization methods;Reinforcement learning

Authors: J. -S. Seo; Y. Chen; D. -Y. Kwon; C. Wallraven
Author Affiliations: Department of Artificial Intelligence, Korea University, Seoul, South Korea; Department of Artificial Intelligence, Korea University, Seoul, South Korea; Department of Neurology, Korea University Ansan Hospital, Ansan, South Korea; Department of Brain and Cognitive Engineering, Korea University, Seoul, South Korea
Publication Title: 2022 International Conference on Mechanical, Automation and Electrical Engineering (CMAEE)
Abstract: Automatic diagnosis of Parkinson's Disease (PD) from sensor data is an important topic given the growing numbers of patients, and the increasing costs to the quality of life of an aging society. Several approaches have been proposed aimed at such an automatic diagnosis, but often suffer from complicated sensor setups or setups ill-fitting for the limitations in clinical settings. Here, we present a system that uses frequency-based analysis of joint data from both arms and legs from a single, frontally-viewed video of people walking towards a camera. We evaluate three machine-learning models on frequency-based features extracted from the joint dynamics on two larger datasets containing a total of $\boldsymbol{\mathrm{N}=300}$ videos of over 50 PD patients and healthy control people. Results confirm typical clinical expectations (leg frequencies are slower in PD patients) and in addition show excellent generalizability even across datasets with performance of up to 97% for an Ensemble classifier.
Funding Information: National Research Foundation of Korea;
Author Keywords: Parkinson's;Parkinson's Disease;artificial intelligence;machine learning;openpose;video analysis;2d;single camera;pose analysis;gait;walk;arm swing

Document Title: Study on intelligent well location optimization of fault-block reservoir based on target region constraints
Authors: C. -Z. Cui; Y. -C. Yang; Y. -F. Sui
Author Affiliations: College of Petroleum Engineering, China University of Petroleum, East China; College of Petroleum Engineering, China University of Petroleum, East China; College of Petroleum Engineering, China University of Petroleum, East China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: In ultra-high water cut stage, local infill wells are often drilled to improve oil recovery. At present, the research on well location determination method of local infill wells mainly focuses on qualitative analysis of residual oil distribution in numerical simulation model of fault block reservoir, and then artificial well location design; this kind of research is not only difficult to cover the entire optimal solution search space, but also does not consider the constraints of economic factors. In this paper, technical and economic factors are considered comprehensively. First, the optimal range of well location in fault block reservoir is determined by analyzing the distribution of remaining oil. Then, taking the net present value as the objective function and the well location as a variable, an intelligent optimization mathematical model of well location is established, and fish swarm algorithm is introduced to solve the problem to obtain the optimal well location with the maximum net present value. By comparing the development effects of intelligent optimization of well location and artificial determination of well location, the calculation shows that the recovery percent of the main layer after intelligent optimization of well location is 52.86%, while the recovery percent of the main layerafter artificial determination of well location is 51.47%, which shows that this method can reasonably select the location of infilled wells, achieve the goal of maximum profit after infilled wells, and effectively improve the reservoir recovery.
Author Keywords: fault block reservoir;well location optimization;fish swarm algorithm;ultra-high water cut stage
IEEE Terms: Economics;Technological innovation;Oils;Reservoirs;Numerical simulation;Linear programming;Fish

Authors: Y. Jiang; J. Zhou
Author Affiliations: Shanghai Film Academy, Shanghai University, Shanghai, China; Shanghai Film Academy, Shanghai University, Shanghai, China

Abstract: With the development of global informatization and digitalization, a large number of digital content works are produced, such as e-books, music, videos and so on. The copyright registration mechanism provided by the traditional third-party copyright management platform can no longer meet the needs of the rapid development trend of digital works. This paper proposes a digital music copyright system based on blockchain. On the Ethereum platform, smart contracts are designed to achieve copyright registration, music authentication and music crowdfunding. Digital signature technology is used to realize the authentication and authorization of transaction information. The Shazam algorithm is used to extract the audio fingerprint. The Interplanetary File System (IPFS) stores the extracted audio fingerprint, and the blockchain stores the hash value generated by IPFS. Compared with the existing system, the function of this system is more perfect. And innovatively through smart contract and digital signature technology, this system realizes the authentication and authorization of transaction information. In particular, it ensures the authenticity of the crowdfunding campaign.
Author Keywords: music copyright;blockchain;digital signature;IPFS

Abstract: One Envisat ASAR image acquired on 22 July, 2011 is analyzed to study the relationship between amplitude, energy of internal waves and the tidal current in Luzon Strait. Firstly, the amplitude is extracted by a retrieval algorithm based on Euler numerical model. Secondly, internal wave energy is calculated with the amplitude. Thirdly, the generation time in the Luzon Strait is found by tracing the souce of IWs. Finally, the amplitudes of IWs can be determined by analyzing the IW energy and the corresponding tidal current difference. Authors: Z. Chen; S. Elsaid; D. Y. Y. Sim; T. Maul; I. Y. Liao
Author Affiliations: Faculty of Science and Engineering, School of Computer Science, University of Nottingham Malaysia, Semenyih, Selangor, Malaysia; Faculty of Science and Engineering, School of Computer Science, University of Nottingham Malaysia, Semenyih, Selangor, Malaysia; Faculty of Science and Engineering, School of Computer Science, University of Nottingham Malaysia, Semenyih, Selangor, Malaysia; Faculty of Science and Engineering, School of Computer Science, University of Nottingham Malaysia, Semenyih, Selangor, Malaysia; Faculty of Science and Engineering, School of Computer Science, University of Nottingham Malaysia, Semenyih, Selangor, Malaysia
Publication Title: 2022 International Conference on Mechanical, Automation and Electrical Engineering (CMAEE)
Abstract: Fresh Fruit Bunches (FFBs) are an important agricultural asset for countries such as Malaysia as they are used to obtain oil palm which contributes to a large portion of the countries' GDP. However, the current FFBs harvesting process requires a significant amount of manual labor and may cause injuries or damage to the FFBs which must be avoided to ensure the oil produced does not get affected. Therefore, an automatic harvesting system needs to be developed to help avoid such issues. An important part of the harvesting system would be a vision system for the detection and localization of the fruits and involves the usage of computer vision models. In this paper, a comparison is performed between four different models: Support Vector Machine (SVM) which uses the Histogram of Gradients (HOG), Faster R-CNN, YOLOv4 and YOLOv5. The models were tested by the metrics of mean average precision (mAP), precision, recall and F1 score and their detection speed. The results showed that the SVM + HOG model had the worst performance with a mAP of 89% and the YOLOv4 model had the best performance with a mAP of 98.5%. However, the YOLOv5 model provided the best results in terms of speed with a detection speed of 11.4 ms and its mAP was 96.4% making it the best model for use in a harvesting system for the detection of FFBs as it provides both speed and accuracy.
Author Keywords: Object detection;oil palm fresh fruit bunch;fruit detection;SVM;Faster RCNN;YOLO

Abstract: Beidou-3 (BD3) system uses the pseudo-range principle to calculate the user receiver position. However, in the satellite positioning method based on pseudo-range, the performance of satellite is the main factor which affect the positioning accuracy. In view of the problem that BD3 pseudo-range positioning is easily affected by the performance of ranging satellites and is difficult to ensure the positioning accuracy, this paper firstly proposes a BD3 satellite operation state evaluation method based on analytic hierarchy process (AHP) which combine with the characteristics of BD3 system. Then, a high precision pseudo-range positioning scheme based on AHP is proposed. Based on the comprehensive score of each satellite, the satellites with the best performance are selected to measure the pseudo-range, so as to achieve high precision positioning. Finally, the feasibility and effectiveness of the proposed method are verified by simulation.

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Based on the large-scale influx of electric vehicles in mountain cities, this paper needs to predict the charging load of electric vehicles, and lay the foundation for the planning of electric vehicle charging and swapping facilities. This paper proposes a spatiotemporal prediction method of electric vehicle charging load considering the characteristics of mountain cities: 1) The wavelet neural network method based on historical traffic data is used to predict the traffic flow in a certain period of time in the future; 2) Considering the influence of traffic flow, the mountain cities are constructed respectively. Flow-density-speed model, road section impedance model; 3) Based on the constructed speed and impedance model and the improved Freud path search algorithm, plan the driving path of electric vehicles and construct the electric vehicle power consumption model; 4) Use random Probabilistic analysis method was used to obtain the electric vehicle charging load prediction method. In order to verify the feasibility and effectiveness of the model and method: 1) Construct a traffic road network, simulate and calculate the accuracy of the traffic flow prediction method, and compare the charging load of the mountain city and the plain city. 2) The results of the calculation example show that due to the large power consumption in mountainous cities and the high demand for electric vehicle charging, the charging time of electric vehicles lags behind that in plain cities, and the load size increases significantly in space.
Author Keywords: an electric vehicle;traffic prediction;mountain city;charging load
IEEE Terms: Analytical models;Power demand;Roads;Urban areas;Predictive models;Electric vehicle charging;Data models

Document Title: Optimal Allocation of Energy Storage for Distributed Wind Farms Under Cost Minimization Constraints
Authors: Y. Song
Author Affiliations: Meigu Xingyu Wind Power Development Co, Ltd., Guangzhou Development New Energy Incorporated, Guangzhou, China
Publication Title: 2022 International Conference on Mechanical, Automation and Electrical Engineering (CMAEE)
Abstract: Aiming at the problems of low total grid-connected capacity of wind power and high wind curtailment rate existing in the current wind farm energy storage configuration method. In this paper, a distributed wind farm energy storage optimization configuration method under the constraint of cost minimization is designed. The self-adjustment interval of the wind farm is set, and the probability density function of Weibull distribution with single peak and two parameters is used to describe the wind speed. Utilize the flexible response of energy storage and the two-way regulation of charge and discharge to enhance power regulation capabilities, establish a distributed energy industry value chain, and calculate energy storage benefits. Construct a cost measurement model under the constraint of cost minimization, and design an optimal allocation method for energy storage. Experimental results: The total grid-connected capacity of wind power and the average value of abandoned wind rate under the method of this paper are: 970.5MW and 28.26%, respectively. At the same time, the mean value of the profit critical power difference and the discount rate under the method of this paper are: 0.786 yuan/Kwh and 73.248% respectively. It shows that the method fully considers the cost constraints, making it more practical.
Author Keywords: cost minimization constraints;distributed wind farms;energy storage optimization;allocation methods

Abstract: Based on the multi-body dynamics theory, the whole vehicle dynamics simulation model of mining truck is established with the help of ADAMS simulation software. Determine the distribution of dynamic load of tramcar under various limit conditions, and abandon the design disadvantages of relying on designer experience and analogy of tramcar parameters of the same tonnage to determine each static load. With the help of computer simulation tools, reduce the manufacturing cost of mining truck, shorten the development cycle and provide product quality. Abstract: Many enterprises stay in the management of computer aided design data, while process planning and resource management are not uploaded to the product lifecycle management (PLM) system for unified management, which does not reflect the real significance of product life management. Based on the product R&D and production requirements of enterprises, a collaborative management solution for product structure, process design and resource management by using Teamcenter manufacturing process management function module is proposed. Taking the assembly process of the primary shaft of the reducer as an example, a Bill of Process (BOP) model is built to realize the unified management of products, process, resources, and plants. Abstract: One of the characteristics of wireless networks is variable topology, but the convergent speed and accuracy of the algorithms for dynamic topology time synchronization are not satisfactory at this stage. Aiming at this problem, this paper proposes a dynamic clustering based on the synchronization algorithm of average time (DC-ATS). When the network topology is changed, the network topology dynamically maintained firstly, then the time synchronization is performed for the primary and secondary networks. Through simulation experiments, it is shown that this algorithm effectively improves the convergence speed and synchronization accuracy.

Authors: M. Chen; F. Gao; J. Wu
Author Affiliations: Nanchang Key Laboratory of Virtual Digital Engineering and Cultural Communication, Nanchang, China; School of Software Engineering, Jiangxi University of Science and Technology, Nanchang, China; School of Software Engineering, Jiangxi University of Science and Technology, Nanchang, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: In order to solve the problem of high difficulty and large amount of computation in feature extraction for web spam detection, a method for extracting semantic features only based on the HTML script of the current page is proposed. Firstly, the domain name is segmented by a memorization search algorithm combining depth-first search and dynamic programming. Secondly, The Latent Dirichlet Distribution is used to extract subject words of the web page. Lastly, three single-page semantic similarity features are calculated based on Word2Vec and word mover distance. Combining the single-page semantic similarity features with single-page statistical features, classification algorithms such as random forest are used to build classification models for web spam detection. The experimental results show that the AUC value of single-page content extraction based on semantic and statistical features for classification reaches 83.1%, which is about 7% higher than that of the control method.

Authors: R. Ma; S. Xu; J. Gao; X. Cheng
Author Affiliations: Southwest Institute of Technical Physics, Chengdu City; Southwest Institute of Technical Physics, Chengdu City; Southwest Institute of Technical Physics, Chengdu City; Southwest Institute of Technical Physics, Chengdu City
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: The existing anchor-free three-dimensional object detection methods exhibit low accuracy for small objects. Therefore, an object detection algorithm based on CenterNet is proposed. High-dimensional features are extracted from meshed point clouds by three-dimensional convolution. Low-dimensional spatial information and high-dimensional abstract semantic information are integrated by the two-dimensional backbone network with attention mechanism. After obtaining target coarse regression by the CenterNet head, the detection accuracy is improved by the Voxel R-CNN ROI Pooling module as a two-stage regression. The pending point cloud may be imperfect, caused by occlusions and sensor malfunction. During the network training phase, the shape sensing data enhancement scheme from SE-SSD is introduced to strengthen the detection capability of small targets.Using the KITTI dataset to evaluate the designed model, the detection accuracy of cars car (medium difficulty) is 80.60%, while that of cyclists and pedestrians is 69.71% and 59.20%, respectively. The model inference speed is 21.3 FPS. The experimental results demonstrate that the proposed method can effectively improve the capability of detecting small targets while it also has good performance with large targets similar to vehicles.
Author Keywords: component;Deep learning;3D object detection;Attention mechanism;anchor-free

Document Title: Research on simulation modeling and test verification of civil aircraft fuel tank structure
Authors: W. K. Jing

Abstract: Lightning protection is an important part of the overall design of large aircraft. It is of great significance to predict the lightning protection of civil aircraft and its fuel tank system in advance by using the numerical finite-difference time-domain simulation technology for aircraft lightning protection design. This paper mainly focuses on the safety simulation of large aircraft and its fuel tank lightning effect as follows: 1. The finite difference time-domain EMA3D software is used to establish the wing box section (component level) simulation model of a certain aircraft and the full aircraft level fuel tank system simulation model of a certain civil aircraft. The current density of the technical skin and the structural current and voltage of the fuel tank system are obtained through simulation calculation, The electromagnetic distribution of wing fuel tank structure under different paths is studied; 2. through the lightning effect test of the wing wing box system of a certain model aircraft and the indoor lightning effect test of the full aircraft level on-board fuel tank system, the lightning current conducted on the pipeline, the lightning current at the connection position of the structure/component, the voltage between the pipeline and the pipeline, and the structural components are obtained; 3. based on the results of comparison between simulation data and test data, verify the effectiveness of the fuel tank system structure simulation model Chengdu, predict the lightning environment of the fuel tank system, the most severe fuel tank lightning level under multiple lightning paths and positions, and select the most severe level values under various structural characteristics to support a civil aircraft to verify the compliance of CCAR25.981 (a) (3) and CCAR25.954 (b). The research shows that the simulation results obtained from the whole engine fuel tank system simulation model and wing box section flash current simulation model are in good agreement with the test data. Because the simulation and test reveal the lightning environment of the fuel tank system.
Author Keywords: lightning path;Current distribution;Fuel tank structure;Modeling;simulation

Author Affiliations: School of Electrical and Information Engineering, Zhengzhou University, Zhengzhou, China; Inspur Electronic Information Industry Co., Ltd, Beijing, China; Jinan Inspur Data Technology Co., Ltd, Jinan, China; Zhengzhou Inspur Data Technology Co., Ltd, Zhengzhou, China; Zhengzhou Inspur Data Technology Co., Ltd, Zhengzhou, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: Aiming at the problems of long storage I/O path, low IOPS (Input/Output Per Second) and high latency of virtual machines in OpenStack cloud platform, a storage performance acceleration scheme based on SPDK (Storage Performance Development Kit) is proposed: offload the back-end driver of virtualized I/O to user state at virtualization layer by mounting SPDK type cloud hard disk, replace interrupt mechanism with polling mechanism, and use lock-free queue to achieve the purpose of shortening I/O path, reducing context switching frequency, and reducing memory copy. The experimental results show that compared with virtual machines mounted with regular cloud hard disks, virtual machines using this acceleration solution saw a 32.75% and 549.02% increase in read IOPS and write IOPS, a 40.73% and 35.18% increase in read and write bandwidth, and a 32% and 18.81% decrease in read latency and write latency, respectively.
Funding Information: Natural Science Foundation of Shandong Province;

Abstract: An industrial bionic soft finger gripping system is proposed in this paper for application in the field of fabric automatic manipulation. A rectangular piece of delicate fabric could be picked up and released from a stack by the proposed gripper from a stack without creating any damage to it. The grasping strategy of the soft finger was described. The performance of the soft finger was analyzed briefly by simulation. In addition, we discussed the placement strategy in detail. In the experiment, we found that not only the grasping margin is a crucial factor that influences the effect of placing, but also placement speed and angle are important. Abstract: The current decision tree based electric power customer demand risk prediction method has low prediction accuracy due to the lack of effective extraction of demand features. Text mining technology is used to extract features from the demand data and perform text clustering analysis. The extracted data are coded and normalized to build a risk prediction model for electric power customers' demands. In the experiments, the proposed risk prediction method is verified for prediction accuracy, and the analysis of the experimental results shows that the proposed method is used to construct the risk prediction model of electric power customers' demands, which has high prediction accuracy.

Abstract: In today's information age, with the rapid development of computer technology, the urban intelligence based on Web2.0 environment has gradually become the current social research hotspot.In such a context, stricter and more comprehensive requirements for system design: efficiency, convenience, flexibility, flexibility, scalability and acceptable performance; From the perspective of social network analysis, the core problem in various social networks is to discover the relationship between users and users. In these methods, a good solution is found: to realize the system function through the relationships and connections between users. This scheme is a "user" -centric idea.After making full use of Louvain partitioning, constructing node importance calculation method, using node importance analysis label propagation ability in label propagation algorithm, and developing new label update strategies through node importance sorting and label propagation ability, the final community division results has obtained. Authors: C. Liu; Y. Huang

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: With the continuous construction of the power system with new energy as the main body, the demand for accurate photovoltaic power prediction of the power system is also increasing. In view of the problems of the original sparrow search algorithm, which are prone to local optimal and slow convergence rate, a (Tent-SSA) modified sparrow search algorithm fused with chaotic mapping function is proposed, which is used to optimize BP neural network to predict short-term photovoltaic power. In order to avoid the influence of redundant data on the predictive accuracy of photovoltaic data, this paper firstly uses the Spearman correlation coefficient to select the data as the input data; secondly, the modified sparrow search algorithm with t distribution and the chaotic mapping function is used to optimize the traditional BP neural network. Finally, the measured photovoltaic power data of the photovoltaic power station are compared with the prediction results of each model. The results show that: BP PV prediction based on Ten-SSA algorithm has better prediction accuracy compared with SSA-BP and BP PV prediction, which is more in line with the needs of the power system.
Author Keywords: Photovoltaic prediction;Improved Sparrow Search Algorithm (Tent-SSA);Prediction accuracy;BP neural network

Abstract: A space division multiplexing (SDM) system based on seven-core single-mode fiber with application of constant modulus algorithm (CMA) for signal equalization is proposed to achieve transmission of seven DP-QPSK signals. We also simulate and analyze the bit error rate (BER) performance with different optical signal-to-noise ratio (OSNR) and transmission distance of the proposed system. Document Title: An Impact Attenuation Structure for Occupant Safety during Vehicle Rollovers
Authors: L. Bao; Z. Wu
Author Affiliations: Wuxi Dipont School of Arts and Science, Wuxi, China; COMAC Shanghai Aircraft Design and Research Institute, Nanjing, China
Publication Title: 2022 International Conference on Mechanical, Automation and Electrical Engineering (CMAEE)
Abstract: Rollover accidents are especially violent and cause greater damage and injury than other accidents. Airbags and seat belts are not designed for such conditions. They provide limited help during a rollover because of the vertical impact in the upside-down position. This paper discussed the mechanism of the rollover accidents and proposed a simple but effective impact attenuation structure, which can be attached to the top of the cars. Quasi-static compression is performed on silicone, EVA rubber, and foam to determine the stress-strain behaviors. Dynamic free fall experiments are conducted to investigate the impact of energy absorption of the materials. A 3-D printed aluminum model is developed as a scale mode of the car cockpit during the free fall experiments. A dynamic 3-axis acceleration sensor at 2 kHz, together with a computer is used for data acquisition. The final results show that EVA rubber is the ideal material that can effectively reduce the impact of the model from >40 g to 5.5 g. Foam is insufficient in energy absorption and unable to prevent the metal model from impact with the ground even when the attenuator is fully compressed. Silicone is also found incapable of reducing the g-force to a safe range during impact due to its high elastic modulus. In the end, an impact attenuation structure made of EVA rubber for real passenger cars is suggested to effectively improve the safety of the people during a rollover accident.
Author Keywords: Rollover;Free-/all;impact attenuator

GA-BP neural network algorithm is used to build a risk grade model for forecasting flood disaster. It is found that the prediction accuracy of BP model optimized by genetic algorithm is significantly higher than that of single BP neural network model, and the prediction accuracy reaches 71.43%. It plays an important guiding role in the risk management of rainstorm and flood disasters.

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: The reservoir space is complex, the remaining oil distribution is not clear, and the bottom water channeling along the dominant channel is the current production problem of the fractured vuggy reservoir. This paper designs the visual physical models of the fractured vuggy reservoir and the fractured net reservoir according to the similarity criteria, intuitively analyzes the generation mechanism of "attic oil", studies the model recovery, water cut change and remaining oil distribution of the bottom water drive under different speeds, and the EOR mechanism of gel profile control. The results show that the generation of "attic oil" is mainly caused by the difference between oil and water gravity. If the fracture communication location is at the high part of the karst cave, the bottom water drive can spread to more areas, and the "attic oil" is less; Properly reducing the bottom water drive speed can replace oil and water, and improve oil recovery to a certain extent; silicic acid gel blocks the bottom of fractures and holes and improves oil recovery and improves local oil-water profile, but bottom water is still easy to cross flow through other advantageous channels.
Author Keywords: Fractured vuggy reservoirs;similarity criterion;visual physical model;attic oil;bottom water drive;water plugging
IEEE Terms: Visualization;Analytical models;Technological innovation;Oils;Production;Drives;Reservoirs

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: As the process of mental model matching evaluation is highly subjective and difficult to quantify and compare, this paper adopts the eye tracking method to optimize it and compares the actual gaze order of the user when operating the interface with the ideal gaze order in the “representation model.” The eye-movement evaluation metrics of “mental model initial variance,” “mental model reconstruction,” and “mental model operational resistance” are proposed in this paper, and their effects are validated. Taking the electronic reconnaissance task interface as an example, the evaluation object indicates that the above indexes can effectively distinguish the interfaces with different mental model matching degrees. Moreover, it can be combined with user interview data to locate the specific locations and causes of a mental model mismatch in the interface, which can help provide reliable data support for interface evaluation and assist in interface optimization design.

Abstract: On the basis of the existing AFM system, in view of its shortcomings such as the randomness of taking points in indentation test and the lack of intuitiveness of the results, it was improved to complete the operation in the selected area and extract the force-distance curve. The method of singular value decomposition and wavelet transform is used to denoise the curve. According to the curve characteristics, the universal model between force and distance is obtained by fitting with the least square method, from which the adhesion index is extracted. The adhesion index obtained is converted into pixel points through the formula and printed on the corresponding grid to obtain the adhesion map. The spectral output method has a high degree of automation and is proved to have a high accuracy by single point verification.

Abstract: In order to improve the utilization efficiency of power generating capacity and reduce the comprehensive transaction costs of spot electricity market and power frequency modulation market, a power frequency modulation market clearing method based on marginal benefit evaluation of power generating capacity was proposed. By comparing the transaction costs difference of generating capacity in the spot and power frequency modulation market, this paper proposes the marginal benefit index of generating capacity to determine the use of generating capacity in different markets. On this basis, a power frequency modulation market clearing method based on marginal benefit assessment is proposed to solve the problem of efficient utilization of generating capacity in the stepwise clearing mode. Publication Title: 2022 International Conference on Mechanical, Automation and Electrical Engineering (CMAEE)
Abstract: Under the lighting conditions of artificial light sources, point lighting causes the image to receive uneven light, leading to the characteristics of color distortion and poor dehazing enhancement effect when the existing dark channel dehazing algorithm is used for dehazing enhancement of haze images. Aiming to solve the above problems, this paper proposes a dark channel defogging enhancement algorithm for haze image in complex environment. First, by calculating the intensity histogram of the initial image, the corresponding mean, median and maximum value are obtained, and a novel brightness factor is constructed accordingly. Then, the over-bright areas in the image are extracted through the brightness factor and processed by down-value. Finally, the down-value image is used to estimate the atmospheric light value to enhance the accuracy of the atmospheric light value, so as to solve the problems of color distortion and poor dehazing effect. The experimental results show that the proposed algorithm has good applicability to dust fog images under non-uniform illumination. Compared with other advanced algorithms, the no-reference evaluation index ranks high, and the qualitative results are more realistic and natural.
Funding Information: International Science and Technology Cooperation Project(grant numbers:2021-2-GH004);
Author Keywords: dark channel dehazing;intensity histogram;brightness factor

Document Title: The algorithm of array antenna multi-beam targeting multiple GEO satellites simultaneously
Authors: B. Liu; X. Dou; T. Zhou
Author Affiliations: Hebei Key Laboratory of Electromagnetic Spectrum Cognition and Control, Shijiazhuang, China; Hebei Key Laboratory of Electromagnetic Spectrum Cognition and Control, Shijiazhuang, China; The 54th Research Institute of CETC, Shijiazhuang, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: In order to simultaneously communicate with multiple geostationary (GEO) satellites at a high rate over a maximum range and save costs, array antennas are often not designed with two-dimensional beam scanning capability, but can only perform one-dimensional beam scanning in a limited Angle range under extremely narrow beam conditions. Under these conditions, it is very difficult to achieve multi-beam targeting of GEO satellites at the same time. In this paper, an algorithm is proposed to simultaneously target multiple GEO satellites with multi-beam arrays in an antenna architecture capable of array rotation. The algorithm can calculate the array normal orientation, array rotation Angle, and the precise beam Angle aimed at multiple GEO's according to the position of the carrier with different attitude and the GEO's position. The feasibility of this method is verified by simulation, and a comprehensive scheme is provided when designing array antenna aiming at multiple GEO simultaneously.
Author Keywords: narrow beam;normal orientation;rotation Angle;beam Angle

Authors: F. Yin; J. Dong; T. Jiang; B. Zhong; W. Zhang; Y. Liang
Author Affiliations: Hunan Normal University, Changsha, China; Hunan Normal University, Changsha, China; Hunan Normal University, Changsha, China; Hunan Normal University, Changsha, China; Hunan Normal University, Changsha, China; Hunan Normal University, Changsha, China
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: A dual-band antenna with small size is proposed in this communication. The proposed antenna consists of half a palm- shape-edge radiating arm, two rows of metallized vias and a pair of rhombus patches. Based on mirror image theory, the induced current on the electric wall in the antenna system can be equivalent to the current in the symmetric position of the radiation arm. The half-mode (HM) Vivaldi structure can effectively reduce the antenna size. Rhombus patches are introduced to enhance the radiation performance of the dielectric notch radiator. The dual- band operation of the antenna is obtained by loading with dumbbell defect-ground-structure (DB-DGS) resonators under the microstrip line. Rogers RO 4003 is used as the dielectric substrate for this antenna, and the entire size is only 20 × 36mm2. For the simulation results, the operating frequencies of the antenna are 7.03GHz to 10.83GHz and 22.95GHz to 29.89GHz respectively. The proposed antenna achieves the gains of 4.5 dB and 8 dB at low frequency and high frequency, respectively. The overall performance of the antenna is good.
Author Keywords: dual-band;Half-mode (HM) Vivaldi;miniaturization;dumbbell defect-ground-structure (DB-DGS)
IEEE Terms: Antenna theory;Simulation;Vivaldi antennas;Dual band;Microstrip antennas;Directive antennas;Dielectric resonator antennas

Firstly, the relationship between shipping demand and economic development is analyzed according to the actual situation. In order to achieve online modeling optimization and improve the performance of wind power prediction, it is urgent to study efficient and practical online modeling optimization methods. Therefore, this paper uses the characteristics of meteorological data and similar scenarios to establish a knowledge transfer model for wind power forecasting, and proposes a deep learning modeling method and a clustering method for similar scenarios that are suitable for short-term wind power forecasting, and has been verified with the data of eight wind farms. Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: To guarantee the quality of services (QoS) for multi-services in smart grid, this paper presents an uplink radio resource scheduling mechanism based on 5G communication system. The QoS requirements of different services are analyzed, based on which the uplink resource scheduling optimization problem is formulated to maximise service transmission satisfaction. The grant-free transmission mechanism for ultra-reliable low-latency communication (uRLLC) is introduced to ensure the performance requirements for delay-sensitive services. Moreover, a priority-based resource scheduling algorithm considering both throughput and delay for other services is proposed to meet the service requirements. The simulation results show that the proposed algorithm can reduce the uplink transmission delay of delay-sensitive services by 54% and improve the service transmission satisfaction by 19% compared with the traditional algorithm, which can effectively guarantee the service quality of the smart grid system.

Abstract: With the connection of Distributed Generations (DG) in distribution network, intelligent distributed feeder automation (IDFA) faces challenges of more sophisticated fault handling procedures and tighter deadlines. In this work, this paper proposes an intelligent distributed feeder automation strategy for distribution network with DG based on 5G, with the capability of real-time topology automatic identification, and taking into account the technical benefits of low latency of 5G. The new essential topology information required for IDFA, named as fault-affected ports, is proposed for rapid power recovery. Traditional investment decision-making methods can no longer meet the practical needs. This paper constructs the quantitative analysis technique and model of investment decision of emerging industry based on dynamic programming method. This paper firstly introduces the investment demand of emerging industries, then analyzes the basic principle of dynamic programming method, constructs the investment decision analysis technology and model of emerging industries based on dynamic programming method, and takes a county power generation enterprise as an example to study the application strategy and application effect of this method, in order to provide reference for power generation enterprises to build a scientific investment decision method.

Publication Title: 2022 International Conference on Mechanical, Automation and Electrical Engineering (CMAEE)
Abstract: In this paper, a modular multilevel converter (MMC) is proposed based four-port power electronic transformer (PET). Medium-voltage AC(MV AC) and medium-voltage DC(MVDC) ports provided by MMC, by using a symmetric submodule of the upper and lower bridge arms of each phase for low-voltage ports, the PET minimizes the number of switching devices and transformers, the cost is 56.8% lower than the existing traditional PET. This paper primarily examines the characteristics of the PET structure, as well as the control approach. A simulation experiment demonstrates the usefulness of the PET, and a cost comparison analysis shows that the PET has good economic benefits.

Document Title: An error neighborhood-based detection mechanism to improve the performance of anomaly detection in industrial control systems
Authors: W. Shen; G. Yang
Author Affiliations: Ningbo Artificial Intelligence Institute, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Zhejiang, China; Ningbo Artificial Intelligence Institute, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Zhejiang, China
Publication Title: 2022 International Conference on Mechanical, Automation and Electrical Engineering (CMAEE)
Abstract: Anomaly detection for devices (e.g, sensors and actuators) plays a crucial role in Industrial Control Systems (ICS) for security protection. The typical framework of deep learning-based anomaly detection includes a model to predict or reconstruct the state of devices and a detection mechanism to determine anomalies. The majority of anomaly detection methods use a fixed threshold detection mechanism to detect anomalous points. However, the anomalies caused by cyberattacks in ICSs are usually continuous anomaly segments. In this paper, we propose a novel detection mechanism to detect continuous anomaly segments. Its core idea is to determine the start and end times of anomalies based on the continuity characteristics of anomalies and the dynamics of error. We conducted experiments on the two real-world datasets for performance evaluation using five baselines. The F1 score increased by 3.8% on average in the SWAT dataset and increased by 15.6% in the WADI dataset. The results show a significant improvement in the performance of baselines using an error neighborhood-based continuity detection mechanism in a real-time manner.
Author Keywords: industrial control system;anomaly detection;detection mechanism;unsupervised learning
IEEE Terms: Integrated circuits;Performance evaluation;Mechanical sensors;Industrial control;Sensor phenomena and characterization;Predictive models;Real-time systems

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: In view of the serious impact of the marine oil spill accident on the marine environment and the relatively lagging emergency response to the accident after the accident. The diffusion of oil spill after an oil spill accident is simulated numerically and in three dimensions using the theory of cellular automata. Initialization of offshore oil spill distribution with initial model input parameters takes into account the airflow factor based on the oil spill spreading toward the surrounding area due to its own gravity at sea. Considering evaporation, attachment, emulsification, dissolution and, shoreline attachment during oil spill dispersion, the oil spill quality of each grid is calculated in discrete time series, and the oil spill quality of different grids is color stratified by edge detection. Finally, the algorithm is integrated into the navigation simulator to simulate the process of oil spill diffusion from the initial state to the influence of the above factors. By continuously observing the simulation results, the algorithm can better simulate the whole process of oil spill diffusion under the influence of the above factors, and integrate it into the navigation simulator to simulate the whole process of oil spill accident occurrence, oil spill dispersion, and emergency treatment. It can realize the Omnidirectional simulation training for oil spill emergency handling agencies and personnel.
Author Keywords: oil spill;Cellular Automata;navigation simulator;three-dimensional scene
IEEE Terms: Solid modeling;Visualization;Three-dimensional displays;Navigation;Oils;Time series analysis;Automata

Document Title: Light Deep Face Recognition based on Knowledge Distillation and Adversarial Training
Authors: J. Liu; X. Li
Author Affiliations: School of Computer Science, Zhongyuan University of Technology, Zhengzhou, China; School of Computer Science, Zhongyuan University of Technology, Zhengzhou, China
Publication Title: 2022 International Conference on Mechanical, Automation and Electrical Engineering (CMAEE)
Abstract: Aiming at the difficulty of deploying deep learning model caused by limited processing capacity and small memory of terminal video acquisition equipment, a deep neural network lightweight algorithm based on knowledge distillation and adversarial training is proposed to transfer knowledge with classification probability and middle-layer feature. The principle of the algorithm is to improve the traditional knowledge distillation loss and add the indicator function, so that the student network only learns the correct classification results given by the teacher network. The discriminator of adversarial learning strategy is introduced to identify the difference between student network and teacher network in middle layer. In the latter part of the training, the teacher network and the student network learn from each other and update each other alternately, so that the student network can explore its own optimal solution space, and further improve the generalization ability of the student network, so that it can be applied to other detection or recognition tasks. The experimental results show that the small size student network obtained by knowledge distillation has less parameter, and the recognition accuracy decreases only about 1.5%.
Author Keywords: knowledge distillation;adversarial learning;mutual learning;model compression;deep face recognition

Abstract: In September 2020, China proposed to achieve the goal of “double carbon”, that is, carbon emissions strive to reach the peak by 2030 and achieve carbon neutrality by 2060, the development of healthy, efficient and low-carbon logistics has become an inevitable trend for the sustainable development of China’s logistics industry. In this context, various manufacturing enterprises are paying more and more attention to the rational use of social and natural resources, and are planning to establish recycling centres to develop reverse logistics, improve their own resource utilisation, reduce costs and increase efficiency, and promote the development of green industries. This paper uses the mileage saving method to establish a 0-1 planning model for the least cost saving path on the premise of minimum path distance. Taking A shipyard as an example, we analyse the current situation of reverse logistics in its recycling centre and identify its problems, and the results show that reasonable path planning can effectively reduce transportation costs.

Author Affiliations: State Grid Chongqing Electric Power Company, Chongqing Electric Power Research Institute, Chongqing; State Grid Chongqing Electric Power Company, Chongqing Electric Power Research Institute, Chongqing; State Grid Chongqing Electric Power Company, Chongqing Electric Power Research Institute, Chongqing; State Grid Chongqing Electric Power Company Bishan Electric Power Company, Chongqing
Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: The domestic UHVDC transmission lines are developing rapidly, among which the converter transformer and its bushing accessories are typical electrical equipment. This paper focuses on theoretical modeling and experimental verification analysis of mechanical vibration characteristics of key electrical equipment under 6300A high current and 800kV high voltage. The band-pass filter is used to analyze the dynamic signal time series, which shows that the band-pass filter limits the frequency to 0~2000Hz, and the passable frequency is 2000~5000Hz. After Fourier decomposition, it is found that the peak value of signal amplitude appears near 1000Hz and 2000Hz. Furthermore, the analysis of the electromagnetic force of the short circuit of the converter transformer winding and its bushing accessory structure and the on-site accident shows that the maximum short circuit current occurs at 0.01s, and SVM identification accuracy is 91.3%. The research in this paper has guiding significance for the fault diagnosis of converter transformer and its bushing accessories based on the vibration signals for typical power equipment.
Author Keywords: Converter transformer;Mechanical vibration characteristics;Field circuit coupling;Resonance characteristics;Band pass filter;Short circuit electromagnetic force

Document Title: Evaluation of Automobile Design Scheme Based on Improved Grey Situation Decision Method
Authors: Y. Jia; Q. Tian; D. Hu
Author Affiliations: Tianjin Key Laboratory for Advanced Signal Processing, Civil Aviation University of China, Tianjin, China; Tianjin Key Laboratory for Advanced Signal Processing, Civil Aviation University of China, Tianjin, China; Suzhou Weizhong Data Technology Co., Ltd, Suzhou, China
Publication Title: 2022 International Conference on Mechanical, Automation and Electrical Engineering (CMAEE)
Abstract: Evaluation of design scheme for new types of cars refers to multiple attribute comprehensive evaluation. In this paper, an improved grey-situation decision-making method is proposed. The advantage of our method lies in both the preference of decision maker and the objectiveness implicated in the data are incorporated. Firstly, AHP is exploited to build hierarchy and assign subjective weights to each attribute. This can incorporate the decision maker's successful experiences into comprehensive evaluation in a fine-grained way. Secondly, the Grading system is used to enhance the contribution of significant attributes with almost equal value. On the contrary, traditional gray-situation method usually overlooks the contribution of almost equal attributes, even if these attributes are greatly weighted at previous step. Finally, the effectiveness of the method is validated through a real-world automotive design scheme. Our method can be easily generalized and applied to wider domains.
Author Keywords: grey-situation decision-making method;analytic hierarchy process;automotive design

Authors: C. Deng

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: The pressurizer operation mode poses a risk of damage to the spray valve of the pressurizer in pressurized water reactor nuclear power unit, which is a pneumatic control valve with a mechanical limit gear. In this research, we offer a logic limit approach with the DCS and a predictive analysis method for control valve opening based on the pipeline heat transfer principle and Flowmaster simulation, which is utilized to determine the required opening of the spray valve. The logic limiting scheme minimizes the technical risk, equipment danger, and radiation risk by preventing the possibility of mechanical limit gear damage and preventing maintenance personnel from accessing the reactor plant to access the spray valve during unit power operation.

Document Title: A machine learning model for parameter correlation analysis and structural deformation prediction
Authors: C. Chen; Z. Wang; P. Shi; P. Jia
Author Affiliations: School of Rail Transportation Soochow University, Suzhou, China; Suzhou Rail Transit Group Co., Ltd.,, Suzhou, China; School of Rail Transportation Soochow University, Suzhou, China; School of Rail Transportation Soochow University, Suzhou, China
Publication Title: 2022 International Conference on Mechanical, Automation and Electrical Engineering (CMAEE)
Abstract: Tunnelling through steel reinforced concrete piles using shield machine involves high risk and creates an engineering challenge. Protecting safety of the superstructure is beneficial for the success of the project. The deformation of the superstructure is a complicated process and is affected by a variety of parameters. This paper proposes a novel model, MK-LSTM, combining maximal information coefficient (MIC), K-median and long short-term memory (LSTM) network to analyze the correlation between the various parameters and to predict of the superstructure deformation during shield driving. The MIC-K-median algorithm is developed to analyze the correlation between the different input parameters and structural deformation, then to preprocess the input parameters based on their correlation coefficients. The prediction accuracy and efficiency using different dimensions of input parameters are analyzed through the LSTM model and the optimal input parameter dimensions are selected. The conclusions show that: 1) the MK-LSTM algorithm can reduce the computational complexity and the impact of noise in raw data; 2) the prediction accuracy of the proposed MK-LSTM model is better than baseline models and some parameters with low correlation (e.g., chamber earth pressure) do not significantly improve the prediction effect. The sorting index can provide reference for construction.
Funding Information: National Science Foundation of China(grant numbers:51778386);
Author Keywords: Machine learning;Parameter dimension;Shield machine;Steel reinforced concrete pile;Deformation

Publication Title: 2022 4th International Academic Exchange Conference on Science and Technology Innovation (IAECST)
Abstract: The sleep stage classification is the most important step in the sleep research. It does not only provide a reference for evaluating the sleep quality clinically, but it also uses to diagnose the sleep disorders. Various methods have been developed for performing the sleep stage classification based on the electrocardiograms (ECGs). However, the computational complexity of these existing methods is very large. Also, the accuracy is still very low. To address this issue, this paper employs a kernel extreme learning machine (KELM) with the particle swarm optimization (PSO) for performing the sleep stage classification using the heart rate variability (HRV) as the features. The results show that the classification accuracies yielded by our proposed method for the three sleep stage classification and the four sleep stage classification are 80.18% and 76.02%, respectively. Obviously, our proposed method is superior to the existing methods.
Funding Information: Nature; Innovation and Technology Commission;
Author Keywords: Heart rate variability;particle swarm optimization;kernel extreme learning machine;sleep stage classification
